Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día centro de su ferretería, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar otras actividades. 
Con el tiempo, espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en la ferretería principal de su barrio.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Elsa con MFP, ella ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados incrementará la cantidad de productos que tiene en ferretería, ya que desea ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa, who is 46 years old, is a very determined and happy woman who lives in her own house with her son Marco, who is 10, and what she wants most is to give him a good education. Her hardware store is one of the busiest in the city. Her great charisma and patience in assisting her customers have made her a well-loved saleswoman. She gets up very early to open her business since she knows demand is highest in the mornings. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers. She has been doing this for 10 years and thinks the most difficult part is having to stay in the store all day, without being able to leave and do other things. With time, she hopes her business grows and becomes the main hardware store in her neighborhood. This is Elsa's ninth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments and expects to be punctual this time, too. She is very active in her communal bank and is well-loved by the other members. With the three thousand soles she has requested, she will increase the number of hardware products she has, since she wishes to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Higinia

texts.es:
Higinia, D. 50 años, es una vecina muy admirada debido al gran amor que les demuestra a sus hijos. Ellos son; Pedro D. 18 y Máxima D. 14, con quienes vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una buena educación para que sean profesionales útiles a la sociedad.

La vida le ha enseñado a Higinia que sólo trabajando duro podrá salir adelante, es por eso que a lo largo D. su vida a incursionado en varios trabajos, poniendo todo su esfuerzo en cada uno D. ellos, actualmente se encuentra en la elaboración y venta D. salteñas (empanadas), la cuales luego distribuye en los distintos mercados D. la ciudad.
Lo que más le gusta D. su negocio es que en el momento que tiene hambre se pueD. comer una D. sus deliciosas salteñas para calmar su apetito, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es vigilar que sus salteñas tengan el cocido perfecto, ya que ella también es dueña del horno donD. los produce. 
Para más adelante, espera que sus salteñas se hagan muy conocidas y les pueda poner una marca, para que así sus clientes puedan distinguirlas, sabe que es un trabajo largo pero está dispuesta a afrontarlo.

Este es el sexto préstamo D. Higinia con MFP y está dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco para poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo; en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los mil ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para la elaboración D. sus salteñas, así tendrá mayor cantidad para vender.
texts.en:
Higinia, 50, is much admired by her neighbors due to the great amount of love she shows her children. Her children are Pedro, 18, and Máxima, 14. She lives with them in the house that she inherited from her parents. What she wishes for most is to give them a good education so that they can be useful professionals in society. Life has taught Higinia that just by working hard she can get ahead. That is why she has worked various jobs throughout her life. She put all of her effort into each one of them. She currently makes and sells “salteñas” (empanadas or meat pastries). She later distributes them to different markets in the city. What she likes most about her business is that when she is hungry she can eat one of her delicious salteños to curb her appetite. She has been in this business for six years. The most difficult part is watching to make sure that the salteñas are cooked perfectly. She also owns the oven where she makes them. Later on, she hopes that her salteñas become well known and that she can brand them. That way her customers will be able to recognize them. She knows it will take a long time, but she is prepared to do it. This is Higinia’s sixth loan with MFP. She is prepared to save a little everyday to be able to make her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. She will use the 1,800 PEN she is requesting to buy more ingredients to make her salteñas. That way she will have a larger quantity to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more ingredients to make her salteñas

loans.name: Ildefonsa

texts.es:
Ildefonsa, de 57 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 hijos; Víctor de 24 y Candy de 13, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La gran sazón que posee ha hecho que su restaurante sea uno de los más concurridos del barrio “Las Flores” de la ciudad de Juliaca. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, quienes conocedores del delicioso sabor de sus comidas no dudan en asistir para disfrutar de un apetecible menú familiar. Le está yendo tan bien que ha decidido vender por la noche comida rápida en una carretilla, la cual le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y ver como sus comensales disfrutan de su comida, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que los más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes ella sola, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para contratar a una persona que le ayude. 
Con el tiempo, espera mejorar su restaurante y brindarles un servicio más completo a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Ildefonsa con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas mesas, sillas y utensilios de cocina, para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Ildefonsa, 57 years old, is the mother of a loving family. She lives in her home with her two children, Victor (24) and Candy (13) – the motivation for all that she does. Her great seasoning is the reason her restaurant is one the most frequented in the Las Flores neighborhood of Juliaca. Her customers are mostly her neighbors, who are familiar with the delicious taste of her food, and come to enjoy a familiar meal. It’s going so well because she has decided to sell fast food from a cart at night. This has helped her improve her earnings. On the other hand, what she likes most about her job is cooking and seeing how her customers enjoy her food. She has been doing this for 35 years and finds that attending to all of her customers by herself is the most difficult part. She doesn’t have the money right now to hire someone to help her. In time, she would like to improve her restaurant and provide more complete service to her customers. This is Ildefonsa’s sixth loan with MFP and she feels obliged to pay on time since she doesn’t want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is much loved. With the three thousand soles she is asking for, she will buy new tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils to improve the environment of her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils for her restaurant

loans.name: Isaac

texts.es:
Isaac, de 25 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador. Vive en su casa propia junto a su madre, Luz de 52 años, a quien desea dar una vejez tranquila.

A su corta edad es el encargado de administrar los dos negocios que su madre comenzó hace algunos años atrás. Con mucho trabajo a logrado sacar adelante la bodega y el restaurante que le han dado los ingresos necesarios a su familia para vivir, es por eso que pone todo su empeño en brindarles a sus clientes la mejor de las atenciones, ya que sabe que de ellos depende el progreso de sus negocios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que le permite realizar sus estudios universitarios al mismo tiempo que cumple con sus negocios, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse muy temprano para limpiar y arreglar el restaurante. 
Para más adelante, espera que sus negocios sigan creciendo y le puedan brindar mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Isaac con MFP y tiene el firme compromiso de no fallar en sus pagos y de ser responsable con el resto de las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Isaac, 25 years old, is a very cheerful and hard working young man. He lives in his own house next to his mother, Luz, who is 52 years old and wishes to have a tranquil life as she grows old. At his young age, Isaac is in charge of running the businesses that his mother began years ago. Through a lot of hard work, he has been able to get ahead with his bodega and restaurant which earn the money necessary to live. For this reason, he puts all of his effort towards offering his customers the best service possible, especially since he knows that they depend on the progress of his businesses. What he likes best about his work is that it allows him to complete his university classes at the same time as running his businesses. He has been doing this for seven years and considers the most difficult thing to be having to get up very early to clean and arrange the restaurant. For the future, he hopes that his businesses continue growing and provide him with a higher income. This is his first loan with MFP and has a firm commitment to not default on his payments and to be responsible with the rest of his community bank's partners. With the 1,000 Nuevos Soles he is requesting, he will buy more products to incorporate into his grocery store's inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of Merchandise

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Née en 1964 à Womey dans la commune d'Abomey-Calavi, K. Antoinette est mariée à AZOGBAKIN Simon. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Certains enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 8 ans à Womey. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. N'ayant jamais fréqenté l'école, Antoinette a commencé très tôt la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce et de poissons frits) à Cocotomey dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Antoinette mène cette activité depuis 22 ans environs et s'approvisonne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. L'activité de Antoinette lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour faire face à ses différents besoins. Mais actuelement, Antoinette n'arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients qui ne cessent d'augmenter. C'est pour cette raison que Antoinette sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire ses clients. Antoinette a entre temps bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle avait bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Born in 1964 in Womey, in the community of Abomey-Calavi, Ms. K. Antoinette is married to Mr. AZOGBAKIN Simon.  The couple has five children to support. Three of the children are their own, and some of them are in school.  The family has been living  in Womey for eight years.  The couple jointly ensures that family responsibilities are met.  Never having attended school, Antoinette soon started selling food (cornmeal mash served with sauce and fried fish), in Cocotomey in Abomey Calavi. She has been in this business for about 22 years and stocks up at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Her business generates revenues that she uses to address her different needs.  But right now, she is no longer able to satisfy the entirety of her ever-growing customer base. For this reason, Antoinette is requesting a second loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and satisfying her customers. In the meanwhile, she benefited from an ALIDé loan, which she repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, oil, and sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, chili peppers)

loans.name: Women Of Peace Group

texts.en: Oretha N. is the leader of group of five borrowers called Women of Peace. She is unmarried with two children, a daughter age 21 and a son age 14. Oretha's daughter is a high school senior and her son is in the third grade. Oretha herself is a high school graduate. Oretha does not get financial support for her children from their father. She also cares for her mother. Oretha's business is the sale of foodstuffs such as flour, sugar, butter, beans and rice. She sells from a table at the Red Light Market, Liberia's largest market on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. Before she sold foodstuffs, Oretha specialized in selling fresh fish, but changed her product line because the profit from selling fish was too small. Oretha plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy flour and sugar for resale. She hopes her business will improve and that one day, she'll be able to open a proper storefront at the Red Light Market. Oretha credits her success in business so far to being a good saleswoman who talks to her customers well. Oretha wants to help her children continue their education. Her daughter is set on going to the University of Liberia and her son says he wants to grow up to be a doctor. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is the one holding the sign. Despite the group's name -- Women of Peace -- there is one male member, Joseph S.. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JUAN CARLOS HUAÑARRAYA R. TIENE 36 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA CON LA SRA. MARIBEL APAZA QUISPE, TIENEN 2 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ES LA PRODUCCION DE LECHE CON ENTREGAS DIARIAS A UNA INTERMEDIARIA, QUIEN SE ENCARGA DE LA COMERCIALIZACION.

EL SEÑOR JUAN CARLOS HUAÑARRAYA, TIENE UNA VIVIENDA MODESTA VIVE EN LA ZONA SUR DE COCHABAMBA, SON PERSONAS MUY DEDICADAS A SU TRABAJO CONOCEN MUCHO SOBRE EL MANEJO DE SU GANADO LECHERO.

EL PRESENTE CREDITO QUE SOLICITA EL CLIENTE ES PARA COMPRA DE ALIMENTO EN GENERAL PARA ASEGURAR LA PRODUCCION DE LECHE, CON EL CUAL TENDRAN ASEGURADAS UNA MEJOR CONDICION DE VIDA PARA DE SU FAMILIA A PARTIR DEL PRESENTE AÑO.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos Huanarraya R. is 36 years old. He is married to Maribel Apaza Quispe, and they have 2 school-aged children. His main activity is milk production; he makes daily deliveries to a broker who handles the marketing. Juan Carlos Huanarraya has a modest home in the southern part of Cochabamba. They are people who are very dedicated to their work and who know a lot about handling their dairy cows. The loan requested is to be used to buy cattle food to ensure the production of milk, so that they can be assured of having better living conditions for their family in the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food for milk cows

loans.name: God's Favor Children Group

texts.en: Joseph S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Favor Children. He is 35 years old and married with three children, aged 3 to 12 years old. His children's educational levels range from kindergarten to first grade. Joseph himself is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty. Joseph and his family live in the Go-Buy-Chop Community and he works at the Red Light Market, Liberia's largest market on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. Joseph’s business is the sale of cosmetics. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table at the Red Light Market. He has been running this business for more than 20 years and hopes to become an importer of cosmetics in the near future. Joseph started by selling for a Nigerian lady. Whenever he sold her goods, she would always share the profits. After saving money, he decided to start his own business. He sells at an ideal location in order to attract customers to buy from him. Joseph plans to use this loan to purchase more body cream, powder, soap, etc., for resale. He dreams of educating his children and his wife, and hopes for a good future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Joseph is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP, a Kiva partner, seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more body cream, powder, soap, etc., for resale

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: T. Déborah est née en 1981 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ZOUMEVO Damien, Déborah est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge. La famille vit au quartier Logbozounkpa dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis 5 ans. Les charges de la famille sont assurées par le couple. Déborah a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Déborah mène comme activité le vente de tissus et des produits de beauté, par le système de distribution. Déborah vend également des divers (sucre, insecticide, etc.). C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi à Lomé au Togo (Etat voisin du Bénin), que Déborah se ravitaille. Déborah n'a jamais bénéficié d'un prêt à ALIDé. Déborah sollicite ce premier prêt en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande des clients.
texts.en:
T. Déborah was born in 1981 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to ZOUMEVO Damien, Déborah is the mother of one child who is enrolled in school. The couple is also raising another child. The family has been living in Logbozounkpa district in the township of Abomey Calavi for 5 years. Family expenses are shared by the couple.

Déborah did not go to school for very long. To cover her different expenses, Déborah sells cloth and cosmetics through the distribution system. She also sells various other things (sugar, insecticide, etc. ) She buys her goods at Dantokpa, international market of Benin, and also in Lomé, Togo (a country that borders Bénin). Déborah has never before received a loan from ALIDé. She is requesting this first loan with a view to bolstering her business and better satisfying the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 10 lengths of cloth

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA FLORENTINA Q. C. TIENE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES UNA MUJER QUE ENVIUDO MUY JOVEN, SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ECONOMIA ES LA PRODUCCION DE LECHE A MUY POCA ESCALA, REALIZA ENTREGAS A DIARIAS A UNA INTERMEDIARIA PARA SU COMERCIALIZACION

LA SEÑORA FLORENTINA Q. C. TIENE UNA VIVIENDA MODESTA VIVE EN LA ZONA SUR DE COCHABAMBA, ES UNA PERSONA MUY DEDICADA A SU TRABAJO CONOCE MUCHO SOBRE EL MANEJO DE SU GANADO LECHERO.

EL PRESENTE CREDITO QUE SOLICITA EL CLIENTE ES PARA COMPRA DE ALIMENTO EN GENERAL PARA ASEGURAR LA PRODUCCION LECHERA. ASI MEJORAR LA CANTIDAD Y CALIDAD DE LECHE, CON LO CUAL TENDRAN ASEGURADA SU MANUTENCION A PARTIR DEL PRESENTE AÑO.
texts.en:
Florentina Q. C. is 63 years old. She was widowed when she was very young. Her main economic activity is the production of milk on a small scale. She makes daily deliveries to a broker who handles the marketing. Florentina Q. C. has a modest home in the southern part of Cochabamba. She is a person who is very dedicated to her work and who knows a lot about handling dairy cows. The loan that she requests will be used to buy food for the cows to ensure the production of milk. In this way she can increase the quantity and quality of the milk, and will be assured of covering her living expenses over the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food for milk cows

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR RICHARD S. C. TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADO CON SRA. MARIA DEL CARMEN ALMANZA OVANDO, ACTUALMENTE NO CUENTAN CON HIJOS, SU PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD ES LA PRODUCCION Y COMERCIALIZACION DE YESO PARA LA CONSTRUCCION CIVIL.

EL SEÑOR RICHARD S., ACTUALMENTE VIVE EN CASA DE SUS SEÑORES PADRES UBICADO EN LA ZONA OESTE A 23 KM DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA, SON PERSONAS JOVENES EN ETAPA DE CONSOLIDACION DE SU MATRIMONIO ASI COMO DE SU ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA.

EL PRESENTE CREDITO ES UNA CONTRAPARTE PARA LA ADQUISICION DE UNA CAMIONETA QUE LE SERVIRA PARA LA DISTRIBUCION DE SU PRODUCTO, CON LO CUAL MEJORARAN SUS INGRESOS Y SU CONDICION DE VIDA Y EN FUTURO INDEPENDIZARSE DE LA VIVIENDA DE SUS SEÑORES PADRES.
texts.en:
Richard S. C. is 22 years old. He is married to Maria del Carmen Almanza Ovando. At the present they have no children; their main economic activity is the production and sale of plaster for construction. Richard S. currently lives in his parents' home, located in the Eastern zone, 23 km from the city of Cochabamba. They are young people in the stage of building their marriage as well as their economic activities. The current loan will be used to acquire a vehicle that will be used to distribute their products. With this vehicle they will increase their income and improve their living conditions and, in the future, become independent from the home of his parents.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for the distribution of plaster

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, de 28 años, es un hombre muy alegre y luchador, vive en la casa de su hermana y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Sus días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar. Él es muy atento con sus clientes y siempre está pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de la ciudad, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. 
Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Juan con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Juan, 28 years old, is a happy and hard working man who lives with his sister and wishes most to stand out.

His work days start very early in the morning, when he leaves with his motocar to look for pasengers. He is very attentive with his customers and always is outstanding with them. He hopes to give them the best service so when they see him again, they will take his motocar. What he like most of is job is to drive in the streets of the city so they distract him a lot from doing it. He has been doing this acitivity for 8 years and considers the most dificult part of his job working late into the night. With time he hopes he can have enough money to buy a new motocar.

This is the fifth loan Juan has had from MFP and he feels responsible to pay it on time as he doesn't want to cause any trouble with the other communal bank members where he is well liked by the rest of his female associates. With the requested 500 nuevos soles, he will buy new tires for motocar as the ones now are actually worn out from the arduos job.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, la señora Reyna C. se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la elaboración de refrescos para venderlos en el mercado todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.
Ella es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y por ello ha sabido llevar a cabo su actividad de venta de refrescos porque quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la materia prima para hacer los refrescos de diferentes sabores y con la más alta calidad posible y de igual manera comprará bebidas gaseosas para ofrecerlas en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega, Señora Reyna C. enjoys a reputation as a very hardworking person. She makes drinks to sell in the market every day starting in the early hours of the morning. As she is very eager to get on in life, she started her soft drinks business because she wanted to improve her living conditions. Reyna is asking for a loan to buy ingredients with which to make high-quality drinks of different flavours. She also plans to buy sodas to sell at her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for drinks and to buy sodas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 33 años, es una madre muy amorosa y cariñosa. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mariano, de 45 años, y a sus 2 hijos: Yesenia de 14 y Rolando de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Hace un año, con los ahorros que logró reunir de su restaurante pudo comprar un auto bus, el cual puso a trabar inmediatamente como un medio de transporte local. Aunque éste le genera muy buenos ingresos, Marcelina sabe que no puede dejar de lado el restaurante que tanto le ha ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida, es por eso que todavía sigue satisfaciendo a sus clientes con los deliciosos menús que prepara.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que atender a sus clientes, ya que casi siempre su restaurante está lleno. 
Para más adelante, espera implementar mejor su restaurante, ya que desea brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Marcelina con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con todas sus cuotas a tiempo si no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en el cual es muy querida por la alegría que demuestra. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingrediente para elaborar sus sabrosos almuerzos.
texts.en:
33-year old Marcelina is a loving and affectionate mother. She lives in her own home with her 45-year old husband Mariano and their two children, Yesenia (14 years) and Rolando (3 years). The children are the reason for all their hard work. A year ago, with the savings Marcelina had managed to accumulate from her restaurant, she was able to buy a bus which she put to work immediately as local transport. Although the bus generates a good income, Marcelina knows that she can't set aside the restaurant which has also helped her improve her quality of life. So she still continues to please her customers with the delicious food she prepares. What she most enjoys about her work is the cooking which she does with much care. She’s been doing this work for six years. The most difficult part is finding the time to serve her customers as the restaurant is almost always full. In the future she hopes to better equip the restaurant as she wants to provide her customers with better service. This is Marcelina’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows that she has to make all her repayments on time if she doesn’t want to cause problems for the members of the community bank. She is well-like there for her happy approach to life. With the S/. 1500 she plans to buy more ingredients for the tasty lunches she cooks.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she cooks

loans.name: Rolande

texts.fr: Née le 13 Mai 1977 à Hêvié dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, M. Rolande vit depuis 13 ans à Akossavié à Abomey Calavi. Mariée à HESSOU Cyrille, un peintre, Rolande est mère d'un enfant. Mais Rolande a deux autres enfants à charge. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Rolande n'a pas fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture, une activité qu'elle mène passionnément depuis 8 ans environs et qui lui procure des revenus. Parallèlement à cette activité, Rolande vend de l'huile près de son atelier situé dans son quartier. Rolande s'approvisionne à Cococodji dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Rolande a bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Rolande sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité de vente d'huile.
texts.en:
Born on May 13, 1977 in Hêvié in the township of Abomey Calavi, M. Rolande has been living for 13 years in Akossavié in Abomey Calavi. Married to HESSOU Cyrille, a painter, Rolande is the mother of one child, but she is also raising two other children. The family is supported by both of the spouses.

Rolande did not attend school, but she learned sewing; she has been working enthusiastically at tailoring for 8 years now and her work is bringing in some income. At the same time, Rolande has been selling oil near her workshop which is situated in her neighborhood. She stocks up at Cococodji in the township of Abomey Calavi.

Rolande has already received one loan from ALIDé and reimbursed it correctly. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé to use to expand her little business selling oil.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 5 jerrycans of oil for resale

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
A sus 44 años de edad, la señora Blanca M.  se dedica a elaborar deliciosos alimentos para venderlos desde su propio establecimiento en el mercado central de Chinandega donde muy profesionalmente elabora todo tipo de alimentos con el fin único de obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar.
Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona que ha sabido llevar a cabo su trabajo y se ha apoyado de los créditos de Ceprodel para salir adelante en el negocio. Hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de aceite, papas, pollo y bebidas gaseosas para continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar por medio de los ingresos percibidos en el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca M., 44, makes delicious meals that she sells in her own establishment in Chinandega's central market. She prepares the meals very professionally in order to earn income to support her household. She has stood out for being a person who has known how to do her work. She has had help, through loans from Ceprodel, that has helped her to move her business forward. Today, she is asking for funding to buy cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and carbonated beverages to continue to bring support home through the income earned in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, potatoes, chicken and carbonated beverages.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, es socia del Bancomunal Niño Nativo, ubicado en el distrito de Acoria, en el departamento de Huancavelica, es casada y tiene un hijo de 10 años. María inició su negocio con la venta de arroz, azúcar, leche y otros productos de primera necesidad, le ha ido muy bien porque en Acoria no hay mercados, ahora María empezó con un nuevo negocio, ha comprado una fotocopiadora y  también vende útiles de escritorio. 
Agradece las reuniones de su bancomunal porque le han enseñado a ahorrar, su hijo también está aprendiendo y le ayuda a guardar el dinero.
El préstamo que solicita le ayudará en comprar más productos al por mayor para su negocio y también realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Niño Nativo Community Bank which is located in the district of Acoria in the department of Huancavelica. She is married and has a 10-year old son. María started in business selling rice, sugar, milk, and other daily necessities; she has done very well as there are no markets in Acoria. Next she bought a photocopier and opened a new business; she also sells office supplies. She is grateful for the meetings run by the bank as she learned how to save. Her son too is learning, and she is helping him save his money. María will use the loan to buy more products at wholesale prices for the store, and also to do some maintenance on her car.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic groceries at wholesale prices

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 31 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Miguel, de 33 años, y su hija Tiffany de 6 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es muy poco común, ella comparte su actividad de artesana de tejidos con la de esotérica, todos los días arma su carpa en una de las calles más concurridas de la ciudad para leerles las cartas a las personas que lo deseen.
Por otro lado, ella desea incrementar su producción de tejidos por lo que desea comprar en el futuro una máquina con la que pueda tejer con mayor calidad y en mayor cantidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de María con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para elaborar nuevas prendas artesanales.
texts.en:
María, 31, is a loving and hard-working mother, who lives in her own house with her husband, Miguel, 33, and her daughter Tiffany, 6; they are the motivating force behind all her efforts. She has a somewhat unusual occupation: she combines her weaving with esotericism. Every day she sets up her tent in one of the city's busiest streets to interpret cards for those who wish. On the other hand,for the future, she would like to increase her production of woven articles and wants to buy a weaving machine to produce larger amounts of better quality items. This is María's first loan with MFP. She is aware that she must repay on time and is willing to do so because she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is a well-liked and admired member. She will use the 1000 new soles to buy wool for her new crafts works.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Family Circle Group

texts.en: Musu J. is the leader of group of five borrowers called Family Circle. She is married with four children, two girls and two boys. Her oldest child is 20 and in the 10th grade, and her youngest is 10 years old and in the fifth grade. Musu herself was only able to complete school through the 9th grade because Liberia's civil war interrupted her schooling in 1990, when she and her family fled from the capital, Monrovia, to Buchanan, a city southeast along the coast. Musu cooks and sells food from a table at the Red Light Market. Red Light is Liberia's largest market and is situated on the outskirts of Monrovia. Musu serves dishes such as fufu (cassava porridge) and soup, fish, beef, rice and greens. Before she started making and selling food, Musu sold raw foodstuffs such as rice, beans and cooking oil, but she decided to start selling cooked food to improve her profits. Musu plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 29,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more ingredients with which to cook. "I cook nice food," she says. She hopes that one day she will be so successful that she's able to open up a big restaurant in its own building, one that has air conditioning and a TV. She also wants to see her children get a good education and hopes that some of them will be able to go to university some day. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Musu is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy ingredients used in cooking, such as rice, cassava flour, fish, and beef

loans.name: Noely

texts.es:
Noely, de 21 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Todas las mañanas, junto a su inseparable carretilla, vende su delicioso queso helado (helado hecho a base de leche batida). En los alrededores del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca) es donde encuentra a sus clientes, quienes conocedores del delicioso producto que vende no dudan en esperarla para saborear el delicioso postre.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su negocio es conversar con sus clientes mientras realiza sus ventas, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es caminar por las calles de la ciudad bajo el inclemente sol del medio día. 
Para el futuro, anhela instalar una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad su producto.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Noely con MFP, está muy feliz de haberlo obtenido y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para elaborar su sabroso queso helado.
texts.en:
Noely, age 21, is a very cheerful and hard-working young woman. She lives in a house which she inherited from her parents, and what she wants most is to improve her quality of life. Every morning, with the pushcart from which she is inseparable, she sells her delicious ice cream (called "queso helado" but prepared with whipped milk, not cheese). The area around the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca) is where she finds her customers. Those who know the delicious product she sells are happy to wait for her in order to enjoy this tasty treat. What Noely likes most about her business is having conversations with her customers while she carries out her sales. She has done this work for 4 years, and she thinks the hardest part is walking through the city streets under the uncomfortable midday sun. For the future, she dreams of setting up a store where she can sell her product with greater tranquility. This is Noely's second loan with MFP; she is very happy to have obtained it, and she plans to make her payments on time. In her communal bank, she is a very well-liked member because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 1000 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy more ingredients for preparing her delicious "queso helado" ice cream.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa, D. 50 años, es una madre muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa que heredó D. sus padres junto a sus 2 hijos; Norma D. 29 y Néstor D. 24 años, quienes ya tienen sus respectivas familias.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Cerro Colorado (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Juliaca). En su pequeño puesto venD. toda clase D. productos comestibles; como harina, huevos, mantequilla, aceite, etc. Es por eso que es muy concurrido, ya que sus clientes saben que siempre encontrarán lo que necesitan.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras D. venta, lleva 17 años realizando este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día cuidando su negocio, ya que siempre hay personas que esperan que tenga un descuido para llevarse algo sin pagar. 
Para más adelante, anhela tener una tienda propia donD. pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el quinto préstamo D. Santa con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal participa activamente y siempre está al tanto D. las decisiones a las que llegan las demás socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para incrementar la cantidad D. mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Santa is 50 years old. She is a very hard-working and happy mother. She lives in the house she inherited from her parents with her two children, 29 year-old Norma and 24 year-old Néstor, both of whom have their own families. Her business is located in the market Cerro Colorado, a very important market in the city of Juliaca. At her small stand Santa sells all kinds of foodstuffs, like flour, eggs, butter, oil, etc. Her stand is always very busy because her customers know they will always find what they need. What Santa most likes about her business is talking to her fellow vendors. She has been doing this for 17 years. She considers having to stay at her stand all day taking care of her business the most difficult part of the job since there are always people who wait for the opportunity to take something without paying when she is not looking. In the future, Santa wants to have her own store where she can more easily sell her products and offer better service to her customers. This is Santa's fifth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual with her payments and hopes to be this time also. She actively participates in her community bank and keeps up to date with the decisions maD. on behalf of her partners. With a loan of 1200 nuevo soles Santa will buy more products to increase the amount of merchandise she sells at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more merchandise

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es:
La señora Julia María T. O., tiene un negocio tipo librería donde oferta productos útiles escolares como cuadernos, mochilas, lapiceros, etc.  La razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento es para comprar más productos escolares ya que estamos en inicio del año escolar y la demanda de este tipo de productos aumenta de forma considerable por lo que ella tiene que incrementar su inventario para poder satisfacer la demanda actual, ella comenzó este negocio hace cinco años, trabajaba como asistente en el área de servicios generales en una universidad y con el salario que ella ganaba le sirvió para solicitar préstamo con nuestra institución de micro crédito   y con el prestamos ella compro un pequeño inventario de producto escolares y una fotocopiadora donde ella brindaba el servicio de fotocopias,  ella es madre soltera y le toca llevar el negocio y cuidar de sus dos hijos una niña de 7 años y un niño de 9 años quienes también estudian en primaria , esta cliente tiene 5 años de tener este negocio del cual depende ella y sus dos hijos, todo el año ella brinda este servicio y en esta fecha de enero es oportuno  y con esto ella espera  incrementar su inventario y aumentar su negocio de esa forma mejorara sus ventas ya que inicia la temporada escolar, esto le ayudara a incrementar  sus ingresos lo que  permitirá  poder darles la oportunidad a sus hijos de tener otras alternativas y facilidades para sus estudios y desarrollo en sus vidas,
Ella lleva 5 años de trabajar con nosotros y 5 ciclos de créditos, 
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia María T. O. has a bookstore where she sells useful school supplies such as notebooks, backpacks, ballpoint pens, etc. She will use this loan to buy more school supplies. Now that we are at the beginning of the school year, demand for these types of products increases considerably, so she must increase her inventory to be able to satisfy current demand. She began this business five years ago. She worked as an assistent in the general services area of a university, and her salary was enough to allow her to ask for a loan from our microcredit institution. With the loan she bought a small stock of school supplies and a photocopier, with which she offered a copy service. She is a single mother, and she must run the business and take care of her two children, a 7-year-old girl and a 9-year-old boy, who both attend primary school. This client has had her business for 5 years, and she and her two children depend on it. She offers this service all year, and January is an opportune time for her. With this loan, she hopes to increase her inventory and expand her business. That way, she will improve her sales now that the school year has started. This will help her to increase her income, which will allow her to give her children the opportunity to have other choices and chances for their studies and for development in their lives. She has worked with us for 5 years and 5 credit cycles. The loans have been very important to her, since they allowed her to improve her work activities. As a result, she has been able to have a better income and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia, de 24 años, es una joven muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le cedió uno de sus familiares y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es el tejido, tanto artesanal y a máquina, esta actividad la realiza desde que tenía 12 años cuando ayudaba a sus padres a terminar sus pedidos. Desde hace 4 años tiene su propio taller de tejidos donde confecciona chompas, chalinas, chullos, guantes, etc., prendas que los fines de semana vende en su puesto ubicado en la explanada Laguna temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), donde atiende con mucha alegría a sus clientes.

Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre las prendas que mejor les quedarán, y lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto, ya que tiene que cuidarlo. Aun así sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para alcanzar sus metas. Con el tiempo, espera poder hacer crecer su negocio y tener una tienda más grande de prendas artesanales.

Este es el primer préstamo de Virginia con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar los tejidos que realiza.
texts.en:
Virginia, who is 24 years old, is a hard-working and very sensible young woman. She lives in the house that one of her family members has ceded to her, and what she wants most is to improve the quality of her life. Her work is artisanal knitting, which she does both by hand and by machine. She has carried out this activity since she was 12 years old, when she helped her parents complete their orders. For the past 4 years, she has had her own handicraft workshop where she makes sweaters, scarves, hats, gloves, etc., garments that she sells on the weekends at her location on the seasonal Laguna esplanade (the place where they have markets in the city of Juliaca), where she waits on her clients with great pleasure. What she likes most about her work is talking with her customers and advising them on the garments that suit them best. The most difficult part of her work is remaining all day at her sales location, since she has to take care of it. Even so, she knows that she has to work very hard to reach her goals. With time, she hopes to increase her business and have a bigger store of handmade clothing. This is Virginia's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to be punctual in her payments, since she doesn't want to damage the reputation of the other members of her community bank, where she is well-liked and respected. With the loan of 500 PEN she is applying for, she will buy more wool to increase the number of garments completed.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Isaack is a 25-year-old single man. He owns an aqua farm named Kamiti Fisheries. Previously, he ran a car-hire business. His farm has been running for one year and he has six employees. 

Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, has helped him to buy the farm that he currently runs. He hopes to expand his business, that is why he requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings so as to buy fingerlings (young or very small fish) to add to his aqua farm. He dreams to buy more land and make more profits in the future.

loans.use: Buy fingerlings (young or very small fish)

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Savalou dans le département des Collines, F. Julienne vit depuis 17 ans à Hêvié dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Mariée à GBEKPONOU Justin, un peintre, Julienne est mère de cinq enfants. Le couple a trois autres enfants à charge. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Julienne n'a pas été à l'école. Il y a une dizaine d'année que Julienne mène comme activité la vente de friperies dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Julienne vend de l'akassa (aliment fait à base de maïs) accompagné de poissons. Julienne achète ses habits au marché Missèbo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Julienne a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé et a bien effectué les remboursements. Julienne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Savalou in the province 'Collines', F. Julienne has been living in Hêvié in the township of 'Abomey Calavi for 17 years. Married to GBEKPONOU Justin, a painter, Julienne is the mother of 5 children. The couple is also raising three other children. Family living expenses are covered by the two spouses.

Julienne did not attend school. For about 10 years she has been selling used clothing in her neighborhood. At the same time, she sells "akassa" (a dish made from maize) with fish. Julienne buys her used clothing in the Missèbo market in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. She has already received one loan from ALIDé and reimbursed it in a timely manner. She is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, to bolster her little businesses and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of half a bale of used clothing and 2 sacks of maize

loans.name: God Knows Group

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Knows. She is 40 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 6 to 20 years old and their educational levels are kindergarten to 12th grade. Evelyn could not continue her own education  through 12th grade due to poverty. She also cares for a niece. Evelyn and her family live and work at the Neezoe community Junction in Paynesville near Monrovia, Liberia. 

Evelyn’s business is the sales of general goods such as sardines, milk, etc. She buys her goods from wholesalers and sells from a table at retail prices to residents of the Neezoe community in Paynesville. She has been running this business for six years and hopes to become an importer of clothing to Liberia in the near future.

Evelyn started selling with 5,000 LRD as her working capital, that was given to her by her husband. She sells daily needed goods and it attracts more customers to buy from her. Evelyn needs this loan to purchase more sardines, milk, etc. for resale to improve her business.
She dreams of all of her children being brought up in a good way to have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Evelyn is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more sardines, milk, etc. for resale to improve her business.

loans.name: Nganga

texts.en: Ng’ang’a is 35 years old and married with three children in school.  He runs a greengrocer shop in a very competitive environment.  He was previously employed in a private company.  He also does farming for extra income.  He hopes to improve his standard of living.  He requested 60,000 KES so as to add to his stock of groceries.  His dream is to expand his shop into a wholesale business.  He describes himself as an ambitious man.

loans.use: Add stock of groceries

loans.name: Kseniya

texts.en:
Kseniya is married with two children. She is a farmer from the town of Kardashinka, Kherson region. Kseniya owns a greenhouse and grows agricultural produce for sale. She started this business sixteen years ago. Currently, she has 15,000 UAH invested in this business. Her monthly net profit amounts to about $500. 

Kseniya is requesting a loan of 8,000 UAH to purchase polyethylene film for her greenhouse and to make some repairs on it. Kseniya can be characterized as a disciplined entrepreneur who keeps everything in order. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film and repair the greenhouse

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a teenage son, Sergey. She is an entrepreneur from the town of Vodyanoye, where she grows vegetables in greenhouses. Olesya grows early spring tomatoes, radishes and greens for further sale at the markets in her region. Olesya has been in this farming business for twelve years. She has 50,000 UAH invested in her venture. Olesya spends about 20,000-25,000 UAH on seeds and plastic film annually. 

Olesya is seeking a 10,000 UAH loan to purchase three rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who strives to see her business grow and expand. Olesya has two bigger and two smaller well-equipped greenhouses with drip systems. This business is very profitable for this agricultural region.   

Note: In the photo Olesya is with her husband in front of their greenhouses.

loans.use: to purchase 3 rolls of polyethylene film, tomato seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with two grown daughters. She lives in Pavlograd. Natalya owns two vending locations and runs her business selling sporting clothing in two different marketplaces: the central market and the one called “Yulana”. Natalya’s merchandise is always in high demand. She has been running this venture for fourteen years. Presently, her turnover capital amounts to 50,000 UAH. Her net profit amounts to about $1000 a month. 

Natalya is requesting an 11,200 UAH loan to increase her turnover capital. She is hoping to see her business developing consistently and bringing her a stable income. Natalya is a determined entrepreneur. She hasn’t had any late payments with previous loans.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 36-year-old single lady with one son in school.  She owns a retail shop where she sells cosmetics, picture frames, CDs and other general retail products.  She was previously employed in the Ministry of Labour as a cleaner.  Through the Kiva field partner, Faulu Kenya, she was able to build rental rooms where she earns extra income.  She requested a loan of 50,000 KES to add to her stock of cosmetics and other products.  She hopes to educate her son and buy him a piece of land in the future.  She dreams of expanding her work into a wholesale business.  She says that she is very ambitious.

loans.use: Add stock of cosmetics and other products

loans.name: Jessica Diana

texts.es:
Jessica C. de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento tiene agua y luz como servicios básicos. Su esposo trabaja como guardia en una empresa con el tiene 3 hijos. 

Hace ya unos años atrás Jessica y su familia vivían en una fabrica ya que la cuidaban, su esposo trabajaba hay como obrero hubo un incendio en la fabrica y murió uno de sus hijos, el dueño de la fabrica decidió darles una tienda para que ellos pudieran sustentar su hogar.

Ahora Jessica trabaja todos los días con sus hijos vendiendo arroz por libra, cola por unidad, papa por libra, legumbres etc. Hasta ahora no se les ha presentado ninguna complicación en la tienda.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, legumbres, papas, colas para agrandar su tienda con más mercadería. En un corto plazo quiere tener ya una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Jessica C. is 28, and lives in a development on the outskirts of Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her house has basic utilities of water and electricity and is made of cement. Her husband works as a guard in a business. They have 3 children. Some years ago Jessica and her family lived in a factory where they were the caretakers. Her husband worked in the factory. There was a fire in the there and one of their sons died. The factory owner decided to give them a store so that they would be able to have a house. Now Jessica works there every day with her children selling rice by the pound, bottles of cola, potatoes by the pound, beans, etc. Up to this point there haven’t been any issues with the store. With the loan she would like to buy rice, sugar, beans, potatoes and colas to expand her store with more merchandise. In the future she would like to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, colas

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa, pertenece al Bancomunal Señor de Acoria, Ninfa es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años, empezó su negocio de venta de cosméticos gracias a los préstamos que recibe de su bancomunal, ahora también vende comida, prepara platos especiales para eventos, fiestas, reuniones, todo por contrato.
El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en la compra de una parrilla grande para la preparación de parrilladas, la que tiene ahora es muy pequeña.
El sueño de Ninfa es ser una empresaria exitosa, primero tener un negocio de productos de belleza en una tienda.
texts.en:
Ninfa belongs to the communal bank Señor de Acoria. She is married and has 2 children, 12 and 8. She began her business selling cosmetics thanks to the loan she received from her communal bank. Now she sells food, makes specials dishes for events, parties, and meetings-all by contract. The loan that is asking for she will use to buy a bigger grill to make grilled meat because the one she has now is very small. Ninfa’s dream is to be a successful businesswoman, by first having a business selling beauty products in a store.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ninfa will use the loan to buy a bigger grill

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia, D. 53 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, abre las puertas D. su tienda D. abarrotes para atender a sus clientes. Ella es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a las personas D. llevarse algo a sus casas. Su tienda es muy concurrida, ya que es la mejor implementada D. su barrio.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así se pueD. enterar D. las cosas que suceden en su barrio. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda, sin poder salir. 
Para el futuro D. su negocio espera hacer arreglar la infraestructura D. su tienda para ampliarla y que sea más atractiva.

Este es el cuarto préstamo D. Anastacia con MFP, está muy feliz D. la oportunidad y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. 
En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Anastacia, 53, is a very hardworking and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home, and what she most desires is to have a peaceful old-age. Every day, early in the morning, she opens the windows of her grocery store to attend to her customers. She is a very persuasive saleswoman, and she always convinces people to take something to their homes. Her store is very busy, since it is the best-supplied store in her neighborhood. What she likes most about her work is to chat with her customers, because this way she can stay informed about things happening in her neighborhood. She has been carrying out this activity for 15 years, and what she considers to be the most difficult part is to have to stay all day insiD. of her store without being able to leave. In the future, she hopes to make some repairs to the infrastructure of her store to expand it and so that it becomes more attractive. This is Anastacia's 4th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to have this opportunity. She is prepared to make all of her payments on time, since she wants to be able to access other loans at a later time. In her communal bank she is a member who is well-respected for the order she brings to the group. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more products to better supply her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y luchadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su carretilla de golosinas se encuentra ubicada en unos de los parques más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca, el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que ella siempre los atiende con mucha amabilidad y una sonrisa en los labios. Su carretilla tiene una gran variedad de productos, lo que ha hecho que su negocio le sea muy rentable.

A su vez, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 10 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el clima, ya que a veces hace mucho calor o a veces mucho frío.  Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda de abarrotes donde pueda vender sus golosinas con más tranquilidad.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Aurelia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su carretilla.
texts.en:
Aurelia, 42 years old, is a woman who is very unassuming and a fighter. She lives in her own house and wants more than anything to improve her quality of life. Aurelia has a candy cart that is located in one of the most important parks in the city of Juliaca. Her cart is very popular with her customers, since she always attends to her customers with much kindness and a smile on her face. Her cart has a wide variety of products, which has made her business very profitable. In turn, what Aurelia likes most about her work is conversing with her customers. She has made a living in this business for 10 years, and says that the most difficult part of her job is enduring extreme temperatures, since it is sometimes very hot and sometimes very cold. Eventually she hopes to have a grocery store where she can sell her candies more comfortably. This is Aurelia’s third loan from Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time and is determined to do so. She always keeps up to date with the agreements made in her group. Aurelia is asking for 1000 soles and will use the money to purchase more candies so that she can improve her cart’s setup.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, de 32 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y luchadora. Viven en la casa que le heredaron sus padres junto a su esposo Guido, de 26 años, y con su querida hija Tayhua de un año, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de billeteras, gorras, adornos, etc. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, sale a vender sus productos por los alrededores del mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Su negocio marcha muy bien, ya que los productos que vende son muy novedosos y siempre llaman la atención de la gente.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene la libertad para decidir en qué momentos salir a vender. Lleva 3 años realizando está actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad su mercadería.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Gladys con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo para poder acceder a otro. En su banco comunal es muy activa y siempre participa de todas las decisiones que se toman. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos, para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de dónde elegir.
texts.en:
Gladys, 32, is a mother who is very hard working and a fighter. She lives with her husband Guido, 26, and their beloved one-year-old daughter Tayhua in the house that she inherited from her parents. Her husband and daughter are the reason for all of her hard work. Gladys makes a living selling wallets, caps, etc. Every day she leaves very early in the morning to sell her products around the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Her business is going well, since the products she sells are very new and always draw people’s attention. The thing Gladys likes most about her work is that she is free to choose when she goes out to sell her products. She has made a living in this business for 3 years, and says that the most difficult part of her job is that she walks all day looking for customers. In the future she hopes to have a store where she can sell her products more comfortably. This is Gladys’s third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she understands the responsibility of paying her loan on time so that she can gain access to another loan. She is very active in her communal bank and always participates in all of the decisions that they make. Gladys is requesting a loan of 2000 soles and will use the money to purchase new products so that she can offer her customers a larger variety of products to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Hugo, de 36 años, y con sus 3 hijos: Rodolfo de 16, Yadira 15 y Frank de 10 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su negocio está ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca). Su puesto de tejidos artesanales es uno de los más visitados, ya que los modelos que tiene son muy novedosos. Las prendas artesanales las teje ella misma, es por eso que le da a sus tejidos el acabado que desea.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y mientras más lo hace mejor se siente, además que de esta forma puede pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es llevar sus artesanías hasta su puesto de venta, ya que vive muy lejos de ahí. 
Para el futuro, espera juntar el dinero necesario para instalar una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nancy con MFP, ella es muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que produce.
texts.en:
Nancy, 35, is a mother who is very cheerful and hardworking. She lives in a rented house with her husband Hugo, 36, and their 3 children: Rodolfo, 16; Yadira, 15; and Frank, 10. Her husband and children are the reason for all of her hard work. Nancy’s business is located in the Laguna Temporal esplanade (a place where markets are set up in the city of Juliaca). Her artisanal weaving booth is one of the most visited, since the designs she has are very original. She weaves the artisanal garments herself, and so she gives her weavings the finish that she wants. The thing Nancy likes most about her work is weaving, and as long as she weaves she feels better; besides, it allows her to pay for her younger children’s studies. She has made a living in this business for 2 years, and says that the thing she finds most difficult is transporting her crafts to her booth, since she lives very far from there. In the future she hopes to set up a store where she can sell her garments more comfortably. This is Nancy’s sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is very punctual in making her payments, since she does not want to cause problems at her communal bank; she is very happy with her bank and knows that it will help her to make progress. Nancy is asking for 1600 soles and will use the money to purchase more wool so that she can increase the amount of garments she produces.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 36 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 2 hijos; Jesús de 13 y Luz de 12, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios.

Se negocio es la venta de gaseosas, jugos, agua mineral, etc. Ella aprovecha todas las ferias de las zonas cercanas a su ciudad para vender sus productos, ya que sabe que existe una gran demanda y que de esta forma puede abarcar un mercado más grande. Pero el pueblo donde sus ventas son más altas se llama “Liman”, pues es natural de la zona y conoce muy bien a sus moradores.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede decidir cuando trabaja y cuando no, ya que también tiene que darse tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que viajar llevando las bebidas a las distintas ferias de su región. 
Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda con la cual pueda obtener mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Norma con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo puntualmente, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más bebidas para mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma, age 36 years, is a hard-working and very loving mother. She lives in the house of one of her relatives along with her 2 children; Jesus age 13 and Luz age12, to whom she desires to give a good education. Her business is the sale of carbonated water, juices, mineral water, etc. She takes advantage of all the outdoor free markets in the areas near her city to sell her products, since she knows that there is a great demand and that in this way she can cover a larger market. But the town where her sales are highest is called "Liman", where she is a local native and is well known. What she likes most about her work is that she can decide when she works and when not, since she also has to have time to care for her children. She has been carrying out this activity for 2 years and considers that what is the most difficult is to have to carry the beverages to the different markets of her region. In the future, she would like to have a store with which she can earn a greater income. This is the first loan with MFP for Norma and she is willing to pay it promptly, since she does not desire to cause problems to the associates of her communal bank, where she actively participates. With the thousand new Soles requested she will buy more beverages to improve the variety of products that she offers her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more beverages for resale.

loans.name: Maclovia

texts.es:
La Sra. Maclovia esta casada y tiene una hija que estudia en colegio y su esposo trabaja como empleado de un surtidor de combustibles.

La Sra. Maclovia tiene como actividad la venta de almuerzos en su restaurante donde vende tambien platos extras como pollos broaster y silpancho, su restaurante esta ubicado en la zona San Pedro, esta atividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella y su familia ya que con esta actividad ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Uno de sus deseos de la Sra. Maclovia es ver a su hija profesional y tambien tener otro restaurante y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

El destino del credito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y comprar de  mesas y sillas para su pension.

La Sra. Maclovia esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Maclovia is married and has a daughter, who is in school. Her husband works as a fuel distributor. Maclovia works selling prepared lunches in her eatery where she also sells extras like broasted chicken and silpancho (a typical Bolivian food from the city of Cochabamba. It consists of a base layer of rice, followed by a layer of boiled and sliced potatoes, followed by a thin schnitzel-style meat, followed by another layer of chopped tomato, onion and parsley mixed together and topped with either one or two fried eggs). Her restaurant is in the San Pedro neighborhood and this work is her main source of income, with which she helps to support her family and helps her husband with household expenses. One of Maclovia's wishes is to see her daughter become a professional and also to have another restaurant so that she can improve her quality of life. This funding will be used to buy tables and chairs for her eatery. Maclovia is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina, de 23 años, es una hija muy conciente y madura, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es darles una vejez tranquila.

Ella se dedica a la venta de quesos de manera ambulatoria, lo hace yendo casa por casa en espera de que la gente le compre alguno de sus productos. Es una vendedora muy convincente, es por eso que ya tiene clientes ganados, los cuales siempre compran sus deliciosos quesos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y oír como sus clientes alaban su sabrosa mercadería, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día bajo el inclemente sol, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que realizarlo. 
Con el tiempo, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus quesos con mayor tranquilidad.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Rufina con MFP y quiere pagarlo a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro préstamo posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa, que siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más quesos, ya que últimamente está teniendo más demanda.
texts.en:
Rufina, 23, is a mature and aware daughter; she lives with her parents and her greatest wish is to provide them with a tranquil old-age. She sells cheeses door-to-door. She is a very convincing salesperson so she has several regular customers who always buy her delicious cheeses. What she likes most about her work is to go from place to place and hear how her products are praised by her customers. She has been in this line of work for two years and considers the most difficult part of it having to walk all day under the relentless sun. Even so, she knows that this is her work and she has to do it. In time, she would like to have a store from which to sell her products more comfortably. This is Rufina's 5th loan with MFP. She wants to repay on time because she wants to be able to have access to loans in the future. She is a very active member of her communal bank; she is always concerned for the well-being of her fellow members. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more cheeses because demand for them has increased lately.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 21 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Diego, de 22 años, y su querida hija Ruth de tan solo 8 meses de nacida, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Recorriendo las oscuras calles de la ciudad se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi en su motocarro. Aunque sabe que esta es una actividad donde predominan los varones no se amilana y muy firme en sus convicciones sigue trabajando duro, con el único fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede recorrer las calles de la ciudad cumpliendo su trabajo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que tiene que obtener la mayor cantidad de ganancias.
Para más adelante, espera reunir el dinero necesario para comprarse otro motocarro, ya que su esposo también ha decidido trabajar en lo mismo.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Silvia con MFP, está muy feliz de la oportunidad y se siente muy segura de poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre alegra con sus ocurrencias a todas sus compañeras durante las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados hará arreglar los asientos de su motocarro, ya que con el paso del tiempo se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Silvia is 21 and is a very happy and uncomplicated young woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Diego, 22, and their dear daughter of 8 months. They are the reason for all her effort. Riding through the dark streets of the city, she works as a motocarro taxi driver.
