Although she knows that this is work where men predominate, she remains undaunted, and she is very strong in her convictions. She continues working hard, with the only goal of improving the quality of life of her family. What she likes most about her work is that she can go around the city streets doing her job. She has been in this work for 2 years and feels that the hardest part is working late hours because that’s how she makes the most money. In the future she would like to save enough money to buy another motocarro since her husband has decided to do the same work. This is the second loan for Silvia with MFP. She is very happy with the opportunity and feels sure that she can make the payments on time. In her communal bank she is a very well-liked member because she’s always happy with the stories of her companions during the meetings. With the one thousand new soles that she is requesting, she will fix the seats in her motocarro since they have deteriorated over time.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up the seats in her motocarro

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Miguel, de también 24 años y su querido hijo José de 2 años a quien desea dar una mejor vida.

Su negocio es la costura y su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza este oficio. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande, pues es muy responsable y sabe que cualquier tardanza podría dañar la reputación que con tanto esfuerzo a logrado. 
En el futuro, espera que su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Yaneth con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una máquina nueva, de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 24, is a young mother, who lives in a rented house with her husband, Miguel, also 24, and her dear, 2-year-old son, José, for whom she wants to provide a better life. She is a seamstress and her work is highly sought-after in her neighborhood because she is the only one doing this kind of work. She learned from her mother at a very young age and she now has her own shop where she very patiently takes care of her customers. What she likes best about her work is to complete the clothing items that they order from her; she has been in this line of work for 6 years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to work all day when she has a large order to fill. However, she is very responsible and knows that any delays in completion could harm the reputation that she has worked so hard to establish. In the future, she hopes to have a better-known business so that she can grow more. To accomplish this, she is willing to work very hard without rest. This is Yaneth's second loan with MFP. She is happy for the opportunity and knows that she must repay on time; she is willing to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for her fellow communal bank members, where she is highly thought of and liked. She will use the 3000 new soles to buy a new sewing machine in order to increase her production and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
El señor Francisco Luis González S., tiene una propiedad pequeña donde él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz para consumo y para negocio venta de este mismo producto al momento que saca la cosecha, este tipo de cultivos los realiza  solamente  en épocas de invierno, después de la época de la cosecha él se dedica a comprar este producto en las zonas de la montaña a un precio más bajo que en el mercado de la  cuidad,   la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar 18 quintales de frijol el cual el después venderá a compradores de mercado de la ciudad a un mejor precio del que el adquirió. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 2 hijos uno es mayor  de edad y le ayuda en las actividades de trabajo en el campo a sembrar y cultivar hasta la cosecha de estos granos , este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder mantener una forma de trabajo en todo el año ya que después que saca la cosecha no hay trabajo y de esta forma con la compra y venta de granos el espera tener trabajo y una forma de ingresos para él y su familia y así ir mejorando su  nivel de vida.
Don Francisco Luis González S., ha tenido 7 créditos  5 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Francisco Luis González S. has a small plot of land where he grows beans and corn both for his own consumption and to sell when he harvests them. He works the land only in Winter. Once harvesting season is over, he buys these products up in the mountains because prices are lower than in the city; this is why he needs financing. He wants to buy 18 quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of beans which he will resell to buyers in the city market at a higher price than what he paid for them. This client began cultivating basic grains just in Winter; he would do the work with his family’s assistance. He is married and has two children, one of whom is an adult and helps him with the field work, to sow and cultivate, until harvest time. He has always been a farmer and continues to be, expecting to continue to improve his work and be able to maintain some kind of work year-round because, once the harvest is in, there is no more work. He hopes, therefore, that buying and selling beans is a way to have income for himself and his family and, thus, continue to improve his quality of life. Francisco Luis González S. has had 7 loans during 5 years of collaborating with Ceprodel. The impact and benefit of the loans have been considerable in that they allowed him to improve his work activities which, in turn, has resulted in a gradual improvement of his living conditions by producing better income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 51 años, es una mujer muy decidida y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija Margot de 25 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal de mejorar su calidad de vida.

En la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca es donde aprovecha para vender los juguetes de segunda mano que compra en el país de Bolivia. Los juguetes que trae están muy bien cuidados, además que ella los desinfecta antes de venderlos, motivo por el cuales se venden rápidamente.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es ver la cara de alegría de los niños que compran sus juguetes, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus muñecos, ya que los fardos son muy pesados.
Para más adelante, espera tener un puesto estable donde vender sus juguetes, ya que actualmente lo hace de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Yolanda con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es muy responsable, siempre está pendiente de que se cumplan los acuerdos a los que llegan entre socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más fardos de juguetes para tener más mercadería que vender.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 51, is a very determined and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her daughter Margot, age 25, and is determined to work very hard in order to improve her quality of life.

In the Sunday market of the city of Juliaca, she takes the opportunity to sell second hand toys that she buys in Bolivia. The toys that she brings are in good condition, and, in addition, she disinfects them before selling them, which is why they sell rapidly.

What she likes most about her work is seeing the happy faces of children that buy her toys. She has been carrying on this business for 7 years and considers the most difficult part the transporting of dolls, since the loads they come in is very heavy. For the future, she hopes to have a permanent stall where she can sell her toys since currently she has to do so on an itinerant basis.

This is Yolanda’s first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay it on time and is determined to do so. In her communal bank she is very responsible and is always watchful to assure they fulfill agreements reached between the members. With the 1000 new soles applied for she will buy more loads of toys in order to have more merchandise to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: Zema

texts.es:
Zema, de 33 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobre salir en la vida. Vive en la casa de uno de sus familiares junto a sus 2 hijos; Carlos de 6 y Erick de 2, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado “Las Mercedes” de la ciudad de Juliaca, ella se dedica a la venta de carretillas, actividad que le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Su puesto es muy visitado por la personas, ya que las carretillas que vende son de muy buena calidad y ya tiene una reputación ganada.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cargar las pesadas carretillas hasta su puesto de venta. 
Para más adelante, espera instalar una ferretería donde pueda ofrecer también otros artículos para construcción.

Este es el segundo préstamo al que accede Zema con MFP, sabe que ese dinero le ayudará a mejorar su futuro, pero también tiene presente que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo para no meter en problemas a su banco comunal. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más carretillas para implementar mejor su stock.
texts.en:
Zema, 33, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives in the house of one of her relatives along with her 2 children: Carlos, 6, and Erick, 2, for whom she wants to provide a better life. Her business is located in the "Las Mercedes" market in the city of Juliaca. She sells dollies (handtrucks), an activity that has given her the income needed to support her family. Her stand is visited by many people, since the dollies that she sells are of very good quality and she has already won a good reputation. What she likes most about her work is to chat with neighboring tradespeople; this makes her long working days more pleasant. She has been carrying out this activity for 5 years, and what she considers most difficult is to transport the heavy dollies to her sales stall. In the future, she hopes to have a hardware store where she can offer additional items related to construction for sale. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that this money will help her to have a better future, but she also remembers that she must make her payments on time so as to avoid problems with her communal bank. With the 2,000 Peruvian soles requested she will buy more dollies to better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy more dollies)

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.es:
Ubaldo F. R. es un señor de 44 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura mayormente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 

Don Ubaldo se dedica a la producción de leche desde hace aproximadamente 3 años  y en estos momentos desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢600.000(seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una vaca lechera más y así aumentar la producción. El sabe que contar con una vaca más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero dice que si quiere sacar a su familia adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario  tiene que esforzarse en producir más ya que la producción de leche es la que le genera mayores  ingresos a su familia.

Don Ubaldo es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ubaldo F. R. is a 44-year-old gentleman that lives with his wife and 4 children in a community called San Ramón de SantaTeresita de Turrialba, Province of Carttago. It is a small rural community. Its settlers are dedicated to the production of milk, agriculture especially of coffee and bananas and also the raising of hogs. It has an irregular terrain and a lot of the land is preserved as a humid tropical forest. Don Ubaldo has been dedicated to the production of milk for approximately 3 years and at this time desires to obtain a micro-loan of 600,000 colones (six hundred thousand Costa Rican currency) to buy another dairy cow and thus to enlarge his production. He knows that to add one more cow is a greater sacrifice and will demand more work, but he says that, if he wants his family to get ahead and to offer them all that is needed, he has to be hard-working in producing more, since the production of milk is the thing that generates greater income for his family. Don Ubaldo is an associate of the Association of Agricultural Producers of Ramón , one of the 100 associate organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with it he expects to continue growing on an economic and personal level, besides participating actively in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another milk cow

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Antonio S. S.,  se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos de consumo como cultivo de frijol y maíz,  la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar materiales de construcción tales como 600 ladrillos, 10 bolsas de cemento, 1.5 mts de arena para mejorar servicios higiénicos (baños).y reparar tres puertas de su casa, este cliente vive en una casa bastante humilde donde él con  esfuerzo propio ha venido mejorándola poco a poco y ahorita desea hacer estas reparaciones ya que donde el utiliza y tiene como baño está hecho de madera y plástico algo muy débil e inseguro. Este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos  únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 2 hijos quienes son menores  de edad ,  este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo, con esto el espera mejorar y brindarle mayor seguridad y beneficios a sus hijos en su casa de habitación y de esa manera sus hijos podrán tener mejores condiciones de vida , 
Don Rafael S. S., ha tenido 3 créditos  desde el año 2008 lleva 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que tiene como resultados  mejorar las condiciones de vida para él y su familia permitiéndole poder ir a realizar su trabajo con mayor tranquilidad sabiendo que en su casa sus hijos están más seguros y con mejores condiciones esto poco a poco le ayudara a mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio S. S. is a beans and corn farmer. He will use these funds to buy building materials, such as, 600 bricks, 10 sacks of cement, 1.5 meters of sand to improve his bathroom and repair three doors in his house. He lives in a very humble abode which, with his own efforts, he has gradually been improving. He would now like to make these improvements because what he currently uses as a bathroom is made of wood and plastic sheeting, something that is very weak and unsafe. He started farming basic grains only in Winter; his family helped him with the farming tasks. He is married and has two, minor children. He has always been a farmer and continues to be one. He hopes with this to improve and provide better security for his children in their home so that they will have better living conditions. Rafael S. S. has had 3 loans since 2008; he has been collaborating with Ceprodel for 3 years. The impact and benefit the financing has had is quite important because the results have been improved living conditions for him and his family allowing him to work more peacefully knowing that his children are safer at home and living under better conditions. This has helped him to improve his standard of living gradually.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home improvements.

loans.name: Luz Marleni

texts.es:
La sra H. D. G. D. 46 años D. edad vive con sus hijos quienes trabajan independientemente y aportan en la unidad familiar todos viven en Los Florales – Acomayo – Parcona – Ica en casa propia.
La sra se dedica a la venta D. verduras enteras y picadas listas para la preparacion D. comidas tambien venD. fruta en esta temporada ella se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 20 años y gracias a este trabajo a logrado obtener su casa darles educacion a su hijos ya que ella esta separada D. su esposo desD. hace mas D. 12 años y ella ha sido madre y padre para ellos.
En su trabajo es bien dedicada emprendedora y da muy buena atención a sus clientes por lo que son fieles a ella antes vendia en calle maurtua pero cuando fue la inundacion en 1997 ella se traslado a la Calle Huancavelica donD. actualmente ofrece sus productos.
Solicita un financiamiento para poder invertir más en su negocio ya que estamos en temporad D. uva y mango.
Ella trabaja desD. las 6.30 a.m. hasta las 2:00 p.m. y en la tarD. venD. chanfaina en su casa por eso tiene buena acumulacion D. bienes.
texts.en:
H. D. G., 46, lives with her children, who work independently and contribute to household expenses. They all live together in their own house, which is located in Los Florales-Acomayo-Parcona-Ica. She sells both whole vegetables and diced vegetables that are ready for food preparation; she also sells seasonal fruit. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and, thanks to it, she has managed to obtain her house and educate her children since she has been separated from her husband for over 12 years and has had to be both mother and father to them. She is a very dedicated entrepreneur in her work and she gives very good customer service so she has secured regular customers. She used to sell on Maurtua Street but, after the flood of 1997, she moved to Huancavelica Street, where she currently operates. She is requesting funds to invest in her business since grape and mango seasons are now. She works from 6:30am until 2:00pm. In the afternoons, she sells chanfaina (a type of stew) in her house; this is how she has managed to acquire some assets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Reyna Sulema

texts.es: Doña Reyna tiene la edad 55 años,  desde su juventud ha apoyado a sus hijos que junto con su esposo crearon, el trabaja en vigilancia y su salario es bajo es por eso, que doña  Reyna vende desde varios años  hielo y helados  para ayudar a pagar los gastos de agua de luz, luego comenzó hacer pasteles de queso lo cual se ha ayudado. Para ellos es difícil hacer mejoras a su pequeña casa ya que le es difícil comprar todo de una solo vez, es por eso nace la iniciativa de hacer préstamo en Afodenic para levantar las paredes de concreto ya que vivía insegura por  lo cual lo logro por este medio. Ahora desea con este financiamiento poner piso ya que su casa es de tierra para mejor higiene, como que sus muebles no se le pudran en la tierra y reparar la división que es de durpanel, le puso de este ya que es el mas barato. Para comenzar comprara: cemento, arena, piso, madera, clavos para hacer las mejoras y poder estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Reyna, 55, has supported the children she and her husband had every since she was young. He works as a security guard and his salary is very low. Because of this, Reyna has sold ice and frozen treats for several years now to augment family income and pay for such things as water and electricity. She then began to make cheesecakes, the sales of which also added income. It has been very difficult for them to make small improvements to their home because it's very hard to have enough money to buy all the necessary supplies at one time. Thus the need to call on Afodenic for financing to build concrete walls, which allowed her to feel safer. Now, she needs funding to install flooring for better hygiene because her house currently has dirt floors. This will also prevent her furniture from rotting in the bare dirt and she will also be able to repair the room division, which is currently made of durpanel (a type of pressed wood panel); she used this material because it's the least expensive. To begin, she will buy: cement, sand, flooring, lumber and nails to start the improvements and thus be in better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Athanasios

texts.en:
For the past 20 years Athanasios (Tony) has operated his mobile restaurant in the busy lower Manhattan area.

Tony came to ACCION USA for a loan after September 11, 2001. During the tough economic times which followed this catastrophe, Tony worked with ACCION USA to keep his business afloat. Once he was able to stabilize his business, he began to prosper, though times have not been as prosperous lately. Due to changes in people's diets, he says many of his regular customers have stopped eating hot-dogs per their doctors' orders. However, Tony still tends to a busy area of town with tourists and court officials who often choose to enjoy the classic New York treat.

Since fewer people venture outside for their lunch during the winter months, Tony's business slows down each winter. For the past several years he has worked with ACCION USA to obtain the working capital he needs during the slow season. Additionally, this year he will use part of his loan from ACCION USA to make needed repairs to his cart.

Long-term, Tony hopes to retire, with his son taking over the business. Learn more about Tony in this video: http://vimeo.com/8998275

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. have faced difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions like ACCION USA support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education, as well.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: Hotdog stand equipment improvements and inventory

loans.name: Gerardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Gerardo tiene la edad de 54 años, es un hombre trabajador y sencillo, su esposa tiene una hija, la cual estudia contabilidad. Don Gerardo es contador y trabaja independiente el cual le labora a varias empresas pero ganando un salario bajo. Pero como son varias el se ayuda económicamente para la alimentación y otros gastos, pero para el ha sido difícil poder hacer las mejoras a su casa que es muy insegura. El presto en Afodenic para comenzar hacer la construcción  de su casa pero como el financiamiento es poco por  la disponibilidad que el cuenta,  solo logro comprar parte de los materiales de construcción ya que todo esta caro. Es por eso que con este financiamiento comprara más material como: bloques,cemento,tablas, clavos y otros para comenzar hacer las mejoras, ya que es difícil en los tiempos de invierno para el, ya que se pasa el agua. Da las gracias por el apoyo ya que solo es posible esta mejora con el financiamiento ya que no cuenta con capital propio.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 54, is an unassuming, hard-working man. His wife has a daughter, who is studying bookkeeping. Gerardo is a bookkeeper and works independently. This means that he works for several companies but at a very low pay rate. Because he works for several, however, it adds up to enough to pay for food and some household expenses. However, it has been very difficult for him to do any home improvements and his house is very unsafe. He got funding from Afodenic to start building his house but, because the loan was small due to his eligibility limits, he was only able to buy some of the materials because everything is very expensive. With this new loan he will buy more materials like: concrete blocks, cement, boards, nails, etc. to start the improvements because Winter is an especially difficult time for him because water gets into the interior of the house. He gives thanks for the support because these improvements are only possible thanks to the loans because he does not have his own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilder de 41 años de edad, es un padre de familia dedicado al trabajo, junto esposa trabajan para poder apoyar a sus dos hijos en la educación. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde vende una variada de productos del consumo diario.  Ante vendía verduras ambulantes pero todo su capital lo invirtió en la venta, ya que ahora esta tiempo completo vendiendo a sus clientes el y su esposa. Ha venido aumentando el inventario con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado que para el es de mucho beneficio por que mejoran las ventas, como sus utilidades, con este préstamo comprara: arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, sardinas, pote de leche, pan, lácteos, verduras y frutas que es de gran necesidad de consumo. Su meta es poder ampliar la estructura en donde tiene la pulpería, pintar la casa pero no lo ha hecho por que todo sus préstamo lo invertido en su venta pero esta ahorrando lo cual espera hacer estas mejora. Para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilder, 41, is a father who is dedicated to his work. Together with his wife he works to support their two children and provide them an education. He has a small grocery store where he sells a variety of daily use items. He used to sell vegetables door-to-door but now he has invested all his capital in his store and he and his wife work full-time there. Afodenic financing has allowed him to gradually increase the variety of his stock inventory and this has resulted in higher earnings and profits. With this new loan he will buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, sweets, soft-drinks, juices, sardines, jars of milk, bread, dairy products, vegetables and fruits which are in high consumer demand. His goal is to be able to enlarge the structure where he has his store and to paint his house but he hasn't been able to do so so far because all of his loans he has invested in his sales. However, now he is saving up so that he can make these improvements for his family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
La señora Benita es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor”  desD. que se formó, vive en el distrito D. Juliaca, provincia D. San Román y departamento D. Puno, tiene 46 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta tercero D. primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta D. abarrotes.

Benita nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es incrementar su negocio. 

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las charlas que da la promotora
texts.en:
Benita has been a member of Dios es Amor (God is Love) community bank since it was formed. She lives in the district of Juliaca in San Román province, department of Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and has 4 children. She has 3rd graD. education and currently works buying and selling groceries. Benita tells us that the first loan she applied for from Movimiento Manuela Ramos, for 300 PEN, helped her increase her working capital. She is now requesting 3,000 PEN, with which she will buy rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc. Her dream for the future is to expand her business. What she likes most about her community bank are the trainings given by the field promoter.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, pasta, oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esthela

texts.es: La señora Maria es una mujer esforzada al trabajo, tiene 30 años de edad, procreo dos hijos, estudiantes, su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi, recorriendo la capital de Managua. Su negocio es la venta de productos lácteos como: queso, cuajada y crema, con varios años en las ventas ah logrado tener sus clientes. Ella inicio estas ventas con dinero que su esposo dio, el cual ha ido aumentando la compra de queso ya que se vende por lo que es mas barato que el pollo y la carne a los sectores mas pobre del barrio. Gracias a estos financiamientos ha logrado hacer las mejoras a su casa, con el crédito anterior pudo hacer la mejora de un cuarto y con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de mas quintales de queso, crema, cuajadas que son muy rica por que son elaborada en el departamento de chontales los cuales los finqueros traen a vender el queso a la capital. Contenta por que aumentara sus ventas que espera poder a corto plazo comenzar vendiendo mas productos de consumo para el cliente a si como pintar su casa, comprar las puerta del cuarto para mejor privacidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria works very hard. She is 30 years old and has 2 children, both students. Her husband works as a taxi driver, covering the capital of Managua. Maria sells dairy products such as cheese, cheese curd and cream. Over the years she has built a customer base. She started her business with money from her husband, buying more cheese in the poorest areas of the neighborhood because the cheese is less expensive than poultry and meat. Thanks to this financing she has been able to improve her house. With her last loan she was able to improve a room in the house, and with this loan she will purchase large quantities of cheese, cream and curd from the department of Chontales. The dairy products from that department are especially delicious, and the farmers bring their products to sell in the capital. Maria is happy because she will increase her sales and begin selling more food products in the near future. In this way she can afford to paint her house and buy a door for the new room to provide her family with more privacy.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of cheese, cream and curd to improve income through more sales.

loans.name: Anielka Nahima

texts.es: La joven Anielka, de 25 años de edad, es madre de familia de una bebe de 10 meses, reside en el barrio Santa Rosa, desde joven le gusto la música, a su esposo también es por eso nace  la iniciativa y forman un grupo Inverso S.A. que comienzan con instrumento de segunda mano y  en donde su esposo es el supervisor. Y ella es músico y administra también, tiene tres años de ejercer este trabajo es música florklorica y andina, el cual pronto grabaremos nuestro primer disco que esperamos en Dios se escuche a nivel nacional como internacional para mejora del grupo. Ella actualmente esta estudiando comunicación social, pero no tiene el capital para pagar el curso, ya que ha tenido muchos gastos con su bebe es por eso con este financiamiento desea para pagar este curso y poder terminarlo para bienestar de su carrera que estudia los fines de semana el cual espera cursar para lograr un trabajo en donde pueda dar sus conocimientos y poder ganar mejor y poder cubrir sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Anielka is a 25 year-old mother of a 10-month old baby. She lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood. She’s loved music since she was a child and so has her husband. Their love of music led them to form a musical group called Inverso S.A. and to start playing with used instruments. She is a musician in the group, but she also helps her husband with the group’s management. They’ve had the group for three years and they will soon record their first album with folkloric and Andean music. They pray to God that it will be heard nationally and internationally for the group’s success. Anielka is taking a course in social communication, but she lacks the money to pay for it because she’s had a lot of baby care expenses. She is requesting this loan to pay for her course and to be able to continue with her career. She studies on the weekends so she can obtain a better job and earn more money to be able to cover their expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for school.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina es una madre de familia de 42 años, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ambos están a su cargo. Desde hace 3 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de cosméticos, funcionando de la manera ambulante, ella atiende personalmente su negocio y siempre ha contado con el apoyo familiar. Ella tiene varios financiamientos y todos han sido destinados para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de pinturas de uñas, lápiz labial, polvos, cremas y mascarilla. Su deseo es mantener esta actividad económica ya que en estos tiempos es muy difícil porque hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 42 year-old mother of two children who live with her. She has been selling cosmetics for three years and has always counted with her family’s support. She has received multiple loans and they have all gone towards improving her business. She is now requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as, nail polish, lipstick, powders, creams and mascaras. Her wish is to continue to grow her business since nowadays it is more difficult due to increased competition.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 40 años de edad, junto a su esposo trabaja ya que su negocio es un estudio fotográfico, el cual ha sido su medio de trabajo desde hace varios años, en donde han  comprado, cámaras nuevas, computadora para darle mejor resolución  alas fotos. Procreo tres hijos los cuales estudian para un porvenir mejor y tienen el apoyo de los dos. Sus financiamientos han sido para mejorar su tecnología y estar con la competencia a igual. Es un trabajo que da ya que cada día hay una celebración en las diferentes ciudades de la capital, contenta por que cada día han ido comprando lo necesario y poder dar un buen servicio. Con este préstamo comprara una computadora portátil para scanner, ya que le será de gran utilidad como herramienta de trabajo. Se siente sastifecha por el apoyo que la institución ha brindado para mejora al dar un servicio mejor de su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Martha is a 40 year-old enterprising woman who works with her husband in their photography studio. They’ve had this business for many years and they have equipped it with new cameras and computers that improve the photos’ resolution. They have three children who are in school training for a better future. They have previously received loans that allowed them to improve their studio’s technology to be at par with the competition. This is a profitable business since there’s always some kind of celebration around the city. They are pleased because they have been able to purchase the necessary supplies to provide good service to their customers. They are requesting this loan to buy a laptop computer for a scanner, as it will be very useful for their business. She is very satisfied with the support this organization has given to improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer for their business.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Huayllapampa, Alejandra tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además venD. comida en el mismo lugar.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Alejandra son mejorar su negocio y que sus hijos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 37 years old, married with 2 children, and lives in the Huayllapampa community. She has a store in her home where every day she sells groceries, such as vegetables and meats, as well as meals. Alejandra needs a loan of 1,200 soles to purchase rice and sugar. Her dream is to improve her business so that her children can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Forever(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Forever está formado por mujeres trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos,  las socias viven la ciudad de Cuenca urbe que  se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región Centro Sur del país.

Verónica M. es socia del banco comunal Forever,  tiene 31 años de edad es casada y madre de tres niños, su esposo trabaja en un taller de mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Ella vende  productos Forever, productos naturales como: medicina, cremas, cosméticos, etc.  le va bastante bien ya que sus productos tiene acogida en el mercado,  lleva un año comercializando estos  productos y solo utiliza  tres  horas al día y el resto del tiempo se dedica a su familia. Las ventas las realiza principalmente a sus amigos y vecinos de  su barrio.

Este es su primer crédito y fue una amiga de su trabajo quien la invito a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres, con el crédito que reciba va a comprar vitaminas, medicinas, cosméticos, etc. para su exigente clientela.

Su meta es de llegar a ser Gerente de la empresa.

Libia Z. es socia éste banco, éste es su primer ciclo y fue incentivada a formar parte del mismo por el Gerente de productos Forever,  ella se dedica  a la venta de éstos productos  hace cuatro meses, inicialmente era consumidora de productos Forever y ahora   espera en poco tiempo tener mucha clientela.

Nuestra socia vive detrás del mercado Feria Libre (mercado de Cuenca), se encuentra divorciada hace siete años por  infidelidad de su marido, junto a quien procreó cuatro hijos que se encuentran de 17, 15, 13, 8 años de edad, no tiene casa propia vive arrendando.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va a pagar una parte de la entrada para su casa.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un carro.
texts.en:
The Forever Community Bank is composed of working women that are always looking for ways to advance. With their everyday work they ensure a better future for their children. The members live in Cuenca city, a charming city in the south central region of the country which is known for it's historic center and scenery. Verónica M. is a member of the Forever Community Bank; she is 31 years old, married and mother of 3 children. Her husband works at a mechanics workshop. They don't own their home and are currently renting. She sells Forever products, natural products like medicine, lotion, cosmetics, etc. Sales are rather good because there is demand in the market for these products. She has been selling for a year. Verónica sells 3 hours a day and spends the rest of her time taking care of her family. She primarily sells to friends and neighbors. This is her first loan. A work friend invited her to become part of this group of women. With the loan she receives, she will buy vitamins, medicine, cosmetics, etc. for her discerning clientele. Her goal is to become a manager in the business. Libia Z. is another member of the bank. This is her first loan and she was motivated to join the group by her manager at Forever. Libia has been selling these products for 4 months. Initially, she was a Forever client and she hopes to have many customers in very little time. This member lives behind the Cuenca open air market. She was divorced 7 years ago, because her husband was unfaithful. They have 4 children, ages 17, 15, 13, and 8. Libia doesn't own her house and is currently renting. With the loan she receives from the foundation she will pay for construction on the entrance of her home. Her dream is to one day own a car.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vitamins, cosmetics, medicine and payment for part of the construction of an entrance hallway (to buy a house).

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

Juana nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar una vaca.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener ganado mejorado, también dedicarse a la elaboración de bloquetas (material de construcción). 

Lo que más le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad en que brinda los préstamos
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Calceteras” for two years. She lives in the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Juana is 47 years old, married, and has four children. She has a fifth grade education and is dedicated to buying and selling small animals.

Juana says the first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to increase her operating capital. She is now seeking a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy a cow.

Her dream for the future is to improve her livestock and also start a business manufacturing building blocks. Juana enjoys the loan services provided by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow

loans.name: Mayda

texts.es:
Mayda es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Mayda es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Mayda vende ropa variada, productos que vende en la selva ayacuchana a donde viaja cada 15 días y en algunas oportunidades vende carne y queso.
Mayda necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas y pantalones.
Los sueños de Mayda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mayda is a member of the community bank "Violeta". She is married, she is 36 years old and she has 4 children. Mayda sells various types of clothing in the Selva Ayacuchana area to where she travels every 15 days. Sometimes she also sells meats and cheeses.

Mayda requires a loan of 1200 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of jackets and slacks.

Mayda's dreams are to see her children grow up to have good careers, and to build a home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jackets and slacks.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Sandra es soltera, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Sandra vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de las diferentes fiestas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Sandra necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarros, chicles y galletas.
Los sueños de Sandra son que sus hijos sean profesional y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She is single, 23 years old and she has a son. Sandra sells snacks by travelling to the different fairs in the region, something she does every day.

Sandra requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cigarrettes, gum and cookies.

Sandra's dreams are to see her children grow up to have good careers and to purchase a house.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cigarrettes, gum and cookies.

loans.name: Mirador De Carabayllo Group

texts.es:
ROSA, TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, TIENE 2 HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SU PAREJA LA APOYA EN LAS ACTIVIDADES QUE ELLA EMPRENDE PARA MEJORAR SUS INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS. ROSA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "MIRADOR DE CARABAYLLO" CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES,QUIENES LA ELIGIERON RECIENTEMENTE COMO TESORERA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO. ELLOS RESIDEN EN LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO.
ROSA,SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS DE BELLEZA POR LAS MAÑANAS OFRECIENDO A SUS FAMILIARES, AMIGOS Y CONOCIDOS Y PORLAS TARDES HASTA ANOCHECER SE DEDICA A LA VENTA POLLO A LA PARRILLA, NEGOCIO AL QUE SE VIENE DEDICANDO DESDE HACE TRES AÑOS, UBICADO FUERA DE SU DOMICILIO DONDE ACONDICIONÓ UNAS CUANTAS MESITAS Y SILLAS PARA ATENDER A SUS CLIENTES.
CON ÉSTE NEGOCIO APOYÓ ECONÓMICAMENTE EN LA CONSTRUCCIÓN DEL SEGUNDO PISO DE SU CASA.
LE GUSTARÍA MAS ADELANTE APERTURAR UN RESTAURANT, EL CUAL TIENE PLANIFICADO HACERLO A MEDIADOS DE ÉSTE AÑO.
EL PRÉSTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN EL NEGOCIO DE LAS PARRILLAS.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and has two dependent children. Her husband is supportive of her business activities as a means of improving their income. Rosa is a member of the group “Mirador de Carabayllo”, which consists of ten members. She was recently appointed to be the treasurer of the group. The members reside in the area of “La Flor” in the District of Carabayllo.

Rosa sells beauty products in the mornings to relatives, friends, and acquaintances. In the afternoons, she sells grilled chickens from her rotisserie shop. Her restaurant has been in operation for three years and is located in her home, which is equipped with a few tables and chairs for accommodating her customers. The revenue from this business enabled her to add a second floor to her house. She enjoyed opening her restaurant and plans to keep it in operation this year. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her rotisserie business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in a chicken rotisserie business

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Marina es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, Marina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Marina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
El sueño de Marina es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She lives with her common-law husband, she is 35 years old and she has 2 children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa. Marina runs a grocery store from her house, selling general merchandise, vegetables and meats, something she does every day.

Marina requires a loan of 1000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Marina's dream is to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Yudith Mercedes

texts.es:
Yudith es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Yudith es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, Yudith tiene un centro de masaje que se encuentra en un local alquilado, brinda servicios de tratamiento de belleza corporal entre otros, Yudith tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio.
Yudith necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina de gimnasia pasiva.
Los sueños de Yudith son tener un spa grande.
texts.en:
Yudith is a member of the Community Bank "Violeta". She is single, 26 years old, and she has a son. Yudith runs a massage spa from a leased locale. She also provides beauty treatments. Yudith is planning to expand her business.

Yudith requires a loan of 1400 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of a resistance training machine.

Yudith's dreams are to own a large spa one day.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a resistance training machine.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Esta señora trabaja por sí sola, el negocio de esta venta de atoles,(Atolillo, Arroz de leche, requesón, Sopa Borracha, Mango en miel, Manuelitas), ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, ha obtenido la cantidad de diecinueve créditos, cabe señalara que no todos han sido directamente para el negocio, otros crédito los ha utilizados para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, es madre soltera, con dos hijos, los cuales son menores, a quienes tiene comprarles sus útiles escolares para mandarlos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Lucia works by herself. She sells a variety of porridges and snacks, such as “atolillo” (rice porridge with cinnamon), rice pudding, “requesón” (a type of cheese similar to ricotta), “sopa borracha” (a type of bread pudding made of sponge cake soaked in sherry and rum), mango with honey, and “Manuelitas” (a pancake or crepe stuffed with cinnamon, sugar, and cheese).

Ana Lucia has been working with CEPRODEL since 2004 and has taken advantage of nineteen previous loans. It should be noted that not all of them have been used for her business. Some have been used to make improvements to her home. She is a single mother with two dependent children. Before she can send them to school, she must purchase their school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business & school supplies for her children

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal Violeta.
Albina es casada, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa, Albina vende comida y bebidas los días domingos en el estadio de su comunidad, además Albina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores.
Albina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y cervezas.
Los sueños de Albina son ampliar su negocio y tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the Violeta Communal Bank. She is 60 years old, married with 8 children, and lives in the Huayllapampa community. Albina sells food and drinks every Sunday at the community stadium. She is also involved in raising small animals. Albina is requesting a loan of 800 soles to purchase sodas and beer. Her dream is to improve her business and to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sodas and beer

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 36 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rodolfo (41) y sus dos hijas Kimberly (11) y Niurka (5).

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, de acuerdo a la temporada; en ocasiones le envía algunas prendas a su madre que vive en otra ciudad y gana una comisión por la venta. Luz está muy satisfecha con este negocio, ya que se ha hecho muy conocida en su zona y aunque entrega la ropa a concesión se asegura de entregarla solo después que le hayan terminado de cancelar, ya que no quiere perder dinero. Ella quiere seguir desempeñando esta actividad porque es tranquila y la puede realizar en la comodidad de su hogar y como es una mujer emprendedora tiene pensado en el futuro instalar una tienda de ropa en un espacio que tiene en su casa y así seguir creciendo como empresaria.

Este es el 7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que quiere continuar sacando préstamos con esta entidad. Luz tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de uniformes escolares, ya que tiene bastantes pedidos por campaña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Luz is 36 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband Rodolfo (41) and her two children Kimberly (11) and Niurka (5). For three years she has been selling clothing according to the season. Sometimes she sends some clothing to her mother who lives in another city and makes a commision from the sale. Luz is very satisfied with this business. She has become very well known in her area. Although she sells the clothes on consignment, she takes care to deliver it only after she has been paid, since she doesn't want to lose money. She wants to continue this activity because it is calm and she can do it from the comfort of her home. Since she is a hardworking woman in the future she plans to install a clothing store in a space she has in her house and in this way grow as a business woman. This is the 7th loan that she has had with MFP. She promises to be punctual with the payments, since she wants to continue taking our loans with this organization. Luz plans on investing the money in the purchase of school uniforms, since she has many orders for the coming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Nely Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “Flor de Kactus II”, vive en la provincia de Huancané, departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y  tiene 02 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales caseros.

Este es su primer préstamo, ella solicitará al Movimiento Manuela Ramos S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que comprará perros, gatos, gallinas, etc. y alimento para estos

Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar su casa y agrandar su negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de Manuela Ramos es la facilidad de los préstamo.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the "Flor de Kactus II" Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Huancané in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old, is in a common-law marriage and has 2 children. She completed her primary school education and now buys and sells domesticated animals. This is her first loan, which she is requesting from the Manuel Ramos Movement in the amount of 500 new soles and with which she will buy dogs, cats, chickens, etc. as well as food for animals. Her dream for the future is to make improvements to her house and to grow her business. What she likes most about Manuela Ramos is the ease of getting of loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dogs, cats, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Este señor es obrero, labora para la Alcaldía del Municipio de Chichigalpa de donde es originario, es soltero, tiene 42 de edad, tiene cinco hijos que mantener, de los cuales cuatro son menores de edad, ha este señor se le han otorgado créditos desde el año 2006, estos han sido en su mayoría  para mejoramiento de su vivienda y este último lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares, uniformes y zapatos, con los enviara a sus hijos a la escuela, a demás de otros gastos que realizará.
texts.en:
This man is a laborer who works in the mayor´s office in the town of Chichigalpa, where he is from originally. He is single, 42 years old and has five children to support, four of whom are minors. He has been receiving loans since 2006. Most of the loans have been for making improvements to his house and this most recent one will be used to buy school supplies, uniforms and shoes, with which he will send his children to school, in addition to other expenses he has.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, pencils, backpacks, uniforms, shoes and pay off other expenses

loans.name: Trabajando En Armonia Group

texts.es:
GLORIA, TIENE 23 AÑOS, TIENE UN PEQUEÑO HIJO DE 4 AÑITOS, QUIEN ES LA RAZON DE TODOS SUS ESFUERZOS Y SACRIFICIOS. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "TRABAJANDO EN ARMONIA" FORMADO POR DIEZ INTEGRANTES RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE LA FLOR EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO, RECIENTEMENTE FUÉ ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO LA PRESIDENTA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DEL GRUPO.
HACE CINCO AÑOS, GLORIA, INICIÓ SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE GOLOSINAS EL CUAL LO REALIZA EN LOS COLEGIOS EN ÉPOCA ESCOLAR Y FUERA DE SU DOMICILIO CUANDO ELLOS ESTAN DE VACACIONES.
CON SU TRABAJO E INGRESOS ECONÓMICOS PUDO ARREGLAR SU CASA Y HA IDO INCREMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA.
LE GUSTARÍA MUCHO PONER UNA BODEGA EN SU CASA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE BEBIDAS PARA SATISFACER LA DEMANDA DE SUS CLIENTES POR LA TEMPORADA DE VERANO.
texts.en:
Gloria is 23 years old and has a small 4-year-old son, who is the inspiration for all her efforts and sacrifices. She is a member of the "Working in Harmony" group, which is made up of 10 residents of the La Flor zone in the district of Carabayllo. The other members recently voted her as chair of the governing board of the group. Five years ago Gloria started up her business selling candy, which she does at schools during the school year and outside her home during school vacation. With this work and income, she was able to fix her house and has been increasing her merchandise. She would really like to install a small store in her house. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy drinks, in order to meet her customers´ demand during summer.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: La señora Maria es madre de familia de 4 hermosos hijos, tiene 48 años de edad, junto a su esposo han formado sus propios negocio. Su negocio es la venta  de ropa, zapatos, carteras, cosméticos, gorras. También tiene una pulpería, vende fármacos y otros en su casa. Ella inicio este negocio con la venta de un terreno en Esteli, y comenzó a vender trucha, pero luego se vino  ala capital y puso la pulpería y con los créditos de Afodenic ha logrado poner la tienda de ropa. Pues al comienzo fue difícil para ella ya que se dedicaba a lavar y planchar para poder apoyar a su esposo fueron tiempos difíciles por que era agotador. Pero por gracias a Dios logro la venta y todo mejoro en su vida como la de su familia. Y con el apoyo de la institución ha venido  a desarrollarse. Con este dinero desea comprar ropa escolar como: falda, pantalones, camisa, calcetas, como útiles escolares. Ya que en pocos día cursaran el año nuevo los estudiantes y desea aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria is a mother of four beautiful children. She is 48 years old. Together with her husband they have formed their own businesses. Her business is selling clothes, shoes, purses, cosmetics, and hats. She also has a local store; she sells pharmaceuticals and other things in her home. She started this business with the sale of some land in Esteli and she started to sell trout. Later she came to the capital and opened the store. With the loans from Afodenic she has been able to open the clothing store. At the beginning it was difficult for her since she was washing and ironing and everything to support her husband. They were hard times because it was exhausting. But thank God she was able to sell and everything improved in her life as well as her family's. With the support of the institution, she has been able to develop. With this money she wishes to buy school clothes such as: skirts, pants, socks, and school supplies. In just a few days students will start the new school year and she wants to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school clothes such as: skirts, pants, socks, and school supplies. In just a few days students will start the new school year and she wants to increase her sales.

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Triangulo está conformado por Lucia, Tamara y Paulita tienen diferentes actividades económicas. en caso de Lucia tiene 47 años y su actividad es una pulperia, es madre de 5 hijos, pero todos trabajan de manera independiente y ayudan a su Mama en lo que pueden. por lo que tiene mas de 4 años de tener este negocio, en su vivienda lo que la hecho muy famosa con su pulperia. Por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que solicitan para la buena inversión de sus negocios. Ellas solicitan este capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima, necesaria para sus actividades. Ellas han sabido luchar juntas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, son personas muy trabajadoras que son excelentes clientes. El deseo de las 3 es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Triangulo Communal Bank is comprised of Lucia, Tamara, and Paulita. They have different economic activities. Lucia is 47 years old and she owns a small grocery store. She has 5 children, but they all work and help their mother when they can. She has had the business for over 4 years, and she is famous for her store. They have all had previous loans for their business. They are asking for this loan for working capital, which is necessary for their businesses. The group has been fighting together to improve the living conditions of their family. They are very hard working people and excellent clients. They all hope that their kids will be able to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariela Victoria

texts.es: Esta señora es maestra de escuela primaria tiene 40 de edad es madre soltera y con dos hijos a su cargo, los dos son menores de edad, ella es directora de un centro de estudio que se llama José Dolores Toruño en el municipio de Posoltega de donde es originaria, ella está trabajando con nuestra institución desde el año 2006, los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido para mejorar su vivienda y este último que se le está otorgando es para la compra de útiles escolares y uniformes para sus hijos, a demás de otros gastos que tiene que solventar.
texts.en:
This woman is a primary school teacher. She is 40 years old and a single mother with two children to support. She is the director of a school called José Dolores Toruño in the town of Posoltega, where she was born. She has been working with CEPRODEL since 2006. The loans that she has been granted have been to make home improvements and this loan is to buy school supplies and uniforms for her children as well as to cover other expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses: notebooks, pencils, backpacks, uniforms, shoes, and other expenses.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial, de 30 años, vive feliz al lado de su esposa Elsa (26) y de sus 2 hijos; Jafet de 6 y Jhonfranco de 3 años, en una acogedora casa (propia) en un populoso distrito de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 4 años, este ingeniero civil de profesión, se dedica a la elaboración de moldes de madera para el encofrado de las veredas y sardineles de las calles. Las municipalidades distritales lo contratan para que trabaje en la construcción de nuevos proyectos para lo que contrata a personas que lo ayudan. A Marcial le gusta desempeñarse en esta labor porque las ganancias son muy buenas y lo hace con pasión. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado constituir una empresa contratista de construcción, además ya está tramitando los que exige la ley para trabajar sin problemas.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, ya que tiene planeado sacar más préstamos con esta entidad. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar triplay y listones para seguir con la elaboración de sus moldes de construcción y terminar de tramitar los documentos para su empresa.
texts.en:
Marcial, 30, lives happily at the side of his 26 year old wife, Elsa, and their two children. Jafet is six, and Jhonfranco is 3. They live in a cozy house (their own) in a densely populated district in the city of Lima. He is a civil engineer, and for four years he has been making molds for the wood casings for the sidewalks and curbs on the streets. The district municipalities contract him to work on the construction of new projects. People are contracted to help him. Marcial likes to do this work because the earnings are very good. He is passionate about his work. In the future he plans to build a contract construction business. He is already dealing with what the law requires so that he can work without problems. This is his first loan with MFP. He promises to be punctual with each one of his payments because he plans on taking out more loans from this entity. He will use the money he is requesting to buy plywood and wooden strips to keep making his construction molds and to finish dealing with the documents for his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Yanaturo Alto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo Alto esta ubicado al oeste de la ciudad de Cuenca  a unos15 minutos fuera de la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, sus habitantes se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, crianza de animales, existen fábricas de velas, sombreros etc., nuestras socias se dedican a diferentes actividades las cuales les han permitido salir adelante e ir buscando días mejores para sus familias.

Esperanza S. vive en la comunidad de Yanaturo bajo con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como mecánico industrial en su propio taller, no tienen casa propia por lo que se encuentra viviendo en casa de su hermana.

Esperanza tiene 32 años y  se dedica a la elaboración de ropa deportiva de mujer, hace dos años,  ya que antes trabajaba en una fábrica de jeans luego que salió de allí estudió en una academia de corte y confección para montar su propio taller, trabaja bajo su propio horario ya que cuando no tiene tiempo en el día trabaja en la noche.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y fue motivada por su amiga María José una socia del banco comunal, los préstamos recibidos los ha invertido en su negocio y con el  nuevo credito que reciba de la institución  va a adquirir telas de varios colores, hilos, cierres y más acabados para sus confecciones de esta  manera tener un mayor surtido para sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a comprarse un carro y una casa.

La señora María Jiménez  es otra de las socias nuevas  de  éste banco, este es su primer crédito y espera mejorar su situación económica de su hogar,  fue invitada por su amiga Angelita I. integrante antigua del banco comunal.

Ella tiene 35 años, vive con sus cuatro hermosos hijos de  17, 15, 12, 10 años, su esposo viajo hace 9 a los Estados Unidos para darles un mejor futuro a su familia y es quien aporta económicamente a su hogar  logrando  construir su casa propia.

Con el préstamo que reciba de la fundación va  a invertir la terminación de su casa ya que aun le falta closets, baldosas en los pìsos, etc,  su mayor sueño es que regrese su esposo.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo Alto Communal Bank is located to the west of the city of Cuenca, which is 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. Its inhabitants mostly work in agriculture and raising animals. There are some factories that make candles and hats, etc. Our members work at different activities that have allowed them to get ahead and look for better days for their families. Esperanza S. lives in the Yanaturo Bajo community with her husband and their four children. Her husband works as an industrial mechanic in his own shop. They do not have their own house; they live in her sister’s house. Esperanza is 32, and for two years she has been making women’s sportswear. Previously, she worked in a jeans factory. Then she left there and studied in a seamstress academy to establish her own workshop. She works on her own schedule. When she does not have time during the day she works at night. She is in her second cycle. She was motivated by her friend, María José, a member of the communal bank. She has invested the loans she has received in her business. With the new loan that she will receive from the institution she will get various colors of fabric, needles, zippers, and more finishings for her creations. This way she will have a better inventory for her customers. Her dream is to buy a car and a house. María Jiménez is another new member in this bank. This is her first loan, and she hopes to improve the economic condition of her household. She was invited by her friend, Angelita I., who has been a member of the communal bank for a long time. She is 35, and she lives with her four lovely children. They are 17, 15, 12, and 10. He husband traveled to the United States nine years ago to give his family a better future. He contributes economically to the household, and they were able to build their own house. With this loan from the foundation she will invest in finishing her house. It still needs closets and tiles on the floors, etc. Her biggest dream is for her husband to return.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, needles, zippers, etc. tiles and closets

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 50 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Pedro (75) y sus 2 hijos Carlos (21) y Carmín (14).
Desde muy joven aprendió el arte del tejido de su madre y desde hace 4 años se dedica al armado de chompas para los comerciantes mayoristas que le solicitan. Esta actividad consiste en armar las partes de una chompa como una especie de rompecabezas y coserlas, y es algo fácil ya que cuenta con la ayuda de su hija.
A Margarita le agrada mucho porque le genera ganancias que le ayudan en el sustento de su hogar y porque puede hacerlo en su hogar  y durante el día para aprovechar la luz natural. 
A su vez, como es una mujer muy trabajadora ya tiene pensado en el futuro dedicarse al mismo negocio, pero sin intermediarios para obtener mejores ganancias.

Este es el 7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que será puntual en cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallarle a la institución. El dinero que ahora solicita tiene planeado invertirlos en la compra de hilos para tejer los pedidos de las chompas que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Margarita is 50 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband Pedro (57 years old) and their 2 children, Carlos (21 years old) and Carmín (14 years old). From a very young age, she learned the art of weaving from her mother and for 4 years has been dedicated to the assembly of sweaters for wholesale retailers who ask for them. This activity consists of fitting parts of the sweater together like a puzzle and sewing them, something that is easy with the help of her daughter. Margarita is very pleased with this because it generates profits that help in maintaining her home and because she can make them at home during the day to take advantage of the natural light. In turn, as a hardworking woman, she has already thought about the future in this business, but without intermediaries so as to obtain better profits. This is the 7th loan that she has with MFP and she is certain she will be punctual with each of her repayments since she does not want to fail the institution. The money that she is now asking for will be used to purchase thread to weave the pending orders of sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase textile materials

loans.name: Amarilis Del Establo Group

texts.es:
YACQUELIN, ES SOLTERA,TIENE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS, A QUIEN CRIA SOLA Y POR QUIEN PONE TODOS SUS ESFUERZOS PARA SACARLO ADELANTE. ELLA INTEGRA EL GRUPO "AMARILIS DEL ESTABLO", FORMADO POR NUEVE SOCIAS RESIDENTES DE LA ZONA DE EL ESTABLO EN EL DISTRITO DE CARABAYLLO. ELLA HA SIDO ELEGIDA POR SUS COMPAÑEROS COMO SECRETARIA DE LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA DE SU GRUPO.
YACQUELIN, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE SALCHIPAPAS. TODAS LAS NOCHES UBICA SU CARRITO SANGUCHERO EN LA PUERTA DE SU DOMICILIO. DESDE PEQUEÑA ELLA VIÓ Y APOYÓ A SUS PADRES EN ÉSTE NEGOCIO Y HACE SEIS MESES DECIDIÓ INDEPENDIZARSE, NO LE HA IDO MAL, HA PODIDO AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO VENDIENDO TAMBIÉN BEBIDAS GASEOSAS. ESTE TRABAJO LE HA PERMITIDO PAGAR EL COLEGIO DE SU HIJO Y SU CASA.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE INSUMOS AL POR MAYOR,PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Yacquelin is single and 24 years old. She has an 8-year-old son who she is raising by herself and for whom she is putting all her efforts to get ahead. She is a member of the "Amarilis del Establo" group, which is made up of residents of the El Establo zone in the district of Carabayllo. She has been chosen by the other members as secretary of the governing board of her group. Yacquelin sells salchipapas (local fast-food dish of thinly sliced pan-fried hot dogs and French fries) every night from her sandwich cart in front of her house. Since she was a little girl she helped her parents in this business and six months ago she started her own. It has not gone too badly and she has been able to expand her business by also selling soft drinks. This work has allowed her to pay for her son´s school and for her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supples for her business at wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa en el sector Ricardo Jauregui de la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias a algunos ahorros compró un automóvil de segunda mano hace tres años y desde entonces ha venido brindando servicio de transporte público en la ruta Piura – Paita y viceversa. Actualmente este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos que cuenta para mantener a su familia.

Debido a la antigüedad del vehícuo y al uso continuo que se le brinda, este ha venido sufriendo algunos deterioros, especialmente en las llantas, las cuales necesitan un cambio urgente ya que las que tiene actualmente estan en mal estado y ponen en riesgo la vida de sus clientes. Es por ello que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Alberto desea conservar su automóvil y hacerle las mejoras que necesita gradualmente, para garantizar su buen funcionamiento. El es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador. Sus vecinos y conocidos lo estiman mucho
texts.en:
Alberto is 54 years old, married, and lives with his wife in the Ricardo Jauregui sector, City of Piura, located 3 hours from Chiclayo city. Thanks to his savings, some 3 years ago, he bought a second hand car and, since then, he has offered public transportation services to and from Piura-Paita. At present, this business is the only source of income he can count on to maintain his family. Due to the age of the vehicle, and its continuous use, it has begun to suffer some deterioration. This is especially true of its tires, which are in bad condition and urgently need changing. They put the life of his customers at risk. That is why he is requesting a loan, for the first time, from EDPYME Alternativa. He needs 1,500 New Sols. Alberto wants to conserve his automobile and make needed improvements, gradually, to guarantee its sound functioning. He is a responsible worker and father of a family. His neighbors and those who know him think very highly of him.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO CHANGE TIRES ON THE CAR HE TRANSPORTS CUSTOMERS IN

loans.name: Ortencia

texts.es:
Ortencia, de 39 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Manuel (40) y sus tres hijos Rosmery (14), Lisbeth (11) y Renzo (1).
Esta emprendedora mujer tiene muchas ganas de trabajar y progresar. Se dedica desde hace 7 años a la crianza de animales de corral como pollos, codornices, patos y conejos, los que comercializa a los comerciantes del mercado de su localidad. El negocio es muy rentable, ya que sus animales se reproducen rápido por la buena crianza y alimentación que les brinda, por lo cual  obtiene muy buenas ganancias, las cuales que le alcanzan para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. 
A su vez, a Ortencia le gusta mucho esta actividad porque le va muy bien, además tiene muchos planes en mente para progresar, ya que quiere brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejor calidad de vida. Como le sobran las ganas para salir adelante, a base de esfuerzo, tiene pensado para el futuro sembrar verduras y empezar con la actividad agrícola.

Este es el 13avo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser puntual, como siempre lo hizo, en el pago de sus cuotas. Además quiere seguir sacando préstamos con esta institución porque dice que desde el principio confió en ella y le ayudó a progresar.
El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gran cantidad de alimento para sus animales, y así seguir con la crianza exitosa de éstos. También destinará otra parte del dinero para dar la cuota inicial del terreno donde empezará a sembrar.
texts.en:
Ortencia, 39, lives in her own home along with her husband Manuel (40) and their three children Rosmery (14), Lisbeth (11) and Renzo (1). She is an enterprising woman who has a strong desire to work and get ahead. For 7 years she has been raising barnyard animals such as chicken, quail, ducks and rabbits, which she sells to the market traders in her area. This business is very profitable, since her animals reproduce rapidly due to the good quality of care and feed that she provides them.
