She gets very good earnings, which allow her to help her husband with the household expenses. Ortencia likes this work very much because it is going very well. In addition, she has many plans in mind to develop, since she wants to provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life. As she continues to have a desire to advance, through effort, she is thinking in the future of planting vegetables and starting up with agricultural activities. This is her 13th loan with MFP, and she is committed to be punctual, as she has always been, in her payments. In addition, she wants to continue taking loans from this institution because she says that from the start they trusted her and helped her to advance. The money that she requests now will be used to buy a large quantity of feed for her animals, so that she can continue to be successful with them. In addition, another part of the money will be used to make a down payment on some land where she will begin to cultivate.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 38 años, tiene 4 hijos: Jesús de 22, Gabriel de 14, Alexander de 12 y Andrés de 3 años; juntos y con muchas ganas de progresar viven en su acogedora casa que es propia.

Desde hace 5 años se dedica al pegado de todo tipo de pedrería en diversas prendas de vestir que le dejan diferentes comerciantes. Ella realiza esta actividad con la ayuda de una amiga, trabajan durante todo el día para aprovechar la luz natural. Por otro lado, le es muy rentable ya que las ganancias le alcanzan para mantener bien a sus hijos, pues lo debe hacer sola.
A su vez, disfruta mucho su labor porque es un trabajo  tranquilo y lo puede hacer en su casa, sin tener que movilizarse a otros lugares, además sabe que tiene paciencia y puede hacer todo tipo de figuras que le encargan sin problemas, ya que tiene muchas ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. 
Para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa y vender toda clase de productos, para seguir saliendo adelante.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en cada una de sus cuotas para devolver la confianza depositada en ella. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de diversidad de pedrería para no tener que viajar hasta la ciudad cuando le hagan pedidos. También planea empezar a abastecerse con mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 38, has 4 sons: Jesús, 22, Gabriel, 14, Alexander, 12, and Andrés, 3. With the will to progress, they live together in her cozy house, which she owns.

For five years, she has been engaged in setting all types of precious stones into a variety of garments left with her by merchants. She carries out this business with the help of a friend. They work all day so that they can take advantage of natural light. This activity is very profitable, for the earnings she attains allow her to provide good support to her children. She has to accomplish this on her own.

She enjoys her work because it is a quiet job, and she can do it in her house without having to go to other places. In addition, she knows that she is patient and can make all kinds of shapes that are assigned to her, without problems. She has a great desire to work in order to get ahead. In the future, she plans to open a shop in her house selling all types of products in order to continue getting ahead.

This is the first loan she has with MFP, and she promises to be punctual in making each of her payments in order to justify the confidence shown her. She is thinking of investing the money in the purchase of a variety of precious stones so that she doesn’t have to travel to the city when they are ordered by customers. She also plans to begin supplying herself with merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, D. 54 años, vive feliz junto a su esposo Norberto (62), su hija Carla (26), su yerno y sus nietos. Todos habitan en su pequeña casa propia, ubicada en un populoso distrito D. la ciudad D. Lima.

DesD. hace 12 años se dedica al tejido D. chompas en su máquina industrial, al principio lo hizo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero en la actualidad este trabajo se ha convertido en el principal sustento D. la familia. Rosa trabaja para mayoristas y según los pedidos que le hacen, teje toda clase D. chompas D. lana y también D. hilo, D. acuerdo a la temporada y las venD. a buen precio, así obtiene buenas ganancias.
Por otro lado, el trabajo le gusta mucho porque es tranquilo y lo pueD. realizar en la comodidad D. su casa, además esta trabajadora mujer también venD. cerveza en su casa y con en este negocio también le va muy bien, ya que las bebidas tienen bastante acogida durante los fines D. semana. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado ampliar su negocio D. tejidos y empezar a vender ella misma y no a través D. intermediarios.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete una vez más a ser responsable y puntual en cada una D. sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchos proyectos en mente y tiene esperanzas D. hacerlos realidad. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. hilo para tejer mayor cantidad D. chompas. También quiere comprar ropa para empezar a vender, ya que tiene cantidad D. personas que le solicitan prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54 years old, lives happily with her husband Norberto (62), her daughter Carla (26), her son-in-law and her grandchildren. For 12 years she has worked making sweaters with her industrial machine. At first she did it to help her husband with household expenses, but now this work has become the main livelihood of the family. Rosa works for wholesalers and, according to the orders they give her, she makes all sorts of sweaters from wool and from linen, depending on the season. She sells them at a good price, thus obtaining good profits. On the other hand, she enjoys the work a lot, because it is peaceful and she can do it in the comfort of her own home. Furthermore, this hardworking woman also sells beer out of her house. She is doing really well with this business, as the drinks are well receiving during the weekends. For the future, she is thinking of expanding her knitting business and beginning to sell things herself and not through middlemen. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises once more to be responsible and punctual with each of her payments, since she has many projects in mind and has hopes of bringing them to fruition. She is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in the purchase of linen to knit a larger quantity of sweaters. She would also like to buy clothes in order to begin selling them, as there are already people who have been asking her for clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 32 años, vive feliz al lado de su esposo Jhon (32) y sus dos traviesos hijos; Yesenia (11) y Rubén (4), juntos habitan en su acogedora casa propia.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinos y amistades, quienes le hacen pedidos de acuerdo a la temporada. La ventaja de su negocio es que comercializa la ropa a concesión, es decir que sus clientes se comprometen a pagarle después de un tiempo. 
A Rosa le gusta su trabajo porque obtiene considerables ganancias, que le permiten ayudar en los gastos de su casa, pero lo difícil es que a veces sus clientes se atrasan en los pagos y esto le retrasa la compra de nuevas prendas. 
Sin embargo, como es una mujer emprendedora tiene muchos planes para el futuro, entre ellos tener una tienda de ropa en un lugar fijo y con el tiempo llegar a aperturar una boutique.

Esta es la 7ma vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y asegura será responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, como lo viene haciendo hasta ahora. Con el dinero que ahora solicita tiene pensado comprar mayor cantidad de ropa para ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 32, lives happily with her husband Jhon (32), and their 2 playful children: Yesenia (11), and Ruben (4). They live in their own cozy home. For 4 years she has sold clothing; she offers her merchandise to her neighbors and friends who make orders according to the season. The advantage of her business is that she sells clothing on consignment, which is to say that her customers promise to pay after some time. Rosa likes her work because she gets considerable earnings that allow her to help with the household expenses, but the difficulty is that at times her customers fall behind in their payments and this delays her ability to buy new garments. However, as she is an enterprising woman she has many plans for the future; among these is to have a store in a fixed location and eventually to open a boutique. This is her 7th loan from MFP, and she assures us that she will be responsible in making each one of her payments, as she has been doing up to now. With the money that she now requests she will buy a large quantity of clothing so that she can offer variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy clothing)

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia, de 41 años, vive al lado de su esposo Martín (43) y sus tres hijos; Elizabeth (16), Jesús (10) y Víctor (8), juntos habitan su casa propia.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica al alquiler de luces para fiestas, se le ocurrió empezar con este peculiar negocio porque no había nadie que lo hiciera en su zona y existía bastante demanda de este servicio. Desde entonces alquila luces sicodélicas, tipo semáforo o reflectores para cualquier tipo de evento y tiene bastante acogida, ya que sus precios son muy accesibles.
Sonia comenta que se ha hecho tan conocida que ahora la llaman “la señora de las luces”, a ella le agrada esta actividad porque tiene buenas ganancias y quiere seguir ampliando este servicio con mejor calidad, además cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, pues durante el día ella trabaja cuidando ancianos y niños. 
Para el futuro quiere ampliar la calidad del servicio de alquiler de luces y comprar equipos más modernos.

Este es el 7mo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir progresando. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquina de humo y burbujas que le solicitan frecuentemente, con esto espera generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sonia is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Martín (43), and her children; Elizabeth (16), Jesús (10) y Víctor (8). For the past four years she has been in the business of renting out light sets for parties and festivals. She came up with this idea because there was nobody else in her neighborhood providing this service and there was a great demand. Since then she has been renting out psychedelic light sets, traffic light style light sets, and spotlights for any type of event. She is welcomed and her prices are affordable. Sonia says that she has become so well known that people refer to her as “the lady of lights.” She likes this work because it provides a good income and she would like to expand it. Her children also help out, as she works during the day, providing care for children and the elderly. In the future she would like to expand her business and invest in more modern equipment. This is her 7th loan through MFP and she promises to be on time with all of her payments. She wants to continue to move ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy a smoke and bubble machine. Her customers often ask for this service. She expects to increase her revenue, by offering this new service.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a smoke and bubble machine

loans.name: The Women's Bank Of Entrepreneurs Of Chilamate Group

texts.en:
“The Women's Bank of Entrepreneurs of Chilamate” is a group of women from Poas, Chilamate, located close to the active Poas volcano in Costa Rica. The members of this group of 7 women are engaged in many varied productive activities including: food sales, a corner store, chicken rearing, bread making, and sewing. They have formed a strong bond with one another. It is apparent that these women regard community, solidarity, and hard work as values central to their beliefs.

Their special bond has developed because the members of the group have been neighbours all their lives, and thus know each other on a very deep and personal level. The positive experience that this group has had throughout the duration of their first loan has inspired new members to join the group. This will be the group's second loan with Fundacion Mujer; the first loan was paid back on time and in full. The loan officer who has been working with this group commends the members on their strong history of punctual repayments.

Socorro P. V. is experienced in sales. Every day, she makes “pan” a type of bread that she sells fresh to her neighbours and others in her community. Socorro also sews women's clothes (underwear and blouses) which she sells on the weekends in Guapiles. She travels by bus with her clothing products, taking a combination of 3 buses. Guapiles, in the Carribean region of Costa Rica, is roughly 2 hours away. Socorro has lived in Poas her entire life. At the age of 54 she is one of the eldest in the group, and she takes pride in the level of trust that has always existed in her community. “There is no trouble,” she says, “if anyone makes trouble it’s because they come from outside of our community.” Her enthusiasm for life is inspiring; she says that every day is a gift.

Angela R. L. is the elected president of the group. She is 57 years old and has 8 children. Angela has a business sewing and selling clothes such as pants for men and women, children’s clothing, shirts, and pyjamas. She also sews quilts and other types of bedding.

Yorleny M. P. raises chickens and then sells the eggs they lay. She is 34 years old and lives with her four children. With her first loan, she made the mistake of buying the wrong feed for her chicks, so they ended up too fat to lay eggs. As a result, she has sold these chickens and plans to use this second loan to purchase the correct feed so that she might have some chickens that lay eggs. Yorleny has thankfully maintained a good sense of humour regarding her mistake.

Vera Maria S. Z. is 43 years old and has 3 children. She has a business preparing and selling foods to people in her community. She works out of her home Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Vera makes the majority of her sales in the afternoons and at night. She sells hamburgers, tacos, and 'ceviche' among other products. She says her tacos are the most popular item on the menu.

Laura Espinoza R. is 32 years old. She has one child and her highest level of formal education is the completion of primary school. Laura runs a beauty salon where she employs one other person. She will use this loan to buy hair and beauty products in order to better serve her clients.

loans.use: For general investments conducive to business growth

loans.name: Vanessa Del Pilar

texts.es:
Vanessa es una madre de familia de 25 años que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en casa de sus suegros ubicada en el sector Miguel Grau de la ciudad de Piura, a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años tiene instalada en casa de sus suegros una pequeña bodega. Ella nos comenta que instaló este negocio con ahorros que había logrado juntar trabajando como vendedora ambulante de pescado en años anteriores. El negocio constituye una fuente estable de ingresos a la familia ya que su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero en una ladrillera de la zona.

Vanessa desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos con los cuales pueda captar más clientes. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de abarrotes y bebidas.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy alegre. Su más grande anhelo es seguir ampliando su negocio para poder juntar el dinero suficiente y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Vanessa is a 25-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their child in the home of her husband's parents, located in the Miguel Grau sector of the city of Piura, three hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For three years she has had a small shop, located in the house of her husband's parents. She tells us that she opened this business with savings that she had managed to save working as a walking vendor of fish in past years. The business creates a stable source of income for the family, since her husband works intermittently in a brick factory in the area.

Vanessa wants to increase her business with the purchase of more products with which she can attract more customers. For this reason, she is applying for the first time at Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 1000 PEN, which she plans to use in the purchase of grocery items and drinks.

She is a hard-working woman, responsible and very happy. Her greatest desire is to continue expanding her business in order to put together enough money to construct their own house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery items and beverages to expand her business

loans.name: Erik

texts.es: El Erick G. G. trabaja en la alcaldía municipal es obrero trabaja en los viveros de la misma institución es soltero vive en casa de sus papas tiene  dos años de  trabajar para la alcaldía el dinero los solicita para ayudar a remodelar la casa de sus padre compra de cemento, arena, pago de mano de obra, estos créditos le han venido a ayudar ya que poco a poco han mejorado su vivienda y han podido comprar sus electrodomésticos y espera que Ceprodel siempre los apoye de esta manera brindándoles financiamiento.
texts.en:
Erick Gonzáles G. works for the government of the local municipality as a laborer in the plant nursery. He is single and lives with his parents. He has been working for the municipality for two years. The money he is requesting will help remodel his parents´ house and will buy cement, sand and pay for labor. These loans have helped him to make home improvements little by little and they have also helped him buy home appliances. He hopes that Ceprodel will always help them by offering loans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make home improvements

loans.name: Jose Williams

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, distrito de Illimo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la comercialización de pavos y chivos. El cría los animales en un corral ubicado frente a su vivienda y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que periódicamente visitan la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola, pero esta actividad no le brinda los recursos que necesita para sacar adelante a su familia.

El modo en que los cría ha hecho que sus animales tengan muy buena acogida entre sus compradores, por lo que José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pavos y chivos, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

José es un padre de familia honrado y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su esposa y sus dos hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José is the 26-year-old father of a family, who lives with his wife and two children in the small village of San Pedro de Sasape, in the Illimo district, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For 10 years he has sold turkeys and kids. He raises the animals in a yard in front of his house and offers them for sale to dealers who periodically visit the area where he lives. He also works as an agricultural worker, but this activity does not offer the means he needs to advance his family.

The way in which he raises his animals has gotten a very good reception from his buyers, so José wants to increase his business with the purchase of more turkeys and kids. For this reason, he is applying to Edpyme Alternative for the first time for a loan of 1200 PEN, which he is planning to use to achieve his goal.

José is an honest and responsible father. His greatest desire is to be able to offer his wife and two children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy turkeys and kids to increase his business

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Wenceslao

texts.es:
Wenceslao tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos nietos en el caserío Huaca de Barro, distrito de Morrope, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 20 años. Tiene unos terrenos de cultivo en una zona cercana. Allí ha sembrado actualmente arroz. Este negocio es la única fuente de sustento con la cual ha venido manteniendo a su familia durante todo este tiempo. Por lo que siempre da todo de si para sacar sus cultivos adelante.

El cultivo de arroz ya está muy avanzado y Wenceslao necesita darle mantenimiento con la aplicación de fertilizantes, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

El es una persona muy conocida y estimada por los vecinos de su comunidad, ellos lo consideran un hombre honrado y trabajador.
texts.en:
Wenceslao is 66 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and two grandchildren in the small village of Huaca de Barro, in the Morrope district, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has worked in agriculture for more than 20 years. He has some land under cultivation in a nearby zone. At this time, he has planted rice there. This business is the only source of sustenance he has had to maintain his family for this whole time. For this reason, he always gives all of himself to raise his crops. The rice crop is already very far along, and Wenceslao needs to maintain it with the application of fertilizer, but he does not have enough capital to do this. For this reason he has seen the need to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 PEN. He is a person who is well-known and admired by his neighbors in the community. They consider him an honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Rusell

texts.en:
Rusell G. is from the village of Southwestern Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Rusell is married and has 1 school age child. To make a living, Rusell owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling meat products including pork and beef in the public market. Rusell has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rusell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rusell has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rusell is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rusell from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y vive en el caserío Lagunas, distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia hizo que empezara a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales para subsistir. Ella cría cerdos y los vende a los negociantes que visitan su caserío de manera constante. Este negoco le ha brindado la suficiente ayuda para salir adelante durante este tiempo.

Debido a la demanda por sus animales Felicita desea mejorar la calidad de sus cerdos para así poder obtener más ganancias. Por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Felicita es una madre luchadora que siempre da todo de si para sacar a su familia adelante. Su más grande anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos todas las posibilidades de desarrollo que estén a su alcance.
texts.en:
Felicita is 42 years old and is the single mother of three children. She lives in the Lagunas neighborhood, in Mórrope District, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. In order to help her family get ahead in life, Felicita decided to start raising and selling animals. She raises pigs, which she then sells to the traveling salespeople who regularly pass through her neighborhood. She has been able to make significant progress in life since launching this business. Because of the demand for her animals, Felicitas wants to improve the quality of her pigs in order to earn more. She is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Peruvian Soles; she plans to use the loan to buy animal feed. Felicita is a hard-working mother who always gives her all so that she can help her family get ahead in life. Her greatest dream is to provide her children with all of the available opportunities to develop themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Compra de alimento balanceado para cerdos.

loans.name: Noel Wilder

texts.es:
Noel tiene 33 años D. edad, es conviviente hace 7 años, vive en casa D. sus padres con 
sus 2 hijos D. 6 y 4 años D. edad. El adquirió su camioneta station wagon con su 
liquidación obtenida D. los más D. 5 años laborando en una empresa distribuidora D. 
cerveza. El tiene amplia experiencia en el servicio D. taxi, adicional a esto brinda 
el servicio D. movilidad escolar. Noel y su cónyuge sueñan con tener su casa propia.   
El tiene muy buen trato con los niños los cuales los traslada a sus escuelas, y a 
todas las personas a las cuales el les brinda su atención. El requiere el crédito para 
realizarle el mantenimiento D. su unidad, y así no tener problemas, ya que se acerca 
L. temporada escolar.
texts.en:
Noel is 33 years old and has been in a common law marriage for seven years. He lives at the home of his parents with his two children, ages 6 and 4. He bought a station wagon using the severance pay he received after working more than five years for a beer distribution company. He has extensive experience in the taxi business, and also provides a shuttle service for school students. Noel and his wife dream of owning their own home. He treats the children he drives to school very well and provides excellent service to the rest of his customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to perform maintenance on his vehicle so that he will not experience problems for the remainder of the school term.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Teresa Fortunata

texts.es:
Teresa 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, de los cuales 
solo una menor de 15 años esta bajo su carga familiar, la cual se encuentra en edad 
escolar. Ella inició el negocio con capital obtenido a través de la liquidación de su 
esposo en su centro laboral, el cual parte lo utilizo para iniciar el negocio y la 
diferencia para la construcción de su vivienda de adobe (material rustico). Ella 
atiende el negocio de manera amable y amena lo que ha permitido incrementar su 
clientela, Teresa sueña con reconstruir su vivienda y brindarle la educación a su hija 
la cual pronto egresara de la escuela. Solicita el crédito para la compra de 
mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. Of all her children, only her 15 year old daughter is still a dependent and attends school. She started her business with the severance pay her husband received when he was laid off at his workplace. Some of the money was used to start her business and the remainder was used to build their house of adobe (a basic material). Teresa attends to her business and serves her customers in a friendly and entertaining manner, which has helped her attract even more of them. Teresa dreams of rebuilding her house and providing for her daughter’s education so that she can graduate as soon as possible. She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Yadira Ether

texts.es:
Yadira Esther M. S. tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en edades 8 y 6 años en el barrio El Carmen de Malambo, Municipio del Área Metropolitana de Barranquilla y pueblo anfibio del  departamento del Atlántico, nacido a orillas del río Magdalena y la Ciénaga Grande, en él que sobreviven las danzas y ritos derivadas de la época de esclavitud en el Atlántico Colombiano, como la Cumbia, el Fandango, La Danza De Negro, La Danza De Los Pajaritos y El Gavilán Pio-pio. 
Como en el interior de Malambo sus habitantes no suelen transportarse en taxi, el transporte público se efectúa principalmente en moto taxi, una moto con sillas para dos pasajeros, que pasa por la puerta de la casa de Yadira, ubicada en esta vía principal, lo cual hace que ella esté bien posicionada en su negocio de venta de aceite para motos, debido a que sus clientes principales son los conductores de moto taxi y a que las cortas distancias al interior de Malambo, hacen que la  población utilice este tipo de transporte y hacen de ella una actividad  muy rentable. 
Aunque Yadira siempre tuvo un negocio, se inició con la venta de aceites para motos, cuando fuè felizmente involucrada  por su prima quien se mudó hace cuatro años y se lo dejó; ella accedió teniendo en cuenta que su casa era el sitio perfecto para comercializar este producto por la  alta circulación de estos vehículos, para ello su padre abrió un local para su funcionamiento. Ella dice que tiene una ventaja competitiva en este negocio porque es una población que ha aumentado mucho y este crecimiento significa un aumento en el número de personas que van transportados por los moto taxis y por consiguiente aumenta la demanda de aceite; adicionalmente tiene una habitación en su casa dedicada a los videojuegos donde niños y jóvenes del Municipio pueden divertirse, este lo trajo una cuñada de Bucaramanga y aunque en el barrio hay mucha competencia, sus equipos son más modernos y ninguna otra sala de videojuegos del municipio tiene los X-Box. Así que la rotación del dinero diario por este concepto lo hace bien atractivo para ella y su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo por valor de  $2.000.000 para comprar aceite y comprar una reja y mejorar la cubierta de la sala de videojuegos lo cual servirá para aumentar la seguridad. Éste es el segundo crédito, efectuado a Yadira por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  entidad a la que le gusta pertenecer, porque considera que  otras organizaciones hacen muchas deducciones, lo que significa que reciben menos dinero; en la Fundación recibe financiación de acuerdo de su capacidad de pago. Es más, Yadira  expresa que aprovecha muy bien los cursos y programas formativos que  le ofrecen el la Fundación y está decidida a  ponerlos en práctica en el negocio. Con esta actividad apoya los ingresos de la familia y  se siente contenta pues puede enviar a su hija a una escuela de ballet.
Yadira M., dice que su mayor desafío personal que enfrenta es la salud de su cónyuge porque tuvo que asumir la dirección y parte de los gastos de la familia cuando  él se enfermó, pero por suerte tiene la seguridad social cubierta, porque en este país le prestan todos los servicios a él. La meta de su familia es construir un almacén de repuestos e insumos para las motos en un lote al lado de su casa, pero aun  sueña con tener un local propio e independiente de sus padres y por eso abrió una cuenta de ahorros para seguir guardando sus ingresos y así poder hacerlo.
texts.en:
Yadira Esther M. S. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two children (ages 8 and 6) in the neighborhood of El Carmen de Malambo, which is in the metropolitan area of the City of Barranquilla, Department of Atlántico. The city lies on the banks of Magdalena River and the Great Marsh. Many of the dances and rituals derived from days of slavery still survive in the Colombian Atlantic region such as the Cumbia, the Fandango, “La Danza de Negro” (The Black Dance), “La Danza de Los Pajaritos” (The Dance of the Small Birds) and “El Gavilán Pio-pio” (The Cry of the Hawk). Within the interior region of Malambo, the inhabitants rarely travel by taxi. The primary mode of transportation is a “mototaxi”, which is a motorcycle with seats for two passengers. When you come across the front door of Yadira’s house, which is located on the main road, you will find a strategically located business for selling motorcycle oil. Her main customers are motorcycle taxi drivers who travel short distances within Malambo. Most of the population utilize this method of transportation, so it can be a very profitable business.

Even though she already had a business, Yadira decided to begin selling motorcycle oil with her cousin. The cousin moved away four years ago and she agreed to take over the business entirely. Her house was the perfect place for selling this type of product because of the high frequency of motorcycle traffic, so her father set aside a space for her to run the business. Yadira says she has a competitive advantage in her business because of the significant increase in the population. This type of growth means more people are traveling by motorcycle taxi, which leads to an increase in the demand for oil. In addition, Yadira has a room in her house where children and teenagers from the neighborhood can come to play video games and have fun. Her sister-in-law brought in the equipment from Bucaramanga. Even though Yadira faces stiff competition from other video arcades in town, her equipment is more modern and her business is the only place in the area that has an X-Box. This particular business was attractive because of the daily income it generates for her and her family.

Yadira is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 COP to buy motorcycle oil and security bars to install in her video game room to provide more safety. This is her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an institution which she enjoys doing business with because she noticed that other organizations made several deductions that decreased the loan amount issued. With the Foundation, she is able to receive the full amount requested. In addition, Yadira says that she taken several good courses offered by the Foundation and is determined to implement them in her business. With her business activities, she is able to provide income for her family and is happy that she is able to send her daughter to ballet classes.

Yadira says the biggest personal challenge she faces is the health of her husband because she had to take charge of the family expenses when he became ill. Fortunately, she receives payments from the government because in her country she is able to access services that her husband needs. Yadira’s goal for her family is to build a warehouse next to her home where she can sell parts and supplies for motorcycles. She still dreams of having a home separate from her parents, so she has opened a savings account to set aside the funds needed to achieve this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase security bars for her video arcade & motorcycle oil for her retail business

loans.name: Gaby Martha

texts.es:
Gaby 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su menor hijo el cual tiene 5 años de 
edad. Ella se inicio en el negocio de venta de golosinas en el Balneario de Huacachina 
hace 13 años de manera informal, primero con un capital pequeño producto de ahorros 
obtenidos, en la actualidad es miembro de la Asociación de Vendedores del Balneario de 
Huacachina, habiendo incrementado el negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella atiende el 
negocio de manera muy calida y amable ya que la gran mayoría de sus clientes son 
turistas que acuden a nuestro Oasis de América, el sueño de Gaby es construir su 
vivienda y así poderle brindar bienestar y seguridad a su menor hijo, el cual ya se 
encuentra en edad escolar. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales de 
construcción.
texts.en:
Gaby is a 51 year old single mother. She lives with her youngest son who is five years old and enrolled in school. Gaby started selling candy thirteen years ago as a street vendor at the Balneario de Huacahina, using her savings as her first source of capital. She is currently a member of the Vendors Association of Balneario de Huacachina and has worked hard to grow her business.

Gaby attends to her business in a warm and friendly manner. The vast majority of her customers are tourists who come to visit the Oasis of America. Her dream is to build a house and provide for her son’s security and well-being. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Test

texts.en: test

loans.use: test

loans.name: Chreng

texts.en: Mrs  Chreng C., 31, has worked as a professional chef for more than four years. She was been married for many years to Sokhunthea, 30,  who helps support the family by working as a blacksmith. The couple has two school-aged children who are dependent on their income. Chreng's husband has been engaged in his business for years, but he needs more accessories to perform his service. C. is therefore asking for a loan to buy a generator and other supply tools which will benefit her husband's business. (Mrs. C.'s husband appears in the photo above.)

loans.use: To buy a generator and other supply tools for her husband's business

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.ru:
Алымбекова Чынар – лидер данной группы. Чынар вместе со своей семьёй живёт в г. Балыкчи. Балыкчи входил в список бурно развивающихся городов республики. Здесь было построено много этажных домов, заводы работали, и город славился также рыбным промыслом. Однако последние годы экономического застоя сделали своё дело. Производство прекратилось, и жители начали покидать город. Чынар было нелегко, ведь надо было ещё четверых детей расти. Они с мужем решили остаться и искать поприще в городе. Вскоре Чынар удалось начать торговлю на рынке. Она начала торговать мукой и кормом. Муж Чынар начал работать таксистом. Сейчас они благополучно продолжают воспитывать своих детей. Старшая дочь учится на первом курсе в лицее. Вторая дочь – студентка колледжа. Восьмилетний сын уже ходит в школу. А младший, ему шесть лет, пока дома. За пятнадцать лет в бизнесе, Чынар многого добилась. Она вместе с мужем смогла купить дом, чтобы там организовать торговую точку. Также она смогла приобрести автомобиль. В данный момент её ежемесячный доход от торговли мукой и кормом для скота составляет от 10,000 ($220) до 15,000 сомов ($340). Старшие дочери уже подросли и после занятий, активно помогают матери вести торговлю. Сейчас Чынар нуждается в кредите. Она надеется получить кредит с целью вложить средства в оборот для покупки 10 мешков муки и 15 мешков корма для скота. В будущем Чынар хочет расширить бизнес и открыть продуктовый магазин. 

Партнёры Чынар по группе:

Жакиевой Кулуйпе пятьдесят семь лет. Муж Кулуйпы – пенсионер. Вместе вырастили одного сына. Кулуйпа также находится дома и живёт одной пенсией. Она давно хочет купить стиральную машину, однако требуется много времени, пока она соберёт деньги. Поэтому она надеется получить этот кредит. 

Токоевой Айнабу сорок три года. Муж Айнабу работает водителем на одном предприятии. У Айнабу двое детей. Один из сыновей работает монтёром. Второму всего два года. Айнабу изготовляет бозо (национальный напиток)  и сдаёт его в магазины. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить кухонный гарнитур. 

Исмаиловой Розе пятьдесят семь лет. Роза занимается скотоводством. Сейчас у неё есть одна корова с телёнком и семь овец. Муж Розы – учитель физики в средней школе. Роза обратилась за этим кредитом, с целью купить ещё одну тёлку с телёнком для откорма. Она хочет достроить дом и для этого ей нужно иметь как можно больше скота для продажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Chynar A. is the leader of this group. Chynar lives in the city of Balykchi together with her family. Balykchi used to be included among the fast-growing cities in the republic. Many multi-story buildings were built here, factories were operating, and the city was also known for its fishing industry. However, recent years of economic decline did their deed. Manufacturing stopped, and the citizens started leaving the city. It was difficult for Chynar because she still had to raise four children. Her husband and she decided to stay and find work in the city. Soon, Chynar was able to get involved in retail sales at the market. She started selling flour and livestock feed. Chynar’s husband began working as a taxi driver. Now, they successfully continue raising their children. The oldest daughter is in her first year of school. The second daughter is a college student. Their eight-year-old son already started school. And the youngest son, who is six, is home for now. Chynar achieved a lot during the fifteen years in her business. Together with her husband, she was able to purchase a house in order to organize a retail outlet there. She was also able to buy a car. Currently, her monthly income from flour sales and livestock feed ranges from 10,000 som ($220) to 15,000 som ($340). The oldest daughters have already grown up and actively help their mother with the sales after school. Now, Chynar needs a loan. She is hoping to obtain a loan in order to increase goods turnover and purchase of 10 bags of flour and 15 bags of livestock feed. In the future, Chynar wants to expand the business and open a food market. Chynar’s partners in this group are: Kuluypa D. is fifty-seven years old. Her husband is retired. Together they raised one son. Kuluypa also stays at home and relies solely on her pension for income. She has wanted to purchase a washing machine for a long time; however, it will take her some time to save money for this purchase. This is why she is hoping to obtain this loan. Aynabu T. is forty-three years old. Her husband works as a driver for one company. Aynabu has two children. One of the sons works as an electrician. The second one is only two years old. Aynabu prepares “bozo” (a traditional drink) and sells it to stores. She needs a loan in order to purchase a kitchen set. Roza I. is fifty-seen years old. She is involved in animal husbandry. She currently has one cow with a calf and seven sheep. Roza’s husband is a physics teacher at a secondary school. Roza requested this loan in order to buy one more cow with a calf for raising. She wants to finish building her house and, to achieve this goal, she needs to own as much livestock for sale as possible.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover by purchasing 10 bags of flour and 15 bags of livestock feed

loans.name: Balyesiima Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
K. Ssaka is the leader of his lending group in Mpigi. He is a hard-working man and married with 30 children, out of which 15 are still in school, as he takes care of orphans for his late brothers.

Ssaka is a multi-business man who is a farmer, he buys and sells coffee, he owns ginger and banana plantations, he buys and sells cows for meat, he has taxis for a transportation system, and he has rental houses as well as a retail shop. 

He is so proud to mention that he is able to do all that he does because he has been using loans from the Kiva field partner, Pearl Microfinance, for over thirteen years. The loans have also helped him to pay school fees for his children. He has also taught his children about running a business, and two of them now go to Dubai for merchandise. 

Ssaka needs a loan to help with repairing his car by buying an engine.

loans.use: Buying a car engine for better transport services.

loans.name: Rwenshama Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
K. Hope is 40 years old and married with five children. Two of them are in secondary school while three are in the primary section. 

Hope is a business lady with a grocery store that has been in existence for six years in Rwenshama trading centre. In her store, she buys and stocks fresh produce like vegetables, matooke (plantain), irish potatoes and so on, and from her transactions, she is able to make approximately $31 in weekly profits that enables her to take care of her family with the help of her husband. 

Hope needs a loan to help with buying more produce for resale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for resale.

loans.name: Elcard

texts.en:
Karanzi Elcard is 38 years old and married with four children, all of whom are in school. He also takes care of some of his siblings. 

Elcard is a farmer. Also, he has dealt in the sale of agricultural products like bananas from the Rutabago trading centre for ten years. He is able to make approximately $62 in profits each week. This helps to boost his business when he has no other source of income.

He has been able to take care of his family and educate his children. He has been getting loans through the Kiva field partner, Pearl Microfinance, for four years, and ever since he has not regretted the move he made. 

Elcard needs a loan to be able to buy more bananas for resale from his stall.

loans.use: Buying more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Obedi

texts.en:
A. Obedi is 32 years old and married with two children who are not yet in school because of their young age. 

He is a businessman involved in the buying and selling of charcoal that he gets from the villages and stocks for his customers in his stall. He has been in this kind of business for five years, and since he knows how to handle his customers, he is able to make approximately $77 in weekly profits that are enabling him to grow. 

As a result, he has been able to buy land and animals like cows and goats and so on. Obedi needs a loan to be able to stock more bags of charcoal for resale, since buying in bulk enables him to get goods at a reduced price.

loans.use: Buying more bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Aguli

texts.en:
Aguli L. is 28 years old and married to a journalist. She has three school-aged children. L. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread from home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene M. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Marlene is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Marlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 60000 PHP every four months or harvest season.

In 2008, Marlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Marlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 32000 PHP from ASKI. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anoma

texts.en:
Anoma is a very good business women, particularly because of her tailoring skills. She started her business in the year 2005.  Anoma wants to take loan of LKR 40,000. This loan is needed because she is wants to expand her business.  She has already employed 5 poor women and planning to create more employments with her expansion. 

Anoma wants to use her loan to purchase material for designing different cloths for sale. She is very hard working women and she knows how to achieve her goals. Anoma has a plan to create employment for 50 poor women within next 3 years. This is so that she can feel better by helping other women in the village and be proud of herself.  

She is 35 years old and married living with her husband and his family. She is blessed by one boy child who is going to school in the 4th grade.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine, cloths and other accessories

loans.name: Kabingo Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: K. Oliver who appears in the small photo is also part of the big photo and she is the leader of her lending group in Rukungiri. She is 54 years old and married with children, although most of them are now grown up. She helps to take care of her grandchildren. Oliver is a businesswoman with a grocery store in Kabingo trading center that she has run for 20 years. She buys and stocks fresh produce such as vegetables, matooke (a plantain dish), Irish potatoes, and so on, and from her transactions she is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profit. This enables her to take care of her family, with her husband's help. Oliver needs a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria V. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Gloria is married and has 1 school-age child. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 50000 PHP every four months or during harvest season.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Kyatoko Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: Bosco A., who appears in the small photo is also in the big photo and he is the leader of his lending group in Rukungiri. He is 41 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom are in school. He also takes care of two orphans. Bosco is a businessman with a grocery store in Kyatoko trading center that has run for 13 years. He buys and stocks fresh produce, such as vegetables, matooke (a plantain dish), Irish potatoes and so on. From his transactions, he is able to make 100,000 UGX as weekly profit. This enables him to take care of his family and pay his children’s school fees. Bosco needs a loan to buy more produce for resale.

loans.use: To buy more produce for resale

loans.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is 50 years old and a single mother of two children aged 18 and 24. Both her children go to school. She lives in her own two-roomed house with three other people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. At home Yudaya has access to electricity but no piped water. Her family eats three meals a day. Her three greatest expenses in the month are paying utility bills, her children's school fees, and rent for her business premises.
Yudaya fries food such as samosas and chapatti in Kasubi and sells them to all sorts of people. She works seven days a week and serves about 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for six years now. Her main challenges are seasonal fluctuations, the rainy season (which disturbs her a lot because she works from a muddy place which prevents customers from reaching her), and the ever-increasing prices of baking flour and cooking oil.
Yudaya has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now servicing her sixth loan. She has always worked with the same group of mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and be able to start a fully stocked bakery.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour and jerrycans of cooking oil

loans.name: Elinya

texts.en:
Elinya L. is 35 years old and married to a teacher. She has four school-aged children. Elinya is currently in the business of selling clothes, shoes and sandles at the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy new material to make bedsheets to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy two sewing machines for making bedsheets.

To make a living, Maryjane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maryjane has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maryjane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maryjane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 28,000 PHP from ASKI. Maryjane is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Maryjane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready-to-wear items like blouses, shirts and pants in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 31-year-old entrepreneur from the western coastal city of Mombasa. He runs a store, which on one side has general retail items like sugar, rice, and beans, and on the other side has vegetables. He is seeking a loan for KSH 40,000 to restock his store with rice, beans and sugar and continue selling vegetables, something he really loves doing. Omar employs one other person and is located in a commercial area, serving the residents of the Manjego and Kingorani dwellers. His biggest challenges are competition from other stores, racism and tribalism. 

Omar has had this store for five years. He also runs a "boda-boda" or motorcycle taxi business. He is married, and has two young children, ages 1 and 3 1/2 years. He would like to eventually start another shop in town, as well as being a wholesale supplier of rice and cereals to restaurants and other clients in town. 

Omar describes himself as honest and hardworking and he has good leadership skills.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans and sugar

loans.name: Erlinda's Group

texts.en:
Erlinda E. is from the town of Barangcuag Jones. She is 60 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is a native of Binangonan, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 42 years old, married and striving hard to help meet her family’s needs. At her age, she is seen as a strong and jolly person and firm in her desire to improve her standard of living.

In 2000, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She has utilized her loans for her primary business of selling jewelry and fashion accessories and her secondary business, a manicure and pedicure service. Since she became a member of ASHI, she has been able to maintain very good performance. She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 pesos to use as additional capital for both businesses.

She still dreams of having a durable and concrete house of her own and to save for her children’s future. Her greatest aspiration is that her children will be able to finish their schooling and find jobs.

loans.use: Additional working capital for selling jewelry and fashion accessories and for manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Aris Setya Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Aris Setia Wiguna is a  group who work at carving in the Balinese style. There are 10 members of the group, all of whom work as professional sculptors using teak wood as their primary raw material.  In addition to teak, the group also uses sand. The teak wood is used to make doors, windows, temples etc, as well as for custom-ordered carved motifs. 
 
The Aris Setia Wiguna group is coordinated by the group chairman I. Putu R., secretary I. Made A. and treasurer I.Ketut S.. This group requested additional capital for business purposes in the amount of Rp.20.000.000. Capital is managed jointly for the purpose of business and is used to purchase raw materials such as teak wood, sand, cement and tools. The work is done according with the tasks assigned by the head of the group. 

According to chairman Putu R., one set of doors and windows can sell for Rp.10.000.000 and the price could reach up to Rp.12.000.000.  A net profit of between Rp.1.000.000 - Rp.2.000.000 can be made on this item. In addition to their weekly salary, each member also earns extra money after the project work is completed.  
 
This loan will help the workers meet their daily necessities of life.

loans.use: To buy teak wood and materials for furniture making projects

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C. is a 38-year-old married woman living in a beautiful green place – the town of Binangonan in Rizal province. She has two children, both are elementary students. She and her husband have a positive outlook towards life. Among many goals in life, education is their priority for their two children.

This new loan of 19,000 Philippine pesos is for hog fattening business. She will buy four pigs, two sacks of feed, and supplements and vitamins for the pigs. She will also construct a small hut for her pigs to live in. Hog fattening is one of the best ways to support her family and lift her family out of poverty.

Her dream is to have a pig farm someday and to be a successful businesswoman. She is also dreaming of a beautiful concrete house.

loans.use: To pay for four pigs and for two sacks of feed, supplements and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 62 years old and married, with seven adult children. She has a farm in the Murang'a area of the Central Province of Kenya and she's been farming for over twenty years. She's a pig farmer but also earns some income from mixed farming. She says that the major challenges to her business are a lack of funds to buy animal feed and improve her pig sty.

She requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 48,920. She'll use 45,000 to buy pigs and the remaining 3,920 to subscribe to the medical aid that Juhudi offers its clients.

In the future, Annah hopes to improve and expand her pig sty so that it can hold more than fifty pigs. Through more investment in her pig farm, she believes she'll be able to eventually improve her homestead with a better house. She hopes that she can continue to be a Juhudi client, since she requires more assets to achieve her goal.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is a for-profit social enterprise focused on the economic development of Kenya. It has a unique approach to financing agribusiness value chains, from production of raw products to processing and delivery of goods: by providing asset financing and technical assistance funding to smallholder farmers and rural enterprises. This approach to poverty alleviation supports sustainable wealth creation in rural communities, establishes local engines of income generation, and generates employment, economic growth and dynamism as well as demand for inputs.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise

Though he is 60 years-old, he still dreams of prospering in his business so that he will be able to provide for the needs of his children and grandchildren. He started his business in 2003 and he continues to pursue his business because it helps him pay the daily expenses of his household. He would like to apply for a small loan of Php 13,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. in order to buy fishing materials and fish to resell in the town market.
