loans.use: To purchase rice for increasing his range of goods

loans.name: Wcsl Makama/mabanta Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the WCSL Makama/Mabanta Primary Schools. These schools, WCSL Makama and WCSL Mabanta, were established by the Wesleyan Church of Sierra Leone. Since both schools from the villages of Mabanta and Makama operate on the same payroll, they have merged to seek a loan from Kiva through SMT.

Teachers from these institutions, like many other teachers within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Fifty-four-year-old Solomon S. K. (right) is the head master at the school. He was born in a village called Rogbin. He is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are in Junior Secondary Schools II (JSS II) while the eldest is in a Teachers' Training College pursuing a Higher Teachers’ Certificate. With his share of the loan, he will buy house-building materials to complete the house-building project he has started.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: S. Nasiba is 45 years old. and lives in Isfara town. She is married and has three children. Nasiba processes and sells dried apricots in the central local market. She purchases dried apricots and processes them and is experienced in the business. Because Nasiba buys apricots wholesale, her prices are lower than regular market prices. She offers a wide assortment of dried apricots for clients of different means. All this allows Nasiba to make her business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for her family. Nasiba requests 1,000 USD which she is going to spend on purchasing more dried apricots to process and sell. Nasiba expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en: T. Shuhrat is a 29-year-old married man. With great sacrifice he works in farming, tending his crops, and at the same time processes dried apricots to sell. It is important to emphasize that he is the father of two children and is obligated to take care of them and provide all that they need. Now, Shuhrat is looking for the support of IMON International to obtain a loan which he will use to buy more dried apricots for processing and later selling. His dream is to improve his economic activity and for this he looks to the support of Kiva, trusting that he will receive the needed support. loans.use: To purchase more dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Via Nova Plus Group

texts.en:
Maxime M. is a leader of a Community bank named “Via Nova Plus”, which is composed of 26 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Maxime, 29, single, runs a cell phone booth. He has been in business since 1998. He is working hard because his ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area. As he wants to develop and diversify his business, he then decided to join one of Hope’s groups in January 2009. He is planning to use the next loan to purchase two dozen prepaid cards to resell in order to increase his working capital. He makes a profit of about $25 per day. Maxime has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase two dozen prepaid phone cards to resell at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Zinatou

texts.fr: Née en 1982, T. Zinatou réside depuis six ans à Lokokokoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin.  Mariée à IBRAHIM Zacharie, un chauffeur, Zinatou est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit avec ses enfants. Zinatou et son mari se partagent ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour participer aux dépenses familiales, Zinatou exerce comme activité principale la vente de maïs et de riz, et parallèlement à cela, la vente de savon. C’est à Kandi dans le nord du Bénin que Zinatou se ravitaille. Zinatou vend ses produits à Abattoir, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Zinatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école mais a déjà bénéficié de 2 crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés.  Zinatou souhaite diversifier ses activités mais ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est la raison pour laquelle Zinatou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Zinatou T., born in 1982, has been living in Lokokoumè, in Sèmè-Podji in Benin, for six years. She's married to Zacharie IBRAHIM, a taxi driver. She's the mother of two school-attending children. The couple lives with their children. Zinatou and her husband support the family expenses together. To help with the family expenses, Zinatou's main business consists in selling corn and rice, as well as soaps. She gets her supplies in Kandi, in North Benin, and sells her products in Abattoir, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Zinatou never attended school but already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. She would like to diversify her business but lacks financial means to do so. This is why she's seeking her third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and boxes of soaps

loans.name: Avazmat

texts.en:
A. Avazmat was born in 1964 and is married with two children. As an aspiring and hard-working man he has always dreamed of achieving success in whatever he does. Thus, when he joined IMON International, he was able to make a lot of progress with his previous loan, which he invested mostly in crop farming. Then, he saw a new business opportunity: rearing young cattle, which is very profitable because of the constant demand for meat at the market. Given this loan, Avazmat will purchase young cattle and feed for them to expand his business. He plans to use the profits from his business to educate his children, improve the structure of his home, and improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Their education is the most important inheritance Aziza and her husband can give to their two dear children. They are both very responsible parents, and they work very hard in agriculture and farming so that they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. This happy mother has been working in agriculture since getting married and, with the unconditional help of her husband, she buys and sells cattle in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, she now finds herself with more expenditures, and she would like a loan in order to increase their capital by increasing their production. Aziza and her family are waiting for your quick response.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: H. Joséphine est née en 1968 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Joséphine est mariée à HOUNGUEVOU Michel, un chauffeur, et est mère de cinq enfants, dont trois sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Joséphine vit depuis une dizaine d’année à PK 10 dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Joséphine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et assurer les charges qui lui reviennent, Joséphine mène comme activité, la vente de fruits au parc MIVVO à Sèmè-Podji. Joséphine vend également du maïs, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Adja au Mono, que Joséphine s’approvisionne. Joséphine exerce cette activité depuis 8 années et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. Joséphine a bien remboursé tous ces crédits. Très sollicitée par ses clients, Joséphine ambitionne renforcer son activité et agrandir son étalage afin de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante. C’est la raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Joséphine H. was born in 1968 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She's married to Michel HOUNGUEVOU, a driver, and she's the mother of five children, and she has to support three of them. All her children attend school. For about ten years, Joséphine has been living with her family in PK 10, in Sèmè-Podji. The couple supports the family expenses together. Joséphine never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells fruits at the MIVVO park in Sèmè-Podji. She also sells corn, which enables her to benefit from several income sources. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Adja, in Mono Department, Benin. Joséphine has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from three loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. She repaid these loans without problems. She's in high demand, and ambitions to bolster her business and expand her stall in order to meet an ever-increasing customer demand. This is why she's seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits (bananas, oranges, etc.) and corn

loans.name: Wickamanaya

texts.en:
Wickamanaya is a 59 year old spice manufacturer. She has one machine for spice making. She collects different types of raw material for spices from the local market and after grinding them, she makes separate packets of spices to sell to shops nearby.  

She has three daughters and one son.  Her husband and daughter also support her business.  Unfortunately she does not have sufficient money to continue her business, so she is asking for a loan of 30000 LKR to help grow her business.

loans.use: Buy raw material of spices

loans.name: Maïmounatou

texts.fr: Née en 1986, D. Maïmounatou est mariée à SADIKOU Kolawolé un transitaire, et est mère de trois enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit depuis 5 ans environs à Sèkandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. N’ayant jamais été à l’école, Maïmounatou mène comme activité, la vente de bouillie de maïs et de « tapioca » (fait à base de manioc), accompagnée de lait et du sucre, au parc DAS sur la route allant à Porto-Novo. Maïmounatou se ravitaille à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi à Parakou dans le Nord du Bénin. Il y a environs trois ans que Maïmounatou mène cette activité, activité qui lui génère des revenus qu’elle utilise pour subvenir à ses différents besoins. Maïmounatou a déjà obtenu deux prêts qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Actuellement, face à la demande de plus en plus importante de ses clients, Maïmounatou éprouve des difficultés pour satisfaire tous ses clients. Maïmounatou souhaiterait agrandir son activité et mieux faire face aux besoins des clients. C’est ce qui amène Maïmounatou à solliciter un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, D. Maïmounatou is married to SADIKOU Kolawolé, a forwarding agent, and is the mother of three children. All three children are enrolled in school. The family has been living for about 5 years in Sèkandji, in the township of Sèmè-Podji in Bénin. The couple share in supporting the household.

Never having been to school, Maïmounatou sells maize porridge and "tapioca" porridge (made of manioc) with milk and sugar, at the DAS truck stop on the road to Porto-Novo. Maïmounatou buys her ingredients in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and also in Parakou in the north of Bénin. She has been in this business for about 3 years, and the income from it is what she uses to support herself.

Maïmounatou has already received two loans that she correctly reimbursed to ALIDé. Presently, due to increasing demand from her clientele, Maïmounatou is having difficulty satisfying all their needs. She would like to expand her business so as to satisfy her customers. This is what leads her to ask for a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize, tapioca, sugar and milk

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Azimjon has loved animals. He has learned to raise them well so that he can market them. Azimjon is married and has three children to provide for. To support his family, he has to invest in his livestock business and, consequently, he's approached IMON International to apply for a loan that will allow him to purchase young cattle and feed for them and, in turn, increase his income from the milk, meat, horn, etc. that cattle provide.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Elva Maria

texts.es:
Elva María R. D. C., es una mujer activa que a sus 70 años vive y goza del Carnaval en su barrio Buenos Aires, donD. para esta época se respira el ambiente pintoresco D. las fiestas patrimonio más importantes D. la ciudad  y una D. las mas alegres del Colombia; esta es, el carnaval D. Barranquilla, que con su estilo popular y  libertario, refleja el espíritu jovial y creativo del Barranquillero y afirma su pertenencia al Caribe. 

DesD. que finalizan las fiestas naviD.ñas, Elva María con su hija disponen su mente, organizan su negocio y su casa con típicos adornos alusivos a esta tradición, donD. tiene presencia el mestizaje en todas sus manifestaciones populares, como si quisieran  recordar el origen remoto del Carnaval, que vino a América desD. España y que continua su espíritu D. renovación y cambio similar al que animó estas fiestas en Europa. 

Elva María además D. ser alegre, es una mujer emprendedora que elabora alimentos entre los cuales están los frituras, derivados D. la harina, arepas, caribañolas-amasijos D. yuca  y papa rellenos con carne y verduras-, que venD. en tiendas y también  D. manera individual a sus vecinos del barrio; ella tiene en su casa una miscelánea surtida D. productos D. papelería y accesorios variados que adornan a mujeres y niñas D. acuerdo a cada temporada del año. 

Su primer negocio nació D. la tradición D. su madre en la preparación D. estos mismos productos que ella ahora venD. y a los que ha agregado  la elaboración D.  los mas deliciosos postres, pues le encanta el arte D. la culinaria, actividad que nunca ha dejado D. realizar; ella también vendía Sancochos o sopas,  pero notó que muchas personas al verla prosperar, empezaron a a hacer lo mismo y decidió suspenderlo provisionalmente y abrir una miscelánea que organizó en su casa. Cuando se inició como negociante,  su esposo Joaquín C. viajaba mucho trabajando en una empresa Naviera  y el negocio la ayudaba a no sentirse sola; él ahora  está pensionado y disfruta  en su compañía D. una vida tranquila y feliz.
  
Elva, ha recibido tres créditos a través D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y los ha reembolsado oportunamente, porque los ha invertido en la compra D. mercancías para la miscelánea  e insumos para la preparación D. alimentos que en cada época le sugiere el mercado: la naviD.ña, carnavalera, Semana Santa etc. Con las utilidades producidas por el negocio ha logrado hacer reparaciones y adecuaciones en su vivienda; porque su esposo con el dinero D. la pensión por tiempo laboral concluido, asume los gastos por alimentación y servicios; la  unión D. ambos ingresos ha generado su éxito en el negocio. Su próximo crédito por valor D. $$2.000.000, lo utilizará en comprar mercancías para surtir la miscelánea con útiles escolares, planea  además vender refrescantes, exquisitos y saludables bolis- jugos congelados, elaborados con leche y frutas frescas, empacadas en bolsas plásticas-, estas serán las delicias que próximamente degustarán sus clientes para aliviar el calor corporal que genera  temperatura ambiente D. la Costa.

Su meta  familiar  a mediano plazo, es comprar un local en un sitio D. mas salida  comercial, pues en su casa debe sacar las vitrinas para  que la mercancía sea vista por los clientes; su meta a corto plazo es comprar  un  tricicarro D. perros calientes-triciclo con carpa, vaporera para panes y salchichas; insertos con tapa corrediza para cebolla, queso, papas, etc.; cubetas para las salsas, en acero inoxidable; con cava en poliestireno expandido forrada en acero inoxidable, y espacio interior para guardar el pan- el cual será instalado en la entrada D. su negocio ya reconocido por la venta D. alimentos y por hacer la fiesta D. disfraces mas esperada por los vecinos D. su barrio,  el famoso Lunes D. carnaval, tercer día D. estas fiestas, caracterizado porque desD. muy temprano suena el gran  PICK-UP, -amplia caja D. sonidos, con 6 bafles entre bajo y medio, 2 columnas, 3 maquinas D. 8 transistores,  un ecualizador, un modulo D. 3 CD, dos columnas para brillo- y el  grupo D. millo para animar esta reunión con música folclórica del Caribe. En este sector D. Barranquilla la ya reconocida “fiesta donD. los  Cuetos”,  apellido D. esta familia,   es el lugar D. encuentro D. sus vecinos  todos los años; ellos solo pagan el consumo D. alimentos y bebidas que Elva María ofrece a las familias que allí se congregan para hacer su gran rumba carnavalera y ella a su vez gana su dinerito y se goza su fiesta.
texts.en:
At 70 years of age, Elva María R. D. C. is an active woman who lives in the neighborhood of Buenos Aires. She enjoys Carnival season, the time of year when a picturesque atmosphere sets the background for the most important cultural festival in the city. The Carnival of Barranquilla is also one of the happiest occasions in Colombia. Its popular and carefree style reflects the youthful spirit and creativity of the people of Barranquilla, making it an essential part of the Caribbean.

Once the Christmas holidays are over, Elva María and her daughter begin organizing her home business with all the decorations pertaining to Carnival, a mixture of the modern with the more traditional type that reflects the event’s origins. The tradition of Carnival was brought to the Americas from Spain and continues to promote the spirit of renewal and change that inspired this holiday season in Europe.

In addition to being known for her cheerful personality, Elva María is an enterprising woman who prepares snacks such as fried foods maD. of flour, arepas (flatbread served with various fillings or toppings), and caribañolas (dumplings maD. of cassava and potato dough, stuffed with meat and vegetables). She sells these snacks to stores and individually to neighbors in her area. Elva María also has a retail shop in her home that is stocked with stationery and various seasonal accessories worn by women and girls.

Her snack business was a tradition passed on to her by her mother, who also prepared these same products for sale. Elva María has added the most delicious desserts to her offerings, as she loves the art of cooking. She also sells sancocho (a traditional soup), but she noticed that many people in the neighborhood started prospering, so she suspended selling food temporarily so that she could open and organize the retail shop in her home. When this business started, her husband Joaquin C. traveled frequently for work since he was employed by a shipping company. Running a home business helped to make her feel that she was not alone. Today, her husband is retired and enjoys a peaceful and happy life.

Elva María has received three previous loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and has repaid them all on time. She used the proceeds to purchase miscellaneous goods and supplies for preparing food at different times of the year: Christmas, Carnival season, Easter, etc. With the profits generated by her business, she has managed to make repairs and modifications to her home because her husband’s pension was used to pay for the completion of the work. This freed up her income to devote on other expenses such as food and services. Their joint incomes have also contributed to the success of her business. Her next loan in the amount of 2,000,000 COP will be used to stock her store with school supplies. She also plans to sell drinks, such as delicious and healthy juices, and popsicles maD. with milk and fruit and packed in plastic bags. Her customers will soon be able to taste these delightful treats in order to cool down from the high temperatures experienced on the Coast.

Elva María’s goal for her family in the midterm is to acquire a place at a commercial site so that she can use her home for storing the display cases that hold the merchandise displayed before customers. Her short-term goal is to buy a hot dog cart with a canopy; a bread and sausage steamer; inserts with lids for keeping onions, cheese, and potatoes; stainless steel containers for holding sauces; and an interior cupboard for storing bread. These items will be installed at the entrance of her business, which is already known for selling food and hosting the most anticipated costume party for the residents of the neighborhood, the famous “Lunes D. Carnaval” that occurs on the third day of Carnival season. The party starts with the appearance of a large pick-up truck equipped with a sound box, six loudspeakers, two columns, three machines, eight transistors, an equalizer, and a three CD disk changer. The group “El Millo” begins the festivities with traditional Caribbean folk music. In this district of Barranquilla, this annual neighborhood tradition is now known as “the Party with the Cuetos”, named after Elva María’s family. The attendees of this great rumba festival only pay for the food and beverages offered by Elva María, so she is able to enjoy the party and still earn a little money.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase refreshments & restock her store with school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Removed at borrower request

loans.use: purchase of children's outfits, hair extensions, and shoes for resale

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz is 50 years old and lives with his wife and their two children. He has the best intentions for his children and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer. Avaz is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work raising cattle. He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. His son (pictured) is also engaged in this business. The challenge is to improve the breed but in order to do so, Avaz must feed them properly. This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family’s standard of living. In order to do so he is asking for a loan which will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve their quality. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle of a better breed

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es:
Leonardo Fabio D. L. H. Barceló tiene 25 años y vive en el barrio Tajamares, del municipio D. Soledad cerca D. BarranquilL.. Se dedica a L. barbería y arrienda un pequeño lugar que ha adornado en un estilo D. muchos toques D. L. cultura afrocolombiana, pues manifiesta sentirse muy afrodescendiente por su herencia y por su infancia en un barrio muy afrocolombiano. Como es muy solicitado sus clientes suelen esperar un turno en L. barbería o en L. calle.  Su  mercado es joven y con el fin D. hacer su espera más agradable está solicitando un crédito  por valor D. $1.300.000 para comprar un equipo, televisor, un espejo, un altavoz y para hacer un pequeño baño. En suma, todo lo necesario para atraer a más clientes.
Dice que empezó desD. muy pequeño cuando los tres hombres D. L. casa, su padre, su hermano y él,  se motilaban a crédito. Su padre al recibir L. pensión D. vejez, pensó en qué cosas necesitaba y compró una máquina rasuradora y a partir D. ese momento inició sus primeras experiencias D. barbero con su familia y  vecinos cercanos; Una vez perfeccionó su arte comenzó a cobrar $1.000; así  poco a poco L. gente D. L. manzana fue localizándolo e inició  un servicio a domicilio en el año 2002 para mas tarD. en el 2008 arrendar su propio local.
 Aunque estudió análisis y programación D. computador, no lo ejerce porque tiene mucho cariño a L. peluquería. Es una persona trabajadora que ha comprado cada una D. sus herramientas con  esfuerzo propio y sus horarios desD. las 8 D. L. mañana hasta las 10 D. L. noche no han cambiado su carácter D. ser amable y conversador.
Está agradecido con L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo porque ha ido ampliando su vida crediticia; y pudo reemplazar los créditos D. agiotistas, con los que pagaba porcentajes muy altos y no ganaba nada. Su meta es estudiar inglés porque es muy visitado por extranjeros, especialmente norteamericanos e italianos, en épocas específicas como L. del Carnaval y con ello poder comunicarse mejor y aprovechar mayores oportunidades en el mercado globalizado. Además Leonardo sueña con un lugar más granD. para contratar a empleadas  que trabajen en manicure, pedicura y cortes D. mujer.
texts.en:
Leonardo Fabio D. L. H. Barceló is 25 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Tajamares, which is part of the city of Soledad near BarranquilL.. He operates a barber shop in a small rented space adorned with many touches of Afro-Colombian culture that represent his African heritage and childhood influences growing up in an Afro-Colombian neighborhood. His services are so much in demand that he often has a line of customers waiting in the barber shop or out in the street. His customers are mostly young people, so in order to make the wait more enjoyable, Leonardo is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 COP to buy a sound system, television, a mirror, a speaker, and pay to have a small lavatory installed. All of these items are needed to attract more customers.

When Leonardo was much younger, there were three men living at home: his father, his brother, and himself. They cut each other’s hair. His father, who receives an old age pension, thought of what things are needed to start a barber shop, so he bought an electric shaver. Leonardo started cutting hair for relatives and next-door neighbors. Once he perfected his technique, he began charging 1000 COP. Over time, people from the block approached him about starting a home service, which he did in 2002. Later on, in 2008, he started renting his own location.

Leonardo studied computer programming and analysis, but he decided not to pursue this field because he enjoys being a barber. He is a hard worker who bought each of his tools as a result of his efforts. His work schedule is from 8am until 10pm and has not changed. He is known for being a friendly conversationalist.

Leonard is grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for increasing his line of credit. The loans from FMSD replaced the ones he obtained from informal moneylenders, who charged high rates that left him earning nothing. His goal is to learn English because Colombia is visited by foreigners, mainly North Americans and Italians, especially during Carnival season. He wants to develop better communication skills and take advantage of opportunities in the global market. Leonardo also dreams of having a larger space so that he can hire employees to proviD. manicures, pedicures, and women’s haircuts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a small lavatory & purchase sound equipment, television, speaker, and mirror for his waiting area

loans.name: Couronne Plus Group

texts.en:
“Couronne Plus” is a group of 32 owners of small businesses chaired by Patience. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Patience sells lamp oil and clothes. She became a micro entrepreneur in 2004, in the southeast province. She has already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy 10 liters of lamp oil. Currently she earns a profit of $120. Patience is 41 years old, married and the mother of eight children aged 4 to 22. All of them attend school.

loans.use: To purchase 10 liters of lamp oil and some clothes to resell in order to increase her working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema A. is an entrepreneurial woman, who is married with three school-aged children. She runs a food stuffs shop at Tungi Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of food stuff at her shop. She purchases the goods direct from the wholesalers and retail shops at Ferry and Kariakoo city market shopping center. She sells maize flour, wheat flour, beans, sugar, ground nuts, rice and cashew nuts. She meets her family's daily demand from the business income. She plans to open another shop for business diversification once she gets enough funds. She needs a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more business goods.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad has worked in publicity and advertising since 2002. He’s 30 years old, and married with one young child. He takes publications and prints them at a printer he works with. His business has developed remarkably over the years and he feels thankful because he is able to raise his family alone. Today, Jihad is requesting $1,200 to expand his business by buying a car for easier transportation to the customers he works with.

loans.use: To buy a car for easier transportation to his customers.

loans.name: Patricia Esther

texts.es:
En la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, hay un sitio muy cercano al Estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla, donde se respira el Futbol y vecinos alegres y solidarios que se cuidan entre si, ese es el barrio donde habita Patricia H. A., una joven de 32 años que desde temprana edad le ha gustado ser independiente, por eso inició desde su casa un negocio de elaboración de bolis o bebida congelada y empacada en bolsas plásticas, preparada naturalmente con las mas deliciosas frutas tropicales de nuestra región: la guayaba, el mango, la guanábana, el  coco, el banano, la piña  entre otras. Con estos refrescantes productos conocieron a Patricia en la comunidad, gradualmente fue atrayendo la oferta de  empresas en la comercialización de mercancías a través de guías especializadas; fue así como inició la venta de estas mercancías, visitando clientes a quienes mostraba los productos exhibidos en el catalogo y estos a su vez lo seleccionaban  para que Patricia se lo llevara a la puerta de su casa e iniciaba con ellos un  plan de pagos a crédito con una cuota inicial. En este momento el único capital que soportaba este segundo negocio era el producido por los bolis y casi siempre se quedaba corta en responder con mercancías a sus clientes; fue entonces cuando Ana, su vecina y amiga, percibiendo su capacidad emprendedora y su ya reconocido sentido de responsabilidad en el barrio, le recomendó acercarse a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para que la apoyaran con un crédito y desde entonces no ha dejado de participar en los programas de esta entidad, ella reconoce que este ha sido un capital adicional que ha mejorado su oferta de productos en cantidad y en calidad.
  
A Patricia siempre le ha gustado ser independiente, su cónyuge es policía y  tienen dos hijos menores de edad; su esposo y su cuñada que es docente, le ayudan a seleccionar sus clientela entre sus amigos de trabajo es decir los que mejor pagan;  ella también compra calzado, prendas de plata, oro golfi, electrodomésticos que no están en la guía de productos y que le piden sus clientes; esta es la razón por la cual ellos la prefieren y su negocio se ha extendido, ya que siempre les vende lo que estos le encargan; su actual aspiración es obtener un crédito por valor de $2.000.000 para comprar prendas de plata y de oro a solicitud  de los mas rentables.

Para esta joven mujer, el tener un negocio le ha fortalecido su carácter independiente, con sus utilidades ella paga la seguridad social y puede incluir a sus padres; tiene una hermosa  y ordenada vivienda, producto del interés de su esposo y  de ella por vivir cada día mejor; ha logrado también hacer optimas adecuaciones en su casa, como los pisos, la puerta, los closets; le encanta su esposo porque él no limita su capacidad de soñar ni sus decisiones de inversión, pues él reconoce que todo le da un resultado exitoso. 

Patricia H. es una mujer polifacética, ama el trabajo que realiza, por eso también participa en actividades, que apoyan la seguridad alimentaria de familias pobres y estimulan el mejoramiento y la recuperación en los niveles de nutrición de niños con dificultades alimenticias o expuestos a ella; allí de la mano de una organización ubicada cerca de su vivienda, realiza  acciones formativas y enseña a identificar como conseguir alimentos a madres y personas responsables de menores en riesgo alimentario; ha participado en programas de siembra de huertas en los patios de familias especiales,  labores mencionadas con la que obtiene algunos ingresos adicionales que fortalecen  el desarrollo  familiar, pues su sueño está proyectado en ofrecer estudios profesionales y especializados a sus hijos y respecto a su negocio planea desarrollar una infraestructura sólida que le permita desde su vivienda tener  exhibidores y contratar personas a las que pueda pagar un salario que beneficie a su familia.
Uno de los retos que ha enfrentado fue cuando se presentaron problemas de salud en su familia y  se quedó sin capital teniendo que empezar nuevamente;  Patricia H. es una excelente miembro de familia, conciente de sus obligaciones morales y con una gran capacidad de riesgo calculado que hacen de ella una mujer con una enorme proyección futura.
texts.en:
In the July 20th neighborhood tenement, there is a place near the Metropolitan Stadium in Barranquilla where soccer games are played and the neighbors are happy and supportive of one another. This place is the neighborhood where Patricia H. A. lives. She is 32 years old and has enjoyed being independent from a young age. Patricia started a home business making popsicles and frozen drinks packed in plastic bags. Her products are prepared naturally and consist of the most delicious tropical fruits of the region including guava, mango, soursop, coconut, banana, and pineapple. By serving these refreshments, Patricia became known in the community and gradually attracted business before she was presented with an opportunity to start selling general merchandise through specialized guides. She eventually started her new retail business in which she visited customers to demonstrate the products shown in the catalog prior to taking their orders. Patricia delivers the goods to the homes of her customers and started offering credit payment plans that require an initial down payment. At the moment, her only source of capital for this second business comes from selling popsicles. However, she was always short of the funds needed to fulfill her customers’ orders. It was at this point that Ana, a friend and neighbor, took note of her entrepreneurship and suggested that she visit Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a loan. Since then, she has continued to participate in the programs offered by the organization. The additional capital issued to Patricia has improved both the quantity and quality of her product offerings.

Patricia’s husband is a policeman and they have two dependent children. Her sister-in-law is a teacher and helps find customers among her friends at work who are more likely to pay. Patricia also sells shoes, silver plated ornaments, imitation gold, and appliances that are not offered in her product catalog but requested by her customers. For this reason, her customers prefer to buy from her, which has led to an expansion of her business since Patricia is willing to sell them whatever they need. Her current goal is to obtain a loan of 2,000,000 COP to buy silver and gold ornaments since these items are the most profitable.

For Patricia, having a business means establishing her status as an independent woman. With her earnings, she is able to pay Social Security so that she can support her parents and still maintain a beautiful and orderly home. This is a by-product of the willingness of her and her husband to live a better life each day. They have been able to make optimal improvements to their home by adding floors, doors, and closets. Patricia loves her husband because he does not limit her ability to dream or make investment decisions. He acknowledges that her choices have resulted in successful outcomes.

Patricia H. is a multifaceted woman. She enjoys her work, but she also participates in activities that support the feeding of the poor and encourage improving the nutritional levels of children who do not have enough to eat. Patricia lends a hand to an organization near her home that identifies mothers and guardians of children at risk and teaches them about proper nutrition. She has participated in programs that plant gardens in the yards of families with special needs. The revenue generated from this program goes to fund programs that strengthen family development. Her dream is to provide specialized training to educators and other professionals who work with children. As for her business, she wants to develop a solid program in which exhibitors can sell from their home and then hire employees and pay them a wage that will allow them to support their families. One of the challenges she faces is the existence of health problems in her family. She ran out of capital and is now having to rebuild. Patricia is an integral member of her family who is aware of her moral obligations. She has a great capacity for taking calculated risks necessary to map out her future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold and silver plated ornaments requested by her customers

loans.name: Berebedwa

texts.en:
Berebedwa A. M. is fifty years old, single, and has five children. Her business is located at Mukumu near a hospital and a busy market in Kakamega.

For the last fifteen years, Berebedwa has been engaged in her business of selling doughnuts and chips (french fries) to the local people. Her major challenge has been the low purchasing power of her customers. However she is using her loan to purchase milk for sale as well as more potatoes and chips.

Berebedwa hopes to expand her business and catch a larger market. She also hopes to purchase a plot for herself. She is a hardworking and visionary woman.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, potatoes and milk

loans.name: Gamage

texts.en: Gamage C. is a 42 year old woman.  She has one son and one daughter. She is lives with her husband. She started her retail business three years ago.  She wants to develop her business but she does not have enough money to purchase sellable items. If she can get sufficient money, she will increase her daily sales and can get more profit.  To make these purchases, she needs 30000 LKR for her business.

loans.use: grocery items such as rice, spices, etc.

loans.name: Neila Rosa

texts.es:
Neila E. D. García tiene 69 años y siete hijos entre las edades D. 35 y 50 años. Vive en el   barrio Cachimbiro, cuna D. un antiguo  asentamiento D. indígenas  que usaban cachimbo,  una pipa en tagua y madera  elaborada por artistas naturales D. origen afrocolombianos.
A sus 69 años, es una mujer D. conversación graciosa y concurrente, que no deja D. trabajar porque siempre desea mejorar su casa con autonomía y comprar los muebles y electrodoméstico que por su uso constante hay que cambiar. Por eso  Neila elabora confecciones D. uniformes para enfermeras y ropa blanca, mediante contratos y trabaja sobre medidas, es decir sus clientes llevan la tela y ella toma las medidas e interpreta y diseña la moda solicitada D. acuerdo a como cada cual desee vestir.  
Neila tiene una máquina y debe mandar a filetear los vestidos,  inició nuevamente  su negocio hace cuatro años pues lo había suspendido por que la atención D. sus siete hijos y los excesos en  sus horarios deterioraron su salud; en su antiguo negocio cosía overoles y uniformes D. hombres  en volúmenes. Ahora con su esposo ya pensionado y sus hijos trabajando, realiza esta labor mas relajadamente, ella no quiere dejar D. coser pues conoce este arte desD. los 17 años, lo estudió en una academia D. modistería, cerca a su casa, antes D. casarse. 
Este es su segundo crédito que le permitió reiniciar su negocio con la ayuda D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, conoció a esta organización a través D. la compañera D. trabajo D. su hija, una enfermera y ahora su codeudora.  Actualmente Solicita un crédito D. $2.000.000 para comprar una maquina fileteadora, que dará un mejor acabado a sus prendas y no tendrá que pagar mas por este servicio.
Su negocio  D. confecciones le permite apoyar los ingresos D. su hogar donD. vive con su esposo,    un pensionado D. Avianca y una hija soltera que le ayuda en  los ingresos al igual que sus otros hijos que ya no están con ella. Su meta es reemplazar muebles D. la casa y comprar unos buenos electrodomésticos, como una lavadora, estos ala ayudarà a hacer su dia a día más fácil y su ambiente doméstico agradable.
Neila vive una vida mas tranquila, ama a su familia y a su tierra Soledad reconocida nacionalmente por ser el cuna D. la butifarra, embutido D. Origen Catalan que es una D. las insignias culinarias D. la Costa Caribe que aun persiste.
texts.en:
Neila E. D. García is 69 years old and has seven children who range in age from 35 to 50. She lives in the neighborhood of Cachimbiro, which is an ancient indigenous settlement. This area is known for the use of the “cachimbo”, a tobacco pipe maD. of ivory and wood maD. by native artists of Afro-Colombian origin.

Neila is a gracious woman who enjoys conversation. At 69 years of age, she does not stop working because she wants to make improvements to her home on her own. She plans to purchase new furniture and appliances because her current items need to be replaced because of constant use. In order to earn money, Neila produces nurses’ uniforms and bed linens through contracts and by direct request. Her customers bring her the material and she takes measurements to determine the design of the uniform. She also takes into consideration how the person wants to dress.

Neila has a sewing machine, but she still has to send out dresses for overlock stitching (in order to finish the edges). She restarted this business four years ago. Neila had stopped working in order to take care of her seven children and also her excessive schedule took a toll on her health. In her previous business, she manufactured overalls and men’s uniforms in mass quantity. Now that her husband is retired and her children are working, Neila is more relaxed when she works. She has no plans to quit because she has been sewing since she was 17 years old. Prior to getting married, she studied dressmaking at an academy near her home.

With this second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Neila will be able to restart her business. She learned about the organization from a co-worker of her daughter, who is a nurse and the co-signer of this loan. The proceeds in the amount of 2,000,000 COP will be used to buy an overlock stitching machine, which will allow her to finish the seams of her garments without having to pay extra for this service.

The income generated from Neila’s apparel business enables her to maintain the home where she lives with her husband, who is a pensioner of Avianca (the national airline of Colombia). One of her unmarried daughters also lives with them and helps with the expenses. Her other children contribute as well. In addition to replacing the furniture, Neila wants to buy some durable appliances, such as a washing machine, that will make her daily chores easier and her home more pleasant. Neila has a very peaceful life. She loves her family and her hometown of Soledad, which is nationally recognized for being the birthplace of “butifarra”, a sausage of Catalan origin that is a specialty of Caribbean coastal cuisine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an overlock stitching machine

loans.name: Adela Esther

texts.es:
Adela Esther B. G. con sus 51 años es la estilista en belleza mas conocida en el barrio Simon Bolívar de la Ciudad  de Barranquilla, considerado uno de las infraestructura mas integrales por su amplia cantidad de servicios alrededor de un amplio  boulevard, entre los que se encuentran  establecimientos  comerciales, zonas deportivas escolares, lugares de oración, unidades de servicios financieros y amplia ruta de transporte publico. Los Habitantes de este barrio,  se sienten muy orgullosos pues aseguran que en este amplio boulevard,  Cinco colombianos y tres alemanes tuvieron la idea de construir una Tarabita entre la costa y el interior de Colombia y funcionó la Sociedad Colombo-Alemana de Transportes Aéreos, SCADTA, y posteriormente AVIANCA haciendo de Barranquilla  la cuna de la aviación civil en el mundo.
 Adela, estudió enfermería y luego belleza, actividad que le satisface personalmente pues ofrece servicios de embellecimiento y cuidado estético  en una  pequeña sala de su local, donde realiza  peinados, cortes de cabello masculino, femenino e infantil, manicure y pedicure.  Maneja simultáneamente un servicio de llamadas telefónicas al público. En el hogar de Adela todos participan en negocios;  asi como su esposo que cuando se quedó sin trabajo inició su actividad de mensajería independiente y al mismo tiempo comercializa alimentos. Tiene cinco hijos entre las edades de 31 y 17;  todos han estudiado: los tres más jóvenes todavía están en la universidad y los demás ya trabajan. Adela aprecia mucho la educación de sus hijos y su sueño siempre ha sido que ellos estudien para que sean independientes, autosuficientes y autosuficientes, con este fin los educó. Precisamente para cumplir esta meta quiere un crédito con el cual pagar la universidad de su hija que estudia en el 5º semestre de Salud Ocupacional y que también ayuda en las actividades de su microempresa.
Adela ya lleva tres años acompañada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se enteró de ella a través de un cliente que la vio muy limitada  y le recomendó un crédito. Dice que desde entonces se siente despajada porque compraba a crédito y ahora puede comprar de contado y en mayores cantidades que salen más económicas aunque requieran más dinero. Es más, puede vender insumos de peluquería a sus clientes, que ayuda en el crecimiento de su negocio. Le gusta ser cliente de la fundación porque no ha tenido problemas con ella y las cuotas son cómodas.
No siente haber tenido muchas dificultades en su negocio, porque desde el comienzo ha sido muy exitosa. Le ayuda la ubicación de su peluquería  en el barrio Simón Bolívar pues se encuentra justamente al pie del boulevard comercial, que concentra un gran tráfico de personas y múltiples transporte. Ahora está pensando en agrandar su peluquería porque el espacio no le permite emplear a más de una empleada.
texts.en:
Adela Esther B. G. is 51 years old and a well-known beauty stylist in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, which is considered to have one of the most comprehensive infrastructures. It offers a wide range of services including shops, sports venues, places of worship, financial service institutions, and an extensive public transportation route. The residents of the neighborhood are very proud that they were able to secure these amenities. Five Colombians and three Germans had the idea to build a bridge between the coast and the Colombian interior. This led to the start of Colombo-German Air Transport Society (or SCADTA), which later became Avianca, thereby making Barranquilla the birthplace of civil aviation in Latin America.

Adela studied nursing and then cosmetology. She personally finds the beauty sector to be more satisfying personally. Adela provides styling and aesthetic care services such as haircuts (for men, women, and children), manicures, and pedicures from her small location. At the same time, she manages a public telephone service. Everyone in her family participates in the business. Her husband lost his job and started an independent messaging service while selling food. They have five children between the ages of 17 and 31. All of them attended school, but the three youngest children are still in college while the others are already working. Adela is thankful that her children have the opportunity to pursue an education because her dream has always been for them to be independent, self-reliant, and self-sufficient, and an education has allowed them to achieve this goal. She is requesting a loan to pay the college expenses of her daughter, who is studying in her fifth semester of Occupational Therapy and also helps with the family microenterprise activities.

Adela has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for three years. She learned about the organization from a one of her customers who she saw on a limited basis and suggested that she apply for a loan. Adela is opposed to buying anything on credit, but now she can make cash purchases and also acquire supplies cheaper and in large quantities even though it may require spending more money. As a stylist, she is able to sell hair products to her customers, which helps to grow her business. She enjoys being a client of the Foundation because she has not experienced any problems and her loans have been manageable.

Adela has not had many difficulties in her business because she experienced success from the very beginning. It helps that her beauty shop is located in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood because of the number of passing vehicles and presence of heavy foot traffic from the commercial boulevard. She is now planning to expand her salon because there is not enough space to accommodate more than one employee.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her daughter's college expenses

loans.name: Alfredo Evelio

texts.es:
Alfredo, desde que naciò conoce perfectamente el tèrmino viceras,  es decir organo de Ganado para hacer los mas exquisitos platos de la comida colombiana,panza,corazon, higado, riñones y pulmon;   èl lo aprendiò tradicionalmente de su padre de quien dice es el “mondonguero mayor” que significa vendedor de panza que montado en un asno ofrece estos productos. 
Alfredo como su padre tambien practica este oficio, pero ahora lo hace en un bicicoche donde ademas de hacer ejercicios,  gana dinero vendiendo viceras  recorriendo la zona  alrededor del barrio Galan de Barranquilla, sitio donde esta ubicada su vivienda. Trabaja como un experto  cortador  carnico,  tiene 12 años de haber iniciado su negocio y le gusta vender estos produtos porque con ellos se preparan los mas exquisitos platos de la comida colombiana: por ejemplo las sopas  de mondongo que es la sopa de panza cortada en cuadritos a la cual agregan papa, yuca maiz,veduras frescas , clavito de olor, sal al gusto y hasta pezuña o medula de Ganado.
Es usual para alfredo, vestirse con su bata blaca y gorra e ir diariamente al Mercado desde las 4:00 a.m. a comprar viceras en su bicicoche, luego recorre mas de 6 barrios con su cuchillo afilado,  2 neveras de polietireno , un balanza  y una Madera donde se afirma para cortar y vender por libras sus productos, porque Alfredo vende al detal a mas de 150 clientes diarios, algunos son atendidos por su padre que ya no va en asno, sino en un vehiculo similar al de èste  y con quien divide la zona de trabajo.  Ellos dos son muy reconocidos  porque los clients saben que venden viceras de calidad , frescas y no los engañan en el pesaje.
El dice que  conociò a la Fundaciòn  Mario Santo Domingo, o a la Mario como cariñosamente la llaman, porque todos en el barrio saben que tienen programas de credito, capacitaciòn y tambien de vivienda. Este es su Segundo credito y aspira a obtener financiamiento por $1.000.000 a èl para agregar un nuevo producto a su oferta, este es la carne por la que sus clientes le preguntan constantemente y tambien  comprarà de contado viceras en mayor cantidad.Alfredo vive en la casa paterna con su esposa y sus hijas de 3, 6 y 15 años respectivamente; el sueña con tener su casa propia para verlas crecer como personas independientes  y estudiosas, por eso se esfuerza diariamente para que su esposa, se dedique personalmente y muy de cerca su cuidado educaciòn.
Su màximo deseo es poner un punto de venta bien dotado y contratar empleados para èl poder extenderse a diversos barrios, porque a los clients les gusta que le lleven a la puerta de su casa estos productos, especialmente a los pensionados con quien tiene mucha acogida y estan sentados en la puerta de su casa esperando a Alfreso para tener con quien conversar, asi muchas veces se demora porque  es un buen escucha y muy paciente. Esto hace que su  aceptaciòn sea ràpida en la comunidad donde incursiona.
Describe al barrio Galan como un lugar donde vive gente tranquila,  los vecinos se cuidan los unos a los otros y sobre todo cuando saben que cargan  dinero producto de las ventas, asi ellos estàn pendientes de Alfredo y eso le gusta.
Alfredo V. es un buenagente como dicen sus vecinos, el  siempre està dispuesto a colaborar y a continuar recorriendo alegremente en su bicicoche las calles de Barranquilla para mantener a su familia y mejorar cada dia su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
From a very young age, Alfredo was fully aware of viscera, the internal organs of livestock used in making the most exquisite Colombian dishes. These include the stomach, heart, liver, kidneys, and lungs. He learned this tradition from his father, who is known as “El Mondonguero Mayor” (The Great Tripe Seller) and travels by donkey to sell his products.

Alfredo followed in his father’s footsteps, except he uses a bicycle cart to sell his goods. He earns his living traveling through the area near his home in the neighborhoods surrounding Galan de Barranquilla to sell internal organs. Alfredo is known as an expert meat cutter and has been in this profession for twelve years. He enjoys working with these products because they are staples in many of the dishes that make up Colombian cuisine. For example, tripe is used in a lot of soups when combined with potatoes, cassava, corn, fresh vegetables, cloves, and salt to taste. Some recipes even call for the hoof and bone marrow of the cow.

Alfredo’s usual schedule is to travel to the market every day at 4am, dressed in a white apron and cap, to buy internal organs to stock his bicycle cart. Later he travels to more than six neighborhoods with his sharp knife, two styrofoam ice chests, a scale, and a butcher block so that he can begin cutting and selling his products by the pound. Alfredo serves more than 150 customers each day, some of whom were previous patrons of his father. Since Alfredo has his own mode of transportation, he and his father decided to divide the sales territory. They both are well-recognized by their customers and known for the quality and freshness of their products. In addition, they have an honest reputation since they don’t cheat when weighing the goods.

Alfredo learned about Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo (or simply “Mario” as he likes to call it) from everyone in the neighborhood because of the credit programs, training seminars, and housing services that it offers. This is his second loan and he hopes to obtain financing of 1,000,000 COP to acquire more products for his business. These include the meats that his customers request on a frequent basis as well as internal organs he plans to buy in bulk. Alfredo lives in his father’s home with his wife and their three daughters (age 15, 6, and 3 respectively). His dream is to have his own house and see his children grow up to become independent and studious individuals. For this reason, he and his wife strive daily on a personal level because they care deeply about their daughters’ education.

Alfredo’s greatest wish is to open a well-stocked vending location and hire employees to travel to different neighborhoods because his customers enjoy having his products delivered to their front door. This service is especially popular among pensioners who are sitting at their front door waiting to strike up a conversation with Alfredo. There have been several occasions in which he was delayed in making deliveries because he is a good listener and very patient with his customers. His services are accepted rapidly in areas where he has not visited before.

The neighborhood of Galan is a place where the residents live peacefully. The neighbors look after one another and know what other people are being charged when making purchases. For this reason, they are loyal to Alfredo and he enjoys having their trust.

Alfredo V. is an outstanding gentleman who is well-spoken of by his neighbors. He can always be found traveling happily through the streets of Barranquilla in his bicycle cart so that he can continue supporting his family and improving their standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat & viscera in large quantities

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.en: Ousmane S., aged 29, runs a small metal workshop in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies. He has run the small “atelier” (workshop) since 2003, and says he enjoys the work. With the loan of 100,000 FCFA, Mr. S. will be able to purchase the materials to complete the work on five large metal doors currently in progress. These doors can take many weeks to complete, and are quite expensive. Mr. S. is married and the father of a two year old, but also supports his extended family. This is his third loan from U-IMCEC.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en: Mr. Moussa B. started out as a “taximan” (taxi driver) 7 years ago, at the age of 20, after being introduced to the job by his older brother. Moussa lives and works in the city of Thies, some 50 miles from the capital Dakar. In 2005, Moussa was able to purchase his own taxi, and has been driving for himself ever since. With the loan of 300,000 FCFA he would like to fix up his car to make it newer looking and more comfortable for his customers.  The majority of the loan will go to buying four new doors and having them painted. This is the second loan for Mr. B..

loans.use: Taxi repair

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Steven B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called United We Stand. He is 42 years old and is married with 5 children aged 4-18 years old and their educational levels are kindergarten-10th grade. Steven and his family live in a factory community, but he works in the largest market of Liberia, which is located in Paynesville, near Monrovia, Liberia. He could not continue his education through 9th grade due to poverty.

Steven’s business is the sale of plastic materials. He buys his goods from wholesalers and sells retail from a table in the market in Paynesville. He has been running this business for 13 years and hopes to get into the real estate business in the near future. He started selling with 500.00 Liberian Dollars that was given to him by his friends as working capital.

Steven sells clean and good plastic materials in order to attract more customers to buy from him. He needs this loan to purchase more plastic materials for resale to improve his business. Steven dreams of building another house for his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Steven is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts an emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more plastic materials for resale to improve his business.

loans.name: Monohari

texts.en: Monohari D. is a 46 years old woman. She has a son and two daughters. She lives with her family.  She has a restaurant that is situated on the main town of Kakanadura.  At this point in the business, she has four employees. She wants to expand her restaurant now, so she needs a loan of 60000 LKR to develop her restaurant.

loans.use: Buy rice,Fish,Meat,vegetable and spices.

loans.name: Papa

texts.fr: Mr. Papa G., aged 62, is a retired railroad worker, living in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies.  Thies, a city about 70km from Dakar, is known as the railroad capital, as it was an important junction on the Dakar-Niger railroad line.  After his retirement, Mr. G. used his savings to purchase a Peugeot 605 station wagon, known commonly as a “sept-place” (seven seats).  The sept-place is a common form of long distance transport, often more convenient than a bus.  Mr. G. hired a young relative to drive the sept-place for him.  With the loan of 400,000 FCFA, Mr. G. will make repairs to the vehicle to insure its long life.  Mr. G. is married and the father of ten children, eight of whom are now adults.
texts.en:
Mr. Papa G., aged 62, is a retired railroad worker, living in the Medina Fall neighborhood of Thies. Thies, a city about 70 km from Dakar, is known as the railroad capital, as it was an important junction on the Dakar-Niger railroad line. After his retirement, Mr. G. used his savings to purchase a Peugeot 605 station wagon, known commonly as a “sept-places” (seven seats). The 'sept-places' is a common form of long distance transport, often more convenient than a bus. Mr. G. hired a young relative to drive the 'sept-places' for him. With the loan of 400,000 FCFA, Mr. G. will make repairs to the vehicle to insure its long life. Mr. G. is married and the father of ten children, eight of whom are now adults.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his 'sept-places' long distance taxi

loans.name: Binetou

texts.en: Ms. Binetou M., aged 46, has been a commercante (vendor) since her youth, being influenced by her parents. She sells fabrics and shoes, which she buys in large quantities and sells them to smaller boutiques. In general, she sells her goods on credit, allowing her customers more flexibility.    Most of her merchandise she buys from Nouakchott, the capital of neighboring Mauritania, where prices are significantly lower. However, the voyage takes a minimum of 10 hours each way, so her clients are happy to buy from her instead of making the trip themselves. This is the third loan for Ms. M.. She is married and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 18.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and shoes in Mauritania

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of traditional goods.

loans.name: Diakhou

texts.fr: Madame Diakhou G. est une veuve qui a adhéré dans l’institution depuis 9 ans avec le démarrage du programme de micro crédit. Elle a déjà rembourse 20 prêts. Elle est mère de 3 enfants et s’est toujours battu pour l’entretien de son ménage. Elle évolue dans le commerce de pain et de petit déjeuner. C’est une activité  qu’elle a choisi pour ne pas rester oisive. Madame G. sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but d’acquérir du matériel pour finir la maison que lui a laisse son défunt mari en héritage. Son souhait est de la mettre en location afin de disposer d’une autre source de revenu  ce qui lui permettra de mieux faire face aux besoins de la famille. Elle se réjouit de la progression positive de ses activités, et surtout la possibilité pour elle d’auto financer son commerce.
texts.en:
Madam Diakhou G. is a widow who joined the institution 9 years ago with the startup of the micro credit program. She already repaid 20 loans. She is the mother of 3 children and always struggled for the upkeep of her household. She has been a seller of bread and breakfast. She chose this business in order not to stay idle. Madam G. is requesting a loan of 300 000frs with the aim of acquiring some material to complete the house that her deceased husband bequeathed to her.Her wish is to put it up for rent inorder to have another source of revenue which will allow her better to meet the needs of the family. She is delighted with the positive progress of her business especially the possibility for her to self-finance her business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. W. is 49 years old and married with five children between the ages of 29 and 22 years old. She is a member of a self-help group called "Mother's Choice". Her business is located in Ndunyu Sabuk where, for seven years now, she has been operating a grocery store. Her major challenge has been too many people in the area who are in the same kind of business as hers. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more vegetables to sell to more people. She has a dream of really expanding her business. She is innovative and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Zarbibi

texts.ru: Махмудова Зарбиби проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 57 лет. Замужем, имеет 10 детей. Торговлей занимается более 8 лет. Махмудова Зарбиби торгует полиэтиленовыми клиенками. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Zarbibi M. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 57 years old, married and has 10 children. She has been involved in retail sales for over 8 years. Zarbibi sells plastic wraps. She is requesting this loan in order to expand merchandise selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding merchandise selection

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 46-year-old widow with six children, between the ages of eight and twenty years old. Four of the children are attending school. She's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for two years and previously worked as a milk vendor. She sells her milk to milk vendors in the local community. She also grows tea and earns some extra income from her crop. She says that the main challengers to her business are a lack of finances to expand the business and animal diseases, but these are mitigated by her dairy cow insurance.

She successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 30,000 and then requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, she would like to construct a modern dairy unity and produce over 20 litres of milk per cow each day.

Rosemary says that the loan will help her improve her income from dairy cows so that she can educate her children who are in school. Even being a widow, she says she can manage to pay school fees and meet other necessities through the income from the dairy cow she obtained through Juhudi Kilimo.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou S. est menuisier métallique depuis 1998 et gère son atelier avec quelques employés apprentis. Parallèlement à son activité, Monsieur S. s’active dans  l’aviculture, un secteur qu’il a embrassé depuis 2003 sous l’influence d’un de ses amis aviculteurs.
Marié récemment, Monsieur S.  compte augmenter ses revenus en renforçant l’aviculture. C’est ainsi qu’il demande un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  pour acheter 200 poussins et y gérer tous les besoins pour l’aliment des poussins.  Cependant ce jeune âgé de 26 ans  espère avec ce crédit développer et accroitre son business  afin de régler les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Modou S. has been a metal worker since 1998 and he manages his own workshop with the help of some trainee workers. At the same time he is also active in poultry farming. He started with this business in 2003, thanks to some friends who were already in the business. Modou S. got recently married and he hopes to enlarge his poultry business in order to increase his revenue. For this reason he requested a loan of 150 000 FCFA to buy 200 poussins and all the necessary to feed them. This young man of 26 years of age hopes that this loan will help him to develop and improve his business in order to provide for his family needs.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of poussins.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 42 years old and married with two grown children, ages 27 and 24. He is a farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley in Kenya. He's been farming for 25 years and sells tea leaves through the Kenya Tea Development Authority and milk to the local community. He says that the main challenges to his business are a lack of capital and the limited size of his farm.

Joel successfully completed a previous loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 and requested this loan for Kes. 35,000 to purchase another dairy cow. The additional cow with increase his milk sales and overall income. In the future, he hopes to purchase more land and expand to start also selling cows. He says that he wants to work hard to improve his livelihood and ensure his family's food security.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 40 years old and married with seven children, between the ages of 6 months and 17 years, 5 of whom are attending school. He's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for ten years and previously owned a "hotel" (small restaurant). He sells his milk at "hotels" in the local community and also runs a small retail shop and sells his tea crop. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of water and feed for the cows and diseases that infect the animals.

He requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. In the future, he would like to have three good quality cows producing over 60 litres of milk per day and to own his own chaff cutter to cut feed. He says that this loan will help him improve his family's health through better nutrition and enable him to pay his children's school fees.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 59 years old and married with eight children, between the ages of nine and 26 years old. Six of the children are still attending school. He's been a dairy farmer in the Litein area of the South Rift Valley of Kenya for five years and previously worked as a supervisor in a tea estate. He sells milk to milk vendors in the area and also earns income from small-scale tea and poultry farming and a retail shop. He says that the main challenges to his business are lack of water and lack of artificial insemination services for his dairy cows.

He has requested this first loan through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. In the future, he would like to acquire two quality breed cows and produce 50 litres of milk per day. He says that this loan will provide him with food security from the milk and added income for school fees and other necessities for his family.

About Juhudi Kilimo

Juhudi Kilimo is an innovative, for-profit social enterprise working with smallholder farmers in Kenya. Juhudi directly finances dairy cows, chickens, agricultural equipment, and other assets that are specifically chosen to create immediate cash flow. Many of the assets are insured to prevent devastating business losses, and targeted technical assistance is provided to farmers, from agricultural training to basic bookkeeping and local market research. For its clients and their families, Juhudi also offers access to medical aid. Through all these services, Juhudi is creating sustainable growth and employment in rural communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Нишонова Махбуба проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 31 год. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Нишонова Махбуба имеет среднее образование. В области торговли работает более 8 лет. Она торгует полиэтиленовыми плиенками. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mahbuba N. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. Mahbuba has a secondary education. She has been working in the retail sales field for over 8 years. Mahbuba sells plastic wraps. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Gana

texts.fr: Madame Gana T.  demeurant à Médina Fall Thiès est commerçante de divers produits (jujubes, beurre de karité, encens…etc)  depuis sa jeunesse. Elle est mariée et est mère de 4 enfants tous majeurs. Née en 1957, Madame Fall est membre à U-IMCEC et elle est à sa septième demande de crédit. Ainsi, elle sollicite un montant de 50 000 FCFA pour compléter son budget d’approvisionnement afin de profiter du Magal de Touba  (Cérémonie religieuse commémorant l’anniversaire du retour en exil de Cheikh Ahmadou Bamba fondateur du mouridisme  confrérie  très développée au Sénégal)  pour écouler ses marchandises aisément.  Cependant elle compte avec les revenus gagnés se réapprovisionner pour préparer le Maouloud  (Gamou) à Tivaouane une cérémonie religieuse qui rassemble beaucoup de fidèles venus de   partout dans le monde  où on fête l’anniversaire du prophète Mouhamed  Paix et Salut sur Lui.
texts.en:
Madame Gana T. who lives in Médina Fall, Thiès, has been selling various items: jujubes, karité (shea) butter, incense, etc., since she was a young woman. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are adults.

Born in 1957, Mrs. Gana T. is a member of U-IMCEC and she is on her seventh loan request.
