She will use the loan to buy a head of cattle in order to increase her sales and be able to have greater earnings. That way she will give her family a better quality of life. She has had three loans with Ceprodel. They have helped her, and she has also improved her home. Cándida is married and has three children. Two of the children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull to butcher

loans.name: Estela Benita

texts.es: Estela tiene 51 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita a Fundación, por lo que es una excelente cliente. Su actividad económica es una pulpería, la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio fue la razón por la ella dio inicio a este humilde negocio que ahora es su medio de vida, y la necesidad de proporcionarle a sus 3 hijos lo necesario así fue que ella pudo sacar adelante sus hijos que actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, jabón, detergentes, leche, jugos y refrescos naturales, a pesar de que tiene que levantarse muy temprano para ir al mercado para realizar las compras y recorrer los diferentes establecimientos donde le ofrezcan los productos más baratos siempre sonríe con mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is 51 years old; this is by no means her first loan from the Foundation and she has been an excellent customer with her previous loans. She runs a small store which is her sole source of income. She was able to use her income from the store to provide for her 3 children who now are grown and work on their own. The loan is for working capital to purchase sugar, soap, detergent, milk, juice, and drinks. In spite of having to get up very early to go to the market to purchase her goods and running from store to store to get the cheapest items, she is always smiling as she works hard to improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Gloria tiene el negocio de venta de comida, el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de utensilios de cocina esto para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes que llegan a consumir a su negocio, sus clientes mayormente son turistas que llegan al sector del mirador de Catarina, el crédito le beneficiara ya que al dar una mejor atención tendrá mas turistas que la visitaran y así tener un mayor ingreso, ella es madre dos niños los que están estudiando.
texts.en:
Gloria has a business selling food. The loan is to buy kitchen utensils to give her customers who come to eat better service. Most of her customers are tourists who come to the scenic Catarina area. The loan will help her give better service, she will have more tourists visit her, and that way she will have better earnings. She has two children who are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tablecloths and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en: Evodia N. is a married woman as well as a business entrepreneur. She runs a hardware business, where she sells at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases building materials from wholesale shops and suppliers and then sells the materials to retail customers at her shop. The income generated from her business has enabled her to construct a residential house and meet her family's daily demands. She is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 TZS to buy more materials.

loans.use: To buy more building materials.

loans.name: Confiance En Dieu Group

texts.en:
The Confiance en Dieu is a made up of fifteen male and female entrepreneurs. After successfully repaying their first and second loans, they are looking forward to continued success and growth for their businesses with their third loan. Francisque S. is the general president of the group. He is 41 years old, married, and has nine children ranging from four to 18 years old.

The hardworking dad is a long-time business person who splits his time between two business activities. He makes cement blocks for the construction of houses, and he also makes charcoal. He will often purchase either wood to make the charcoal or already prepared charcoal to resell in the big city. He is thankful for the presence of Esperanza in the area because they have allowed many people to get back on their feet. He prays for not only the organization, but his fellow associates to grow. On behalf of Francisque, Confiance en Dieu, and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: cement, rocks, sand, wood

loans.name: Erick Daniel

texts.es: El señor Erick Daniel tiene negocio de peluquería unisex, el crédito lo ocupara para invertirlo en el mismo y poder da una mejor atención a su clientela que lo visita, el negocio lo inicio hace cinco años con capital propio donde solamente tenia un espejo y una silla ahora el negocio a crecido y a mejorado la estructura del local el crédito le beneficiara ya que asi seguirá mejorando su negocio y calidad de vida, el señor Erick es soltero pero tiene a su cargo a su abuelita que vive con el.
texts.en:
Erick Daniel’s business is a unisex beauty salon. He will use the loan to invest in his business to be able to give his customers better service. He started the business five years ago with his own money. He only had a mirror and a chair. Now the business has grown, and he has made improvements to his place. The loan will help him to keep improving his business and his quality of life. Erick is single, but he has the responsibility of his grandmother who lives with him.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Two revolving chairs, two meter mirror, a display case, and accessories

loans.name: Silvanus

texts.en:
Silvanus M. is married and has a small business. He runs a tailoring mart at the Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. He designs and sews different types of clothes for both men and women and for school uniforms. He purchases the business materials from the wholesale shops and retailers at the Kariakoo shopping city center. The business income he's generated has enabled him to have three sewing machines and meet his daily needs. 

He needs a loan of 1,000,000 Tanzanian shillings to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Taabu

texts.en: Taabu B. Juma  is a petty businesswoman. She runs a business supplying foodstuffs to customers, wholesale and retail.  She purchases the business goods including beans and rice from different regions in Tanzania and sells them at Kariakoo city market shopping center, wholesale and retail. The business needs big capital but sometimes they do it in joint ventures so as to reduce transport costs. She is requesting a loan of T.shs 1,000,000 to capitalize the business.

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: 10 De Agosto (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal 10 de Agosto está integrado por un grupo de mujeres  que siempre buscan oportunidades de superación personal y familiar, ubicado en la parroquia Santa Ana,   ésta es  una comunidad que cuenta con paisajes hermosos en su estado natural,   el 27 de Mayo es  su parroquialización donde  podemos disfrutar  de música, desfiles, danzas, artistas, etc., su gente es muy cálida como nuestras socias que nos brindan sus historias.

La señora  María L. tiene 66 años, vive  sola en su casa propia  heredada por sus abuelos  que tiene 150 años de construida, está ubicada en la parroquia Santa Ana comunidad Latig, además nos comenta que es viuda hace doce años porque su esposo tenía problemas de alcoholismo, con él concibió seis hijos que ahora son todos adultos y han formado su propia familia. 

María se dedica  a cultivar sus tierras, criar animales como gallinas, cerdos  y también lava ropa ajena los días miércoles, jueves, sábados de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. Lleva dos años como socia del banco comunal incitada  por una amiga  manteniendo una gran amistad con sus compañeras del banco comunal.

Con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNCACION ESPOIR le   entregue va a comprar pollos y cerdos, su gran sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y construirse una casa nueva.

Mercedes C. vive en las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia El Valle, tiene 26 años de edad y  vive en unión libre  fruto su amor procreó tres hijos  de  9, 4, 2, años de edad,  su esposo trabaja como chofer de un bus Intercantonal, viven en  casa de sus padres en un departamento  independiente por ahora están construyendo su casa propia fruto de su esfuerzo y trabajo conjunto.

Nuestra amiga se dedica a la compra y venta de pollos, cuyes, los vende en tiendas de su comunidad  lleva dos  años realizando esta actividad y nos comenta que le va bien. Este es su tercer ciclo en la fundación y fue su cuñada quien la estímulo para formar parte de este grupo de amigas. Con  el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar cerdos, cuyes y el respectivo alimento para su crianza.

Su gran sueño es poder terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The August 10th village bank consists of a group of women who are always looking for ways to progress individually and with their families; it is located in the Santa Ana parrish. It is a city with beautiful natural landscapes. The May 27th parrish is an area of the city for music, parades, dances, artists, etc. The people of the city are very warm and friendly like the women who make up this village bank. Maria L. is 66 years old and lives alone in her home which she inherited from her grandparents; it is 150 years old and located in the Santa Ana parrish of the Latig community. She was widowed 12 years ago as her husband died from alcoholism; she had 6 children with him who are now all adults and have their own families. Maria raises crops on her land and also raises animals like chickens and pigs; she also washes clothes for customers on Wednesdays, Thursdays, and Saturdays from 8 am to 6 pm. She has been part of the bank for 2 years and has developed a deep friendship with the other members of the bank. With the loan she will receive from Fundacion Espoir, she will buy chickens and pigs; her dream is to have good health to keep working and build a new home. Mercedes C. lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the El Valle parrish; she is 26 years old and lives in a common law marriage. She has 3 children who are 9, 4, and 2 years old. Her husband is a bus driver for Intercantonal. They live in her parents' home in an independent apartment but are building their own home thanks to their hard work in their jobs. She buys and sells chickens and guinea pigs and sells them in the community; she has done this for the past 2 years and it has been a good business for her. This is her 3rd loan through the foundation; her sister-in-law encouraged her to become part of the group. With this new loan, she will buy pigs and guinea pigs and food to raise them. Her dream is to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal food

loans.name: Salama

texts.en: Salama K. is a married small businesswoman with one child.  She runs a business selling firewood to customers at Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the firewood wholesale from the suppliers and sells it retail to her customers. She has been in the business for five years and she manages to live based on the business income. Her business plan is to diversify the business into a foodstuffs shop but her lack of capital is very limiting. She needs a loan of T.shs 700,000 to diversify the business.

loans.use: To diversify the business

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Cette femme est mère de 04 enfants, elle n’est pas légalement mariée et vit avec ses enfants, l’activité  qu’elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Son stock a connu une baisse et elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 10 bidons d’huile, 5 paniers de tomates, 5 paniers d’adémé, 4 sacs de maïs.
texts.en:
This woman is the mother of four children; she is not legally married and lives with her children. The business with which she supports her children is the sale of grocery products. Her stock is diminished and she would like to replenish it, which is the reason why she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy 10 jerrycans of oil, 5 baskets of tomatoes, 5 baskets of "adémé", and 4 sacks of maize.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery items for resale

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr: Monsieur Demba G. est un tailleur de36 ans qui habite dans la banlieue de Guediawaye plus précisément dans le quartier de baye laye 447. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2007 et a déjà bénéficié de  3 prêts antérieurs. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 et 6 ans. C’est depuis 1985 qu’il a commence a apprendre ce métier. En 1990 il dispose de son propre atelier de couture. Malgré ses performances dans le métier  il n’a jamais appris le français sinon le Coran. C’est un choix qui a été fait par amour. C’est un grand plaisir pour lui de confectionner de jolis boubous. Mais il se réjouit aussi de gagner beaucoup d’argent pendant les fêtes de tabaski de korite et de fin d’années. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000frs destine a l’achat d’une sixième machine a coudre dans le souci de renforcer son matériel. Il envisage dans le futur d’étendre son atelier car son activité commence a s’agrandir.
texts.en:
Monsieur Demba G. is a tailor, age 36, who lives on the outskirts of Guediawaye, more precisely in the Baye Laye 447 neighborhood. He has been a member of U-IMCEC since September 2007 and has already received three loans. He is married and the father of two children, 4 and 6 years old.

In 1985 he began to learn his trade. In 1990 he got his own tailor shop. Despite his performance in this trade, he never learned French, only the Koran. This is a choice he made freely and it is a great pleasure for him to sew beautiful boubous (traditional robes). But he is also very happy to earn a lot of money during the feast days at 'Tabaski', 'Korite' (Moslem holy days), and the New Year's holidays.

He is requesting a loan of 200,000 frs to use to buy a sixth sewing machine so that he can improve his equipment. In future, he foresees that he will need to enlarge his workshop since his business is beginning to grow.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a 6th sewing machine for his workshop

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari S. runs a foodstuffs shop at Tabata ward in Dar es Salaam. He is married with four school-age children. He purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops at the city market and sells retail to customers at his shop. He has been in the business for five years and the business income has enabled him to pay the children's school fees and capitalize the business. He needs a loan of T.shs 700,000 to buy more business goods. 
. 
.

loans.use: To buy more business stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: processing fruits and vegetables and sale of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying and selling seafood products and local cereals

loans.name: Anavita

texts.es:
Anavita M. N., tiene la edad de 47 años, es soltera, y tiene dos hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 14 y 16 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca.El proyecto básicamente consiste en hacer almácigos de café. Ella desea hacer los almácigos de café, luego sembrar una parte y vender la otra  a otros agricultores. El darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo va a permitirle tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le dieron, dice que esto le ha ayudado a sacar adelante sus proyectos.Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos los estudios y una mejor calidad de vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Anavita M. N. is 47 years old. She is single and has two children who are her main priority. The children are 14 and 16 years old, respectively. She wants this loan in order to help her farm. The basic project consists in making seedbeds for coffee. She wants to make the seedbeds, then plant part of them and sell the rest to other farmers. By maintaining the plants adequately, she will have a better harvest and then she will have greater economic earnings. This is not her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the opportunities given. She says that this has helped her make progress with her projects. She hopes in the future, she will give her children an education and a better quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm assistance

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Olivia tiene 69 años, a pesar de su edad es una persona muy luchadora y responsable. Su actividad económica es la venta de cereales, hace más de  8 años que se dedica este negocio, que consiste en venta pinol, semilla, pinolillo y cereal que son bebidas tipicas de Nicargua, que ha muchos extranjeros les gusta. Oliva tiene 6 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente ella nos dice que la iniciativa de este negocio se da con el proyecto de la cuenta reto del milenio, ya que por medio de esta organización aprendió este oficio que ahora es su medio de vida. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de leña, cacao, canela, bolsas plásticas entre otros productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio.
texts.en:
Olivia is 69 years old; in spite of her age, she is a very hard-working, responsible person. For the past 8 years, she has sold cereals and grains. She sells cornstarch, seeds and other grains used in typical Nicaraguan drinks that many foreigners enjoy. Olivia has 6 children who all work on their own. She explains that she learned her current business through the Millenium Challenge project. The loan will be used to purchase firewood, cocoa, cinammon, plastic bags and other products. She would like to continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mariana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Mariana  tiene la edad de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora comprometida a su trabajo ella se desempeña como Responsable de un programa social familiar desde hace nueve años, en donde llevan los programas y consejos a familias a los barrios mas pobre, lo cual le trabaja a los Españole, que son los que hacen posible estos proyectos. Procreo dos hijos, casada, su esposo es ingeniero civil. Y junto han logrado hacer su casa, la necesidad que tiene es que quiere comprar un lavandero nuevo ya que esta rajado el que tiene, repellar las paredes, y embaldosar la parte en donde lava lo cual comprara: arena, cemento, piedrin y comenzar para estar en mejores condiciones como mejor higiene. Sus planes es poder ir mejorando las necesidades de su hogar poco a poco ya que todo ha incrementado y solo mediante este medio de financiamiento se puede avanzar por los meses y plan de pago. Con el crédito anterior logro terminar el caraje,  lo cual esta feliz por poder hacer las mejora a su vivienda, como poder ayudar a sus hijos en lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mariana is 57 years old and is a very hard-working woman who is committed to her work. For the past 9 years, she has been responsible for a family social program where they take programs and counsels to families in the poorest neighborhoods; these projects are put on by Españole. She has two children, is married, and her husband is a civil engineer. With him, they have been able to build their home; however, currently they need to buy a new washer, plaster the walls, and tile the area where they wash clothing. In order to do this, they will need sand, cement, and gravel. One they finish, their home will be in better conditions and more hygienic. She plans to improve her home little by little and only through loans like this can she accomplish her goals. With her previous loan, she was able to finish her garage which made her very happy as she improved her home and better provided for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, cement, gravel to plaster the walls and tile the floor; also purchase a new washer

loans.name: The Women's Bank Of Entrepreneurs Of Chilamate (2) Group

texts.en:
“The Women's Bank of Entrepreneurs of Chilamate (2)” is a group of women from Poas, Chilamate, located close to the active Poas volcano in Costa Rica. The members of this group of 4 women are engaged in different productive activities including: curtain and clothes sewing, catalogue sales, nail painting, hydroponic agriculture, and hot food sales. The members of this group have formed a strong bond with one another. It is apparent that these women regard community, solidarity and hard work as values central to their beliefs. Their special bond has developed because the members of the group have been neighbours all their lives, and thus know each other on a very deep and personal level. These four women were inspired to apply for a loan with Fundacion Mujer as a result of the positive experience that their colleagues in the community had had throughout the duration of their first loan. This will be this group’s first loan with Fundacion Mujer.

Iris A. L. is a 50-year-old mother of five who has a business sewing curtains, bedsheets and drapes; she also sells catalogue items from door to door in her community. Her highest level of formal education attained is the completion of primary school. She will use this loan to purchase household and beauty products to sell. Her goal is to use this loan to seek out new clients; Iris wants her business to grow so she can bring prosperity and support to her family.

Deilyn U. B. is a 26-year-old mother of two. Deilyn has a business selling hand-made clothes such as women's underwear and pyjamas. She also uses hydroponic technology to produce cabbage and lettuce for personal consumption and for sale. She started her clothes sewing and selling business with an initial investment of 10,000 colons. Deilyn will use this loan to equally develop both of her projects. Every day, she sews from 2 until 5 in the afternoon; for this she will need to purchase thread, needles, and maintain her two sewing machines. Otherwise, Deilyn will be using her loan to invest in the nutritional elements necessary to the production of healthy lettuce and cabbage. Since the lettuce is especially sensitive, she would like to invest in a protective material that limits the amount of sunlight to the lettuce leaves. Deilyn says that she hopes by joining this group, she will be surrounded by companions who work in cooperation.

loans.use: household and beauty products to sell door to door

loans.name: Ana Emperatriz

texts.es:
Ana Martínez de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, su esposo es chofer de un bus con el tiene 4 hijos.

Ana empezó invirtiendo una pequeña cantidad de dinero en dulces, poco a poco compro víveres y después pudo poner una pequeña tienda.

Ahora Ana trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 21h00, trabaja en conjunto con sus hijos, ella vende arroz, azúcar, aceites, dulces, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es el lodo que produce las lluvias. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceites para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere expandir la tienda con una sucursal.
texts.en:
Ana Martínez, 34, lives in the outlying area of Fortín in Guayaquil. Her house is made of cane, and electricity is the only basic service she has. Her husband is a bus driver, and they have four children. Ana started investing a small amount of money in sweets. Little by little she bought supplies. After that she was able to set up her small store. Ana now works everyday from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. She works with her children. She sells rice, sugar, oil, and sweets, etc. One of the inconveniences she has is the mud that the rain produces. She wants to use this loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil in order to increase the business. In the future she wants to expand the store with a branch.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, and oil

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor González de 60 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz como servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 2 hijos uno de 17 años y de 13 años estudiantes de escuelas particulares. 

Pastor empezó hace 15 años atrás con la elaboración de helados poco a poco implemento hielo en funda y siguió creciendo en esta actividad ya que le generaba muy buenas ganancias.

Ahora el trabaja todos los días desde las 10h00 hasta las 17h00 vendiendo helados de coco, frutilla, leche, chicle, hielo en funda, esencias de frutas, coco rallado etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la delincuencia en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, coco, esencias, leche para tener más productos que vender. De aquí a unos 5 años el quiere tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Pastor González is 60 years old and lives in the Fortin district in the outskirts of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and only has one basic service, which is electricity. His wife is a homemaker and with her he has 2 children, one who is 17 and another who is 13. They study in a private school. Pastor started out 15 years ago making ice cream. Gradually, he established a business selling ice in bags, and continued to grow this business, since it generated very good earnings. Now he works each day from 10am until 5pm selling ice creams flavored with coconut, strawberry, and milk, as well as chewing gum, bagged ice, fruit extracts, grated coconut and other items. One of the drawbacks is that there is a lot of crime in the area where he lives. With the loan he will buy sugar, coconut, extracts, and milk so that he can have more products to sell. Five years from now he would like to have a store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, coconut, milk and fruit

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo A. C., tiene la edad de 77 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo que es su mayor prioridad. El hijo tiene 36 años. El crédito lo quiere para asistir una plantación de café, de plátano y pasto. Además, desea comprar el fertilizante para darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cultivos, esto le va a permitir tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Don Teofilo también se dedica al cultivo de árboles frutales y pasto.Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le dieron.El espera en un futuro brindarle a su hijo y a toda su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Teofilo A. C. is 77 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one son who is his biggest priority. His son is 36 years old. The loan he is requesting is to help him plant coffee, bananas, and grass. Also, he would like to buy fertilizer to better maintain his crops and produce a bigger harvest in order to improve his income. Teofilo also grows fruit trees and grass. This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with what they have provided him. He hopes to provide a better life and better standard of living for his son and his family. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Farm maintenance

loans.name: Mujeres Soñadoras (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia N. es socia activa del  banco comunal Mujeres Soñadoras  motivada por su suegra, éste banco se formó en  la ciudad de Cuenca, urbe llena de tradiciones, leyendas y una hermosa arquitectura mezcla de lo medieval y moderno,  ella vive en la Av. Don Bosco en la urbe Cuencana  con apenas  24 años  está felizmente casada y tiene dos hermosos niños de 8 y 3 años, su esposo trabaja en la empresa de plástico Rival, no posee casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de sus suegros.


Sonia tiene un cyber y cabinas telefónicas lleva dos años seis meses con su negocio su horario de atención de 8 a.m. a 10 p.m. todos los días de la semana sin descansar uno solo. Nos manifiesta que este  es su cuarto ciclo en la fundación y con el nuevo préstamo que le  entreguen va a comprar algunos programas y cámaras para sus computadoras.

Su meta es tener casa propia.

Blanca Gavilanes  vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo en la fundación y los créditos recibidos ha invertido en la compra de materiales al contado y no a credito  para seguir implementando su negocio de costura que realiza desde hace treinta años en  su taller ubicado  en su propia casa.
 
Blanca tiene 56 años está casada y tiene tres hijos de  30, 28, 20 su hija mayor  es casada y vive independiente mientras que  sus otros dos hijos estudian en la universidad de la ciudad,  su esposo es de profesión profesor y gracias al trabajo mutuo construyeron su casa propia.

Con el nuevo préstamo solicitado  va a comprar materiales como encajes, cierres, telas, hilos, etc. para la confección de sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Sonia N., 24, is an active member of the Mujeres Soñadoras communal bank. Her mother-in-law motivated her to join. The bank is in the city of Cuenca, a city that is full of tradition, legends and beautiful architecture that combines medieval and modern styles. She lives on Don Bosco avenue in greater Cuenca. Sonia is happily married and has two beautiful children, who are 8 and 3 years old. Her husband is employed by the Rival plastics company. She does not own a house; they live in the home of her in-laws. Sonia runs an Internet access and public phone booth business; she has been in this line of work for two-and-a-half years. She is open to the public from 8am until 10pm seven days a week; she takes no days off. She tells us that this is her 4th loan cycle with the Foundation and she will use the new funds, when she gets them, to buy software and webcams for her computers. Her goal is to have her own home. Blanca Gavilanes, 56, lives in greater Cuenca. This is her 4th loan cycle with the Foundation. Her previous loans have been used to pay cash, rather than on credit, for her sewing shop materials and supplies. She has been a seamstress for 30 years and she works from home. Blanca is married and has three children, 30, 28, and 20 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives independently while her other two children are still in university in the city; her husband is a professor and, thanks to their mutual effort, they were able to build their own house. She will use her new financing to buy supplies like lace trim, zippers, fabric, thread, etc. to use in dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy software and webcams for computers and fabric, zippers, threads, etc. for dress-making.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio G. Z., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 2 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen 2 años y otro de 4 meses de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de vacas.El desea comprar 2 vacas de cría, para luego poder venderlas y obtener mayores ganancias.El negocio del ganado es un complemento para su familia ya que el se dedica también a la agricultura de tubérculos. Es la primera vez que don Sergio se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que con esta ayuda espera lograr sacar adelante sus proyectos, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Sergio G. Z., 39, lives in a common law marriage. He has two children, and they are his greatest priority. One child is two years old and the other is four months old. He wants a loan to buy cows. He wants to buy two cows to raise in order to be able to sell them later and get greater earnings. The livestock business is a complement to his family because they also devote themselves to growing tubers. It is the first time that Sergio has had a loan from FUDECOSUR. He says that the loan committee has helped him a lot. With this help he expects to proceed with his projects. He is very satisfied with the funds that he has received. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock

loans.name: Dolores Yolanda

texts.es: Dolores Yolanda  solicito un financiamiento para incrementar la venta de su productos, ya que se encontraba en una fecha de bastantes pedidos, y quería la señora cumplir con todos ellos. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora que disfruta de su trabajo, y que además está luchando por llevar los ingresos necesarios a su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de perfumes, cremas, mascarillas, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas y faldas. Ella sueña con tener una casa con muchas comodidades y tener un negocio muy productivo, si es posible establecerlo en el mercado.
texts.en:
Dolores Yolanda is seeking a loan to increase her product sales since she has received many orders and she would like to be able to fulfill all of them. She sells general merchandise and is a very hard-working woman who enjoys her work. She puts forth so much effort in order to provide income for her home and her family. She is requesting this loan to buy perfumres, creams, mascara, underwear, pants, shirts and skirts. She dreams of having her own home with better accommodations and to have a very productive business established in the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yuri Anis

texts.es: La señora Yuri Anis H. R., vive en el Barrio La Francia, es soltera y tiene 24 años de edad la cliente se dedica al comercio de las frutas desde hace 10 años y uno de los problemas principales han sido la de un local apropiado para ofertar el producto, ella solicita un prestamo para la ampliación del local donde vende las frutas con el dinero compraría materiales de construcción, para comenzar con la primera fase de construccion, esto le ayudaría de gran medida debido a que la demanda de las frutas le han aumentado considerablemente y ella asegura que podría vender el doble del volumen de venta que tiene actualmente.
texts.en:
Yuri Anis Hernandez R. lives in the La Francia neighborhood, is single and 24 years old. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling fruit and one of the biggest challenges she faces is having an appropriate place from which to sell her fruit. She is seeking a loan to enlarge her current locale where she sells fruit; with the money, she will buy construction materials to start the first phase of construction. This will help her a lot since the demand for her fruit has increased substantially and she firmly believes that she could sell twice the amount of fruit that she currently sells.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Evelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Evelia Del Socorro tiene 48 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita, por lo que está muy contenta por la experiencia que obtuvo con el crédito anterior. Sus 2 hijos siempre están a su cargo por lo que se preocupa por proporcionarle lo necesario, con mucho esmero y dedicación ella ofrece sus productos, Ella utiliza una chaqueta que la cubra del inmenso sol por lo que tiene que recorrer lugares lejanos y tiene que hacerlo caminando, esto no la detiene para seguir adelante con su negocio. El financiamiento lo utilizara para la compra de perfumes, cremas, colonias, lápiz labial, polvos y algunos tratamientos. Su deseo es obtener un local en el mercado porque aquí podrá ofrecer sus productos a los diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Evelia del Socorro is 48 years old and this is not the first loan she has requested; she is very pleased with the experience she had with her previous loan. She has two dependent children and she always seeks to be able to provide for them. She offers her products with great care and great dedication. She uses a jacket to cover her from the intense sunlight as she walks to and fro for long distances in order to sell her goods; in spite of this hardship, she remains encouraged with her business. She will use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, colognes, lip liners, blush and other makeup/skin care treatments. She would like to eventually have a store in the market to more easily offer her products to customers.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tropical Group

texts.es: El grupo “Tropical” esta representado por el señora EriK Mauricio  y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad, responsabilidad y muchas ganas D. trabajar. Una gran mayoría D. los socios posee negocios comerciales como la venta D. comida, empanadas, abarrotes, ropa y al transporte público D. pasajeros, por ejemplo el presidente se dedica a la elaboración y distracción D. pan el trabaja desD. las tres D. la madrugada debido a que solo tiene un vehiculo repartidor y debe madrugar para elaborar el pan y lograr distribuir a todas las tiendas con las que tienen contratos fijos ya que la mejor forma D. fidelizar con lo clientes es no fallar con el producto el señor Erik Mauricio tiene cuatro hijos pequeños a los cuales deben mantener y es ayudado por su esposa que venD. masitas en la puerta D. la panadería para ayudar a suspendo D. su hogar. En el mercado existe una amplia gama D. panaderos por lo que la competencia es alta pero el presidente indica que nunca falta el pan D. la casa si uno trabaja por salir adelante siempre, el resto D. los socios también tienen mucha competencia pero tratan D. salir adelante con esfuerzo trabajo y gracias  a la experiencia que poseen. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos como por ejemplo en el caso del presidente será destinado a la compra D. Harina y garrafas industriales D. gas para que sea menos pesado el estar cargando y cambiando las garrafas D. gas a cada momento ya que su zona no cuenta con gas domiciliario por tuberías y también para prevenir la escasez D. garrafas; el resto D. los socios desea ampliar mas sus negocios con mas mercadería, insumos y materiales la señora Nilda que se dedica a la venta D. comida insiste en ampliar y modernizar su negocio para que sea mas atractivo para los clientes que la frecuentan, el señora Walter desea chapear la pintura D. sus  vehiculo ya que es su fuente D. ingresos y con los años que tiene su vehículo ya le hace falta una mano D. pintura. Todas las expectativas D. los socios son para agrandar sus negocios y así poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida con esfuerzo y trabajo honesto.
texts.en:
The group "Tropical" is represented by Mrs. Erik Mauricio and maD. up of 12 members, who are in their third loan cycle, demonstrating punctuality, responsibility, and a great desire to work. The great majority of the partners own commercial businesses, in food sales, empanadas, groceries, clothing, and public transportation. For example, the president earns a living by making and distributing bread. He starts working at 3:00 in the morning, since he only has one delivery vehicle and must wake up early to make the bread and manage to distribute it to all of the stores with which he has set contracts. The best way to make your clients loyal is to make sure your products never fail. Mr. Erik Mauricio has four small children whom he must support, and he is helped by his wife, who sells pastries at the entrance of the bakery to help with the domestic expensese. In the market, there exists an ample amount of bakers, therefore the competition is high, but the president states that bread is never lacking at home if one always works hard to get ahead. The rest of the members also have a lot of competition, but they try to get ahead in life with effort, work, and appreciation for the experience that they have. This loan will be used for the purchase of supplies. For example, in the case of the president it will be used for buying flour and industrial gas cylinders, so that it is less difficult to carry and change the cylinders at any moment, since his zone does not have domestic gas through tubing. Also, this will prevent the scarcity of gas cylinders. The rest of the members desire to expand their businesses with more merchandise, supplies, and materials. Mrs. Nilda, who makes a living selling food, insists in expanding and modernizing her business so that it is more attractive for her clients that frequent it. Mrs. Walter wishes to paint her vehicle, since it is her source of income and with the age of her car, a new coat of paint is necessary. All of the expectations of these partners are for expanding their businesses and to therefore give their families a better quality of life, with effort and honest work.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Andrea Fernanda

texts.es:
Andrea C. de 25 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo es ebanista con el tiene 2 hijos aun no están estudiando en la escuela. 

Andrea empezó con la venta de arroz a quintal con un pequeño capital que le presto su papa, poco a poco siguió adelante con el negocio.

Ahora ella reparte a muchas tiendas el arroz por quintal como comerciante mayorista, trabaja de lunes a domingos en compañía de su papa ya que le ayuda con la transportación del arroz, vende cada quintal de arroz a $ 27.00. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es que a veces los clientes se demoran en cancelar.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar más arroz para poder agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere comprar su propia casa y poner hay su negocio.
texts.en:
Andrea C. is 25 years old and lives in a semi-urban area in Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and has basic utilities (running water, electricity, etc.). Her husband is a carpenter with whom she has 2 young children who are not quite school-aged. Andrea started her business selling rice by the kilo (in large quantities, ~45 kg) with a small amount of capital her father lent her; little by little she has grown her business. Now, she acts as a wholesaler selling her rice to various retail stores; she works Monday to Sunday with her father who helps her with transportation. She sells each ~45 kg of rice for $27. One of the challenges she faces is that sometimes her customers are slow to pay her. With the loan, she will purchase more rice to grow her business. In the future, she would like to buy her own home and put up a more stable business there.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice sales

loans.name: María Haideé

texts.es:
María Haydeé B. M., tiene la edad de 34 años, está  casada, y tiene 5 hijos, sus edades son de 18,14,9 y 5 años respectivamente, además de un bebé de 4 meses. El crédito lo quiere para asitir sus cultivos de granos básicos y tubérculos,  además se va ayudar para hacer un camino de acceso a la finca.
No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta por las facilidades que se le han brindado. Doña María Haydeé trabaja  desde hace varios años en la agricultura. Ella espera junto a su esposo en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
María Haydeé B. M., 34, is married and has 5 children, who range from 4 months to 18 years of age. She wants financing for her tuber and basic grains crops as well as to build an access road to her farm. This isn't her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms granted. María Haydeé has been a farmer for several years. She hopes, together with her husband, to provide her family in the future with a better quality of life, greater economic stability, and to continue to grow both as a person and as a grower.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming supplies.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “santa María” esta representado por el señor Darwin y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando junto a nuestra empresa por un segundo ciclo demostrando siempre responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus pagos. La gran mayoría D. los socios se dedica al comercio D. productos como comida abarrotes, frutas, productos electrodomésticos y a negocios como la panadería y venta D. refrigerios por ejemplo el señora Dawin se dedica al transporte público D. pasajeros desD. las seis D. la mañana a hasta las once D. la noche para hacer la renta del día y poder mantener a sus tres niños y a su esposa la cual se dedica a tejer y vender mantas y ropa a pedido para poder ayudar un poco a su esposo que trabaja duramente todo el día para mejorar la calidad D. vida para su familia.  En cuanto al entorno competitivo se pueD. decir que es alto ya que muchas D. las socias se ven en la necesidad D. llevar sus venta a las áreas periféricas debido a la fuerte competencia ene el mercado aquellos que realizan su venta en su domicilio no tienen otra mas que esperar a que los clientes vengan a efectuar el movimiento del día en el caso D. la señora María Luisa que venD. comida tiene sus pensionistas y no tiene mucho conflicto para efectuar su ingreso diario. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, mercadería, herramientas y materiales por ejemplo el señor Darwin efectuara la compra D. repuestos para su vehículo debido a que los muelles ya les están fallando y necesita del dinero para cambiarlos, la señora María Luisa desea efectuar unos cambios a los muebles D. su pensión para darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes que son los que generan el ingreso necesario para el sustento D. su familia. La mayor expectativa que tienen los socios es hacer crecer sus negocios D. manera que no les falte nada a sus familias y puedan darles una mayor comodidad en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Santa Maria" is represented by Darwin, and is maD. up of 15 members who are working with our foundation in their 2nd loan cycle, demonstrating, as always, responsibility and compliance in their payments. A great majority of the members sell products, such as groceries, fruit, electric appliances, snacks, and some have businesses, such as a bakery. For example, Darwin works in public passenger transportation from 6 in the morning until 11 at night so that he can make a daily income and support his 3 children and his wife. His wife weaves blankets and sells them on order so that she can help her husband a little, who works very hard every day to improve the quality of life for his family. As far as the competitive environment, one might say that it is very strong, since many of the members find it necessary to take their sales to outlying areas due to the strong competition in the market. Those who sell from their homes must wait for their customers to come to get their businesses moving. In the case of Maria Luisa, who sells food, she has her boarders and does not have much trouble making her daily income. This loan will be used to buy supplies, merchandise, tools and materials. For example, Darwin will buy spare parts for his vehicle, since his springs are failing and he needs money to change them. Maria Luisa wants to make some changes to the furniture in her boarding-house, to proviD. better comfort for her customers, who are the ones that generate the income necessary to support her family. The main expectation of the members is to make their businesses grow so that their families do not lack for anything and so that they can give their families greater comfort in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy supplies, merchandise, tools and materials

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata SADIO est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfant. Elle est membre du banc villageois de KADIOR depuis 7 ans et demis et a une bonne expérience de crédit pour y avoir accédé à 15 fois de suite. Elle fait un petit commerce d'huile de palme, une activité qui lui permet de se procurer des ressources financière et de participer au bien être familiale.
texts.en:
Aminata SADIO is a 44 year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two. She has been a member of the Kadior "Banc Villageois" (village loan group) for seven and a half years, and has significant experience with credit as she has obtained loans fifteen times in a row. She has a small business trading palm oil, an activity which allow her to access financial resources and to contribute to her family well-being.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her invested capital

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “6 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Lorgia y conformada por 15 miembros muy responsables y capaces como lo han demostrado en estos dos ciclos pasados, tienen mucha experiencia y son gente con muchas ganas D. salir adelante y seguir creciendo gracias al apoyo que les brinda la institución. 

Cada uno D. los socios tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. ropa, cosméticos, promotores D. revistas, venta D. comida, leña, tarjetas telefónicas y a la prestación D. servicios como la reparación D. motos y en el caso D. la señora Lorgia que se dedica a al elaboración D. horneados en general, ella elabora desD. muy temprano masitas, salteñas, cuñapes y empanadas en la puerta D. sus domicilio, ella es casada pero lo que gana su esposo no abastece para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y es por eso que la señora se dedica a la educación D. sus hijos y lo que genera sirve para pagar las cuentas D. servicios pero ella desea poder tener un horno industrial para poder efectuar mas masitas y salir a las ferias locales para venderlas y generar un mejor ingreso que les D. a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder efectuar la compra D. sus horno; al igual que ella las demás socias desean el crédito para incrementar sus insumos, mercadería y su capital D. trabajo para poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. 

En cuanto a competencia se pueD. mencionar que si bien esta presente las socias no se dejan intimidar por ella ya que saben la calidad D. los productos que ofrecen y la experiencia que tienen les favorecen bastante. La mayor expectativa que tienen los socios es hacer crecer sus negocios D. manera que no les falte nada a sus familias y puedan darles una mayor comodidad en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group, "the 6th of August" is represented by Lorgia and maD. up of 15 very responsible and capable members who have shown in the past two cycles that they have a lot of experience and are people who have much desire to get ahead and to continue growing thanks to the help offered them by the institution. Each one of the members has different activities like selling clothing, cosmetics, promoting magazines, selling food, firewood, phone cards and providing services like scooter repair and in the case of Lorgia, who works making baked goods. Usually, she makes them very early - pastries, salteñas (meat empanadas), cuñapes (bread roll with cheese and yucca), and empanadas - in the door of her house. She is married, but what her husband earns isn't enough to support their 4 children and that's why she works - for at the education of her children and to pay the utility bills. But, she would like to have an industrial oven to be able to make more pastries and to go to the local fairs to sell them and make better money to give her children a better quality of life. It's for this reason that she requires a loan to be able to purchase their oven. Like her, the other members would like the loan to increase their investments, merchandise and their working capital to be able to better their earnings and be able to give their families a better quality of life. As to competition, it can be mentioned that if this loan is granted, the members don't allow being intimidated by it. They know that the products that they offer and the experience is enough help. The greatest expectation that the members have is to grow their businesses in a way that their families aren't in need of anything and they can proviD. them more comfort in their homes. .

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Bello Horizonte Group

texts.es: El grupo “Bello Horizonte” esta representado por la señora Sarah y conformado por 12 miembros que van cursando un tercer ciclo juntas demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar junto con la institución con la cual están agradecidos por el apoyo económico y la confianza depositada. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como  Venta D. comida, venta D. ropa, venta D. refrigerios, venta D. cosméticos, venta bebidas alcohólicas y algunas socias se dedican a servicios domésticos, por ejemplo las presidenta se dedica a al venta D. comida típica como majaditos, patasca D. trigo pelado y sopas en el mercado trabaja desD. muy temprano y termina en la noche después D. vender sus platos D. cena por lo que pasa muy poco tiempo con sus pequeños niños que es lo que mas le preocupa ella quisiera generar mayores ganancias solo con sus almuerzos para poder pasar el resto del día con sus hijos pero asta que las ganancias no mejoren ella se conforma con poderles pagar una educación y que tengan un techo donD. descansar, así como las señora Sarah muchos D. lso socios deben dejar a sus nichos para trabajar pero es el precio que pagan por sus sustento y para mejoras la vida D. sus hijos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas que ayuden a generar una mejor ganancia que ayuD. a mantener a sus hogares. La mayor expectativa que tiene las socias es poder darles un hogar estable a sus hijos ya que muchas D.  las socias viven en alquileres o anticríticos y constantemente debe trasladarse en busca D. un nuevo hogar es por esta razón que traban para poder comprarse una cas o construir en lotes que algunos D. los socios ya tienen comprados, dándoles un mejor hogar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Bello Horizonte" group is headed by Sarah and comprised of 12 members, who together, are in the process of their third loan cycle. Such shows responsibility and industriousness, and the group is very grateful for the economic support and trust provided by the parties involved. Most of the members sell products such as food, clothes, domestic appliances, cosmetics, and alcoholic beverages. Some members proviD. domestic services. The group's President sells typical fare such as majaditos (a regional rice dish), patasca D. trigo pelado (wheat with jerked beef) and soup in the market from very early till late. Therefore, she has very little time to spend with her children. She hopes to spend more time with them, by focusing on lunch sales only, thereby increasing her earning potential. However, at present, providing her children with an education and a roof over their heads takes priority. As is the case with Sarah, many of the group's members also have to leave home to work. However, such is the price they pay for household upkeep and to improve the lives of their children. The purpose of the loan is to buy consumables, utensils and other necessary products in order to generate a higher income for the members' households. The members' greatest wish is to be able to proviD. a stable home for their children as most of the members rent accommodation or live in 'anticríticos' (a particular type of renting) and are constantly having to relocate in search of a new place in which to rent. Therefore, members have to work to be able to purchase a property or build on plots of land, which some have already managed to buy and which will proviD. a better life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To generate business income

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo es un hombre muy trabajador, que disfruta de su trabajo. Este no es el primer crédito que obtiene con Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sabido administrar el dinero para invertirlo en su negocio. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio el taxi, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de mantener a su esposa y su hijo que son lo más importante en su vida. El financiamiento es para la compra de repuestos para la caja de cambio, llantas nuevas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es obtener otro taxi, para mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a hardworking man who enjoys his job. This is not the first loan he has had with Fundación León 2000. In the past he has used the loans to invest in his business. His economic activity is to offer a taxi service, which he has done for more than 6 years. This is how he has always supported his wife and son, who are the most important things in his life. This financing is for buying spare parts for the gearbox and new tires among other things. His wish is to get another taxi to improve his life style.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business captial

loans.name: La Costanera Group

texts.es: El grupo “La Costanera” esta representado por la señora María Ylda y conformada por 14 miembros que van cursando ya un segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando puntualidad y solidaridad con sus integrantes. Cada socias tiene un negocio propio como la venta de comida, empanadas, refrigerios, bebidas en licorerías, pescado, abarrotes y gasolina; la presidenta se dedica la venta de refrigerios al paso ella tiene un puesto se sándwiches y hamburguesas al paso ella es madres soltera y tiene una pequeña niña, vive con su mama  por lo que no paga alquileres pero también tiene hermanitas menores a las cuales debe ayudar a educar es por esta razón que se esfuerza para sacar a delante a sus familia ya que desea que sus hermanas puedan terminar de estudiar y ayudar a su mama a mantener sus hogar. A pesar de existir mucha competencia en el mercado laboral muchas de las socias saben como salir adelante ya que tienen años trabajando en su rubro y saben como salir de apuros. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos, materiales y herramientas para seguir con sus negocios por ejemplo la presidenta desea un carrito móvil para vender sus hamburguesas y poder desplazarse más cuando no hay muchas ventas.  La mayor expectativa de las socias es poder tener sus puestos de trabajo con más  Implementación, equipamiento, ampliación y surtir mercadería para tener buenas  ventas en el futuro que ayudaran a brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
"La Costanera" ("The Coast") is led by Mrs. Maria Ylda. The group's 14 members are working with Fundación AgroCapital for the second time; they have proven to be co-operative and punctual. Each member of La Costanera has his/her own business. They sell food, baked goods, snacks, alcoholic drinks, fish, groceries and gasoline. Maria, the group leader, sells snacks and has a job making sandwiches and hamburgers. Maria is a single mother; she lives with her young daughter, her mother and her little sisters. She doesn't have to pay rent, but she works to get ahead because she wants to help her sisters get an education, and she wants to help her mother with household responsibilities. There's a lot of competition in the local labour market these days, but the members of La Costanera have experience and problem-solving skills working in their favour. They'll be using this loan to purchase the supplies, materials and tools they need for their businesses. For example, Maria wants a push-cart that she can use when selling burgers. She'd be able to move to new locations when sales in one spot taper off. The group hopes that more and better supplies and equipment will help their sales, their families and their overall quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Los Angelitos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Angelitos” esta representado por la señora Sandra Herry y conformada por 11 miembros que van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos y muchas ganas de trabajar, como loe demuestran en sus negocios de ventas de Venta de pescado crudo y cocido, venta de ropa, venta de empanadas, venta comida, venta de cosméticos y algunos socios tienen otra actividad como ser moto taxistas y servicios domésticos; la presidenta se dedica a la venta de pescado fresco que traen desde temprano desde las laderas del río y que si no se vende en la mañana lo cocinas para media tarde para no perder la ganancia del día ella mantiene a sus tres niñas junto con su esposo que es el que pesca junto con ella en las madrugadas que es donde los peces están en sus auge, ella tiene una casita modesta pero acogedora que es donde realizan las reuniones las socias. Como todo negocio tienen competencia, la mayoría de los socios de este grupo tienen su puesto de venta en el mercado del pescado ubicado en la zona 13 de abril por lo que siempre hay venta de l plato cosido o del pez fresco. El destino del crédito es para el crecimiento de sus negocios y a futuro esperan tener puestos de venta en otros mercados de la ciudad e invertirán en compra de insumos y materia prima para almacenar. En cuanto a su experiencia en Agrocapital están en su tercer ciclo sus antecedentes crediticios son regulares con la institución y la mayoría de los socios de este grupo han tenido experiencia en bancos comunales en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
The community bank "Los Angelitos" (The Little Angels") is represented by Sra. Sandra Herry and is made up of 11 members who are in their third loan cycle. They demonstrate punctuality with their payments and they have a lot of desire to work, as they demonstrate in their sales businesses of selling raw and cooked fish, clothes, empanadas, food, and cosmetics. Some of the members have other businesses such as motorcycle taxi drivers and domestic services. The president sells fresh fish that she brings early from the river slope, and if she doesn't sell it in the morning, she cooks it in the mid-afternoon so as not to lose the daily profits.

She has three daughters with her husband, who fishes with her very early in the morning, because that is when the fish are at their peak. She has a modest but cosy small house, which is where they have their meetings with the members. Like all businesses, they have competition, the majority of the members of this group have their sales stand in the fish market, located in the 13 of April region, so therefore there are always sales of cooked plates or fresh fish.

The use of the loan is for the growth of their businesses, and in the future they hope to have sales stands in other city markets. They will invest in the purchase of supplies and raw materials for storage. As for their experience in Agrocapital, they are in their third cycle and their credit antecedents are regular with the insitution and the majority of the members in this group have had experience in community banks in other institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Lubin

texts.es:
Lubin F. V., tiene la edad de 49 años, esta soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive con su madre y dos hermanos, su madre tiene  86 años y sus hermanos 52 y 54 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para mejorar su taller de ebanistería y para la compra de materiales como lo es la compra de madera para trabajar, tiene un local donde realiza sus trabajos en la confección de muebles. Es la primera vez don Lubin se financia con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y le brindaron muchas facilidades. El espera que con este proyecto crezca y pueda mejorar su capacidad en los trabajos y así aumentar sus ingresos, además desea superarse como persona,  y así poder en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Lubin F. V., 49, is single; he has no children. He lives with his mother and two brothers. His mother is 86 years old and his brothers are 52 and 54 years old, respectively. He needs funding to make improvements to his wood-working shop. He wants to buy supplies and materials like wood. He has a shop where he makes furniture. This is Lubin's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He states that the credit committee has been very helpful and they offered many incentives. He hopes that this project will help him grow and that he will increase his abilities in his jobs so that his earnings will increase. He also wants to improve as a person so that, in the future, he can provide his family with a better quality of life and have better economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood-working shop.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou M. est une femme de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demis et a été 17 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédits. Elle vendeuse de bouillie de mil qu'elle prépare elle-même, parallèlement et commercialise du jus de citron. Elle assure partiellement les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou M. is a 40 year-old woman. She is married and a mother of six. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois (village loan group) for eight and a half years, and has been a beneficiary of loans 17 times in a row. She sells millet porridge, which she prepares herself. In parallel she also sells lemon juice. She provides for part of the family expenses.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her small business

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es: Este cliente tiene trabaja por si solo en la agricultura y ganado menor (cerdos) tiene 15 años de experiencia en este trabajo el crédito lo utilizara para ampliar la vivienda. hay que mencionar que el mismo construirá su vivienda por lo que los costos se le disminuyen
texts.en:
Pablo Antonio G. V. works on his own in agriculture and raising livestock (pigs.) He has 15 years of experience in this type of work. He will use this loan to expand his house. It is worth mentioning that he will build this house himself, so as to minimize the cost.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Deysi Mariana

texts.es:
Deysi Cárdenas de 20 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de caña y solo tiene luz como servicio básico, es soltera.

La familia de Deysi siempre se ha dedicado ha vender pescados, ella comenzó con ellos a vender y después se independizó con un pequeño capital que ahorro.

Ahora ella comprar el pescado en la Caraguay de Guayaquil para venderlo en la esquina de su casa, trabaja desde las 06h00 hasta las 14h00 vendiendo varios tipos de pescados y camarones, uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es al salir a comprar los pescados en la madrugada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados y camarones para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender los mariscos.
texts.en:
Deysi Cárdenas, 20, is single and lives in a periurban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of sugar cane stalks and its only utility is electricity. Daysi's family has always worked as fishmongers. She began to sell with them and later became independent using a small amount of savings she had. Now, she buys the fish in Guayaquil's Caraguay market and sells it on the corner where she lives. She works from 6am until 2pm selling various kinds of fish and shrimp. One of the inconveniences she faces is having to go out at dawn to buy her fish. She will use the funding to buy fish and shrimp to enlarge her stock. In the future, she would like to have a locale from which to sell her seafood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase of capacity for self-finance

loans.name: Jorge Alexis

texts.es:
Jorge Alexis U. M., tiene la edad de 49 años, está  casado, y vive con su esposa y un nieto, que son su mayor prioridad. Ella tiene 43 años y el niño 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, además para dar asistencia  a una plantación de café que posee. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Jorge  trabaja  desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jorge Alexis U. M., 49, is married and lives with his wife and a grandson, who are his main priority in life. She is 43 and the child is 5 years old. He wants funding to buy natural and chemical fertilizers to enhance his coffee crops. He wants his crops to have the proper care so that his yield will be greater thus increasing his earnings. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms granted. Jorge has been a farmer for many years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability as well as to continue to develop both as a person and as a coffee grower.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Nialing

texts.fr: Nialing B. est une femme de 57 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et a eu 16 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait la transformation et vente de jus de fruits, elle vend également une bouillie à base de céréales locales. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Nialing B. is a 57-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of six children whom she cares for. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for eight years and has had 16 experiences with loans. Nialing makes fruit juice and sells it. She also sells porridge made from a base of local grains. Her profits allow her to take care of her children and provide for their personal needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her commercial activity

loans.name: Rutbel

texts.es:
Rutbel N. C., tiene la edad de 45 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 3 hijos, que son su mayor prioridad. Los hijos tienen  21,17 y 1 años respectivamente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros y para comprar el alimento para mantener al ganado,el señor cuenta con una área de pasto donde tendrá a los animales para su crianza, el está seguro de que puede darle un buen mantenimiento y así cuando las venda obtener una ganancia. Es la primera vez que se financea con  FUDECOSUR, el manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho, ya que por la ayuda ha logrado sacar adelante los diferentes proyectos que se ha planteado, además que está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron.
El espera en un futuro brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, estudios y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Rutbel N. C. is 45 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. He has three children who are his biggest priority. His children are ages 21, 17 and 1 respectively. The loan he is requesting is for buying calves and food for the livestock. Rutbel has an area of pasture where he will raise the animals. He is certain that he will be able to raise them well and when he sells them he will make a profit. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he says that the loan committee has helped him a lot. Already they have helped him move forward the different projects he has proposed. In addition he is very happy with how easily he has received help. He hopes in the future to give his children a better quality of life, school and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Erika Luzmila

texts.es:
Erika A. de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposo tiene un local en donde vende cilindros de gas no tienen hijos. 

Erika comenzó dando sus servicios como maquilladora visitando a sus clientes en sus domicilios, poco a poco comenzó a tener ingresos suficientes para poner un pequeño gabinete de belleza. 

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 12h00 hasta las 22h00, haciendo cortes de cabello, tinturados, secados etc. Una de las complicaciones que tiene es atender el negocio en el estado de embarazada.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes, sacadoras, silla para agrandar el negocio. En el futuro tener ayudantes y poner una sucursal del gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Erika A. is 27 years old and lives in a suburban area in Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her house is made of cement and she has all the basics; her husband has a stand where he sells gas cilinders and they are expecting their first child. Erika started her business as a makeup artist by visiting her clients in their homes, and soon she had enough clients to open her own beauty salon. She now works every day from 12pm until 10pm, giving haircuts, dying and styling hair. Her only difficulty at the moment is that she's pregnant and needs to keep working. With the loan she wishes to buy more dye, hair driers, chairs and other equipment to expand her business. She hopes to hire people to help her out in the future and open another branch of her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for hair salon

loans.name: José León

texts.es:
José León G. F., tiene la edad de 70 años, está  soltero. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para dar asistencia  a una plantación de café que posee. El desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo  para  que este le permita  tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José  trabaja  desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
