Jose Leon G. F., 70, is single. He is applying for a loan to buy manure and fertilizer that he will use to grow coffee on a farm that he owns. He wants to do everything that he can to ensure the greatest yield possible and maximize his revenue from the crop. This isn't his first FUDECOSUR loan and he has been very happy with what he has been able to do with past loans. Don Jose has worked at farming for many years. He hopes that he'll be more economically secure in the future and be able to grow as a person and as a businessman.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee farming.

loans.name: Kadessa

texts.fr: Kadessa T. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est marie et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8 ans et demi et a été 17 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait la préparation et vente de bouillie de mil. Son activité lui génère des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Kadessa T. is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and mother to two children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for eight and a half years and already received 17 successive loans. She prepares and sells millet porridge. Her work generates profits which provide financial support for her family's needs.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finance her revenue-generating activity

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica V. M. es esposa del señor Eduardo y son una familia muy trabajadora y responsable ellos iniciaron un negocio de abarrotes establecido desde hace 3 años, el cual ha dado fruto ya que son preferidos por sus clientes, están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Verónica V. M. is the wife of Eduardo, and they are a very responsible and hardworking family. They started up a grocery store 3 years ago, and this investment has borne fruit, since they are preferred by their customers. They are taking out this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale so that they can have increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the business (grocery store) by buying more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her capacity to invest

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa DIALBANG est âgée de 53 ans et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est mariée et membre du Banc villageois de de KADIOR depuis 7 ans et demi et a été 15 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle fait de la transformation et vente de bouillie de mil. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer aux différentes charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa DIALBANG, age 53, is the mother of three children. She's married, and she's been a member of the village bank of KADIOR for seven and a half years and already benefited from 15 consecutive loans. She transforms mil into porridge that she sells. Her profits enable her to take part in covering the various expenses of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her business

loans.name: Leonor Maria

texts.es:
La Stra. Leonor Maria S. D. de  de 32 años de edad vive con su madre en casa propia en la Av. Principal de Comatrana – Ica ella es huerfana de padre por eso vive sola con su madre ya que su hermana es casada y está viviendo en otra ciudad.
La srta se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas en su domicilio pero tambien trabaja en una muebleria como vendedora ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante ella costea su estudio de ingles ya que desea poco a poco superase su anhelo es poder estudiar una carrera profesional la cual quedo trunca a raiz del terremoto ya que ha estado apoyando mas a su madre y ahorrando para construir su vivienda la cual ya levanto con esfuerzo de sus ahorros ahora ella esta solicitando que le financiemos por que le falta para el techado de la vivienda ya que desea que su madre este en un buen ambiente ya que mas de dos años han vivido en carpa y modulo de madera.
Ella goza de buenas referencias de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es una hija bien buena y responsable.
texts.en:
Leonor Maria S. D., 32, lives with her mother in her own house on the Principal Avenue of Comatrana – Ica. She lost her father, and that is why she only lives with her mother. Her sister is married and lives in another city. She sells beer and soft drinks in her home. She also works as a salesperson in a furniture store. She has a great desire to get ahead. She pays to study English because she wishes to better herself little by little. She wants to be able to study a professional career, which was curtailed because of the earthquake. She has been supporting her mother more and saving to build her house. She used her savings to raise the house, and now she is asking for a loan because it needs a roof. She wants her mother to be in a good environment. For over two years they have lived in a tent and pre-fabricated housing. She enjoys good references from her neighbors. They say that she is a very good daughter, and that she is responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Victor Gabriel

texts.es:
El Señor H. M. Víctor Gabriel de de 29 años de edad, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa de Lima - Cercado de Ica vive en casa de suegra con su esposa y su menor hijo.
El se dedica a la actividad de transporte cuenta con una mototaxi, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 6 años, gracias a su trabajo esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado obtener sus bienes.
El Señor  goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos quienes manifiestan que es bien trabajador y emprendedor.
El desea que le apoyemos para el cambio de motor de una mototaxi que compro producto de su trabajo, ya que su anhelo es adquirir un terreno donde construir su casa propia y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
H. M. Víctor Gabriel, 29, lives in the Asentamiento Humano Santa Rosa de Lima – Cercado de Ica. He lives in his mother-in-law’s house with his wife and his young son. He works in transportation with his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle). He has been doing this for six years. Thanks to his work, effort, and dedication he has been able to obtain his assets. He enjoys good references from his neighbors. They say he is a hard-worker and enterprising. He wants us to help him in order to change the motor on a mototaxi that he bought with his earnings. He wishes to get a piece of land where he can build his own house and give his family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motor for his "mototaxi"

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, 29 years old, is a mother of four. She is into rice farming. She started farming in 2007 and she currently owns a hectare of rice field. She also owns a sound system to rent out, which people around her community rent from her for special occasions. She wants to grow her business so that her income will also increase and eventually improve her family’s living conditions.

Leah would like to apply for a loan in the amount of Php 6,000. She will use it to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
59-year-old Rebecca used to borrow money from individuals at a high interest rate just so she could fund her farm. It was difficult for her because there was almost nothing left of her income. When she heard of CEVI, she settled her obligations and joined the micro-finance institute. She and her husband want to earn more because their children depend on them.

Rebecca applied for a loan of Php 6,000. With this amount, she will be able to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Gloregen

texts.en:
Gloregen married her husband, Randy, in 2004 and they now have three children, with the oldest aged 7.

Farming is what Gloregen does to earn a living, helping her husband to plant rice crops on their farm. She also grows chickens and pigs, which provides additional income for her family.

Gloregen wants her business to grow so that her family’s needs are met. She requested a loan of Php 6,000 which she will use to purchase farm supplies and feeds for the livestock.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and feeds for her livestock

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth went into business as a rice farmer in 2003. She is 30 years old, married and has two children, the older of which is six. When not working on the farm, she supplements her income by selling health and beauty products. She is committed to save as much money as possible to cover the cost of educating and caring for her children. She has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy supplies for her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
19-year-old Janice is the young mother of a 2-year-old baby. She and her partner are not married yet but plan to settle down.

Janice is involved in rice farming and also retails gasoline. She said, “I believe every business starts out small and if you work hard at it, success is not impossible.”

Janice is a new member of CEVI and is thankful to be given an opportunity to have financial support for her business. She requested Php 6,000 which she will use to buy farm supplies like seed and fertilizer. She will also acquire additional gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies plus more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Marianito

texts.en:
Marianito strives hard to feed his family. He is 28 years old, married, and has three kids, his oldest child being only nine years old. He wishes his children to have a bright future.

Right now, one of his goals is to give them a proper education so he makes sure to have an income to meet their school needs. He would like to request Php 6,000 which he will use to fund his farm. He will purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies he needs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly has a four-year-old child with her husband Reneboy. She is 23 years old and involved in rice farming. She helps her husband till their 1-hectare rice field. The farm is their only source of income. She wants the farm to be productive in order for there to be enough income for her family and also for savings. She wants to save for her child's education.

Shirly is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. She said that she will use it for farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica, age 38, is a rice grower. She is married to Geronimo, and they have four children. They both want their kids to have a proper education, and they work hard to achieve this. Palm trees, which produce palm oil, are planted on some parts of their land. This serves as another source of income for Angelica's family.

Angelica currently needs additional income for her farming business. She applied for a loan of 6000 PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy necessary farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer, which she needs for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita is 47 years old and married to Perpeto. They have four children, and their oldest child is now 22 years old. Perlita began farming in 2005, and she continues to grow rice for a living. Her 1.5-hectare rice field provides income for her family. She wants to double her harvest to increase her income. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP. She wants this loan in order to properly invest in her farm. With this amount, she will be able to purchase quality seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: April

texts.en:
April grows rice for a living. She is 23 years old, married and has three kids. Her oldest child is only 5 years old. She wants her children to have a bright future. She and her husband work hand-in-hand in making the farm productive. When free of farming duties, her husband uses their own motorcycle to transport people around their community. April is thankful for this because it adds income to her household.

April is now requesting to borrow 6,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will definitely be used for farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
48-year-old Creselda married her husband, Ernie, in 1985. They both grew up with farmer parents so they also ventured into the same type of business. They have two children with the oldest aged 23.

According to Creselda, farming builds patience and even though it takes months to see the outcome, she is still thankful because of the income her farm gives her family.

Creselda would like to request Php 6,000 for her loan. She will use it to buy seed and fertilizer and other farm supplies. She chose to be a member of CEVI because of its low interest rate.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is in need of additional capital for his business and that’s why he joined CEVI, a  micro-finance institute in the Philippines. He is 50 years old and married.

Reynaldo is engaged in rice farming. He wants to double his harvest so he applied for a loan of Php 6,000 which he will use to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer.

Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Reynaldo’s farming as he aims to double his harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is 53 years old and has a 15-year-old child. Alfredo started farming several years ago and, although he has been in this business for quite a long time now, he still experiences failure when it comes to harvest. But he treats this as a normal part of farming.

Alfredo is determined to double his harvest so he is able to provide for his family’s needs. He requested a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI which will be used to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies needed on his farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a rice grower. She is 37 years old, married and has four children. Her oldest child is now 18 years old. As a rice grower, she has to keep herself strong and healthy to endure the hard work required on the farm. She and her husband help each other to make their farm productive. When not busy on the farm, Mercy’s husband drives a motorcycle to transport people around their community. It brings income into their household, which Mercy is really thankful for. 

Mercy would like a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farm supplies she is lacking.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jess

texts.en: 40-year-old Jess recently joined CEVI and he is thankful to have gained access to its financial service. He said that his farm could now be properly funded. He is married to Julita and they have four children. Their oldest child is now 15 years old and goes to school. Jess works hard to give his children a proper education. He requested Php 6,000 from CEVI, which he will use to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other necessary farm inputs needed at his farm. He hopes that this loan will make his farm more productive.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jesmarie

texts.en: Jesmarie, 24 years old, is involved in rice farming. She has one child whom she loves taking care of. She started her business in 2005. She used to borrow money from individuals who charge high interest rates. This brought difficulty in maintaining her business and sustaining her family. Now she is a member of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines with only 2% interest rate. Jesmarie likes its program and thinks that it is really helpful to farmers like her. She applied for Php 6,000, which will definitely be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs that her farm needs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is thankful CEVI’s program reached her town. She is a 36-year-old rice grower. She is married and has two children. She joined CEVI to take advantage of its financial service. She likes its program because of the low interest rate. She said that her income would now improve because of her loan from the MFI. She applied for Php 6,000, to be used in buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. Hopefully, this loan will help Marilyn’s income increase.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Delilah

texts.en: Delilah manages a rice farm. She is 56 years old, married and has two children. According to her, farm work is tiring but she still finds happiness knowing she and her husband are together in this. They work hard to make the farm productive. Delilah wants to help improve her family’s living conditions. She applied for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. This loan will be used for acquiring farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ernie

texts.en:
Ernie is a hard-working farmer. He is 45 years old, married, and has five kids. His oldest child is now eighteen years old. Ernie owns a hectare of rice field. He has been tilling it for quite a while now. He finds ways to enjoy working at the farm to keep himself from tiring.

Ernie has been with CEVI for a year now. He said that his first loans were really helpful in his business. He is now requesting to borrow Php 14,000. The loan will be used to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita has children who go to school. She is 54 years old and married. The oldest among her nine children is now 36 years old and does not live at home anymore. Rosita has been involved in rice farming since the 1990s. She has maintained the farm because it provides income for her family. She is also a member of CEVI. Her first loans were used to fund her farm, and, according to her, this was really helpful as it helped her farm to be productive. She is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP. As in the past, this loan will be used to purchase farm supplies lacking from Rosita's farm. She will be able to buy quality seeds and fertilizer with this amount.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita became a member of CEVI in 2008. She said that managing her business has been going pretty good, since she now has a partner in financing. Nenita is 54 years old and married. She has two children. Her 2-hectare rice field is her family's only source of income. Rice crops have already been planted on one hectare. She and her husband are still preparing the other hectare for planting. She needs farm supplies for it. She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP. She will use it to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn, age 44, farms for a living. She is married and has three children who go to school. She works hard to help her family have an income to sustain their needs. She also strives to give her children a proper education. She plants rice crops and makes sure that they grow healthily on her farm. She joined CEVI to assist her business financially. Her previous loans were used to fund her farm. She is now requesting a loan of 14,000 PHP to be used for acquiring necessary farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Alan

texts.en:
Alan wants to provide his family with food to eat, clothes to wear and their other needs. He has been married to his wife, Evelyn, for fourteen years and they now have five children. He is determined to send all his children to school and give them a proper education. He wants all of them to finish college someday.

Alan is a rice farmer in Agusan Del Sur. He also grows chickens to add income to his household. He hopes to expand his rice field so he would have a greater harvest so he applied for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He said that he would use it to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies he needs. He will also buy feed for his chickens.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies plus feed for his chickens

loans.name: Jean Ann

texts.en: Jean is a 26-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has a 5-year-old child. She is involved in rice farming. She and her husband patiently till their farm to earn a living. Jean also acquires fish she sells around in her community. She does it to add income for her family. She currently needs farm inputs to be supplied at the farm. She applied for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer and also fish that she can sell.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en: Carlos, 55 years old, is a rice farmer. He is married and has ten children. Because his family is big, he doubles his efforts in farming. He makes sure to grow his rice crops healthily so he will have an abundant harvest. He wants to double his harvest so his income will also improve. He applied to CEVI and asked to borrow Php 14,000. He will use the loan to acquire farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer. Hopefully, this loan will help Carlos double his harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jou-Ann

texts.en: Jou-ann is a member of CEVI. She is 21 years old, married, and has two children. Her older child is only 2 years old. She chose to be a member of CEVI because of its 2% interest rate. She said that as a farmer, proper financing is necessary. She is thankful she is able to access CEVI’s financial service. She used her previous loans to fund the farm that she tends. She would like now to request Php 14,000. This loan will be used in buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin enjoys having a business, especially since she became a member of CEVI. She said that managing the farm became easier when she found a financial partner. Jasmin is 45 years old, married to Rogelio, and has four children. Like other mothers, she wants her children to finish college. She does her best to be able to support her children’s education. She and her husband carefully till their rice farm. She aims to have an abundant harvest.

Jasmin would like to request a loan of Php 14,000. She will use the loan in buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: 43-year-old Alona is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has eight children that she wants to have a proper education. She is engaged in rice farming. She said, “My parents were farmers and I have also learned to love farming because it does not only benefit my family, but also other families to whom we sell our harvest.” Alona wants to grow her farm. She applied for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She told CEVI that she would use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley, a 48-year-old married woman, farms for a living. She is from Agusan Del Sur and she has seven children. Her oldest is now 26 years old. She grows rice crops. She wants to sell quality rice to other people, so she and her husband make sure the farm is able to grow healthy crops. She says that she currently needs additional funding for their farm. She applied to CEVI for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos. This loan will go for seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies Shirley needs to provide for her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn says she learned the value of savings when she joined CEVI. She is a 44-year-old rice grower from Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has eight children. She has been growing rice for quite a while. The farm provides income for her household. She wants it to grow so her income will improve and her family’s needs will be met. She applied for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI. The loan will go for farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie, 33 years old, grows rice in her hometown. She is married and has four children. Her rice farm is the only source of income her family has. She wants to have an abundant harvest so that all her family’s needs will be met. 

She currently needs inputs at her farm. She requested 12,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use it to buy inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She will also pay the laborers she hired to help till her farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Warlito

texts.en:
Warlito tills 2 hectares of rice field. He has been doing this since he was younger. He is now 33 years old. He keeps himself away from sickness so that he can always attend to the farm he tills. He is always determined to have an abundant harvest. Despite having experienced failure in harvest, he still works hard to achieve what he wants. 

He applied for a loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos from CEVI, a Kiva partner. He said that he would use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. He likes CEVI’s low interest rate.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra Gálvez M. y su esposo han ido construyendo su casa poco a poco; estas personas están agradecidas por el apoyo que les han brindado ya que con préstamos de aquí han podido realizar su proyecto de tener un hogar cómodo para sus hijos, la casa en cada crédito ha ido mejorando como en el primero fue poner losa, luego Vitro piso en una recama y ahora quieren poner Vitro piso en otro cuarto ya que lo utilizara para negocio de ropa usada. 
La señora Gálvez es una de las mujeres emprendedoras que les gusta trabajar y sacar a sus hijos adelante junto con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja en maquiladora para así obtener ingresos y ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Gálvez M. and her husband have been building their home little by little. They are grateful for the support that they have been given with these loans. They have been able to work on a comfortable home for their children. With each loan the home has been improving: for example, with the first loan they put down a stone floor. Then they put a tile floor in a bedroom and now they want to put tile in another room. This room is used for the second-hand clothing business that they have. Mrs. Gálvez is one of the entrepreneurial women who likes to work and help her children get ahead. Together with her husband who works in a tolling factory (maquiladora) they have income to give their children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put flooring in their home

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina Marciales is 60 years old and married to Ronald M.. The couple has an only child, Ronald M., who is a 22-year-old factory worker. She and her husband work hard but they had a very small income and they didn't even have capital to start up a business. 

In 2003, Carolina heard about ASHI, a Kiva partner. She dreamed of having a stable life with a stable house and of starting a business. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, she started her own business of buying and selling small retail goods. It has been many years that she has had this kind of business. Retailing of small goods has been a great help to her family. 

However, the demands of her family grow as years goes by, so she aspires to have more business that can add to her present income so she will have bigger profits and savings. Then she came up with the idea of operating computer rentals. It has been great! She earns a good income and she wants to have more investment in it. On her 11th loan, she is proposing to borrow 40,000.00 Philippine pesos to expand her growing business.

With this kind of business, she can still manage her previous business of retailing small goods, because either her child or husband can operate their computer rental at home when she's away selling goods. Someday, as her income increases, she wants the computer shop separate from their house because the computers are placed in part of their home. Her greatest dreams are to get out from the spiral of poverty and to have a happy life.

loans.use: For the expansion of her computer business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A. is a 42-year-old married mother of three. Her youngest is a 5-year-old and her oldest is a high school student. She and her husband work together buying and selling cell phones in their village and at the market. This couple has been in this business for more than three years now. Her husband also works as a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) driver for extra income to support and sustain the family. Emma also runs a variety store for supplementary profits, and she is a housing loan agent from time to time, because her husband's income is not enough to provide for all the needs of her three children. 

Emma joined ASHI in 2006, aiming to get out of the spiral of poverty and consistently acquire working capital for her business. She will use this loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos to buy a supply of cell phones for resale. She says ASHI-Kiva partners have good hearts for the poor, like her family, and really help them reach their dreams. That is why this couple has grown to love this institution very much.

Emma hopes that one day she will be able to have her own produce stall at the marketplace, instead of selling cell phone products from her house. She wants to be able to make enough money to pay for her children's education. She dreams of the best life for her family, who live together.

loans.use: To buy a supply of cell phones for resale

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
Abraham, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia, es separado pero tiene 5 hijos mayores que se dedican, como él, a la construcción.
Desde muy joven aprendió el oficio de albañil, al principio sólo miraba, pero cuando estuvo seguro no hubo quien lo detenga en el trabajo.  En la actualidad es maestro de obra, es decir que lo contratan para un proyecto de construcción y el lleva a su equipo de albañiles, al cual guía con su experiencia hasta culminar el trabajo. Esta actividad le apasiona, pues tiene mucho trabajo y gana muy bien, además es el oficio que les transmitió a sus hijos, quienes ya formaron sus propias familias y las mantienen con su trabajo en construcción, como lo hizo su padre. 
A pesar de su edad,  Abraham es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante y tiene muchos planes para el futuro, como constituir una empresa de construcción, con su propia movilidad y máquina mezcladora de cemento, así lo contratarían para proyectos mayores y ganaría mucho más dinero.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura será muy puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas para continuar progresando. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un taladro y otras herramientas que le hacen falta y le serán de mucha ayuda para el mejor desempeño de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Abraham, 59, lives in his own home. He is separated but he has 5 grown children who, like him, work in construction. When he was very young he learned the trade of bricklayer. At first he only watched, but when he was sure nothing stopped him from this work. He is currently a construction foreman, that is to say one who hires for a construction project and brings his team of bricklayers, which he leads with his experience until the work is finished. He is passionate about his work, since he has a lot of work and has good earnings. In addition, it is a trade that he passed on to his children, who have already formed their own families and are supporting themselves with their work in construction, like their father did. In spite of his age, Abraham is a man who has a strong desire to get ahead and who has many plans for the future, such as building a construction company with his own vehicle and cement mixer. In this way he would be able to hire for large projects and would earn much more money. This is his third loan with MFP, and he assures us that he will be very punctual with each of his payments, so that he can continue to advance. With the money that he requests he will buy a drill and other tools that he needs that will help him to do his job better.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools for his work

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo, de 36 años, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Delza (25) y su pequeña hija Diana (8), en una zona turística en las afueras de Lima.

Cuando era muy joven aprendió el arte de la joyería, al principio era ayudante en un taller de orfebrería y viendo lo que hacían los maestros del oficio aprendió todas las técnicas. Actualmente y desde hace 20 años se dedica a esta labor pero en su propio negocio, él produce y da forma a las piezas de crisocola (mineral verde azulado) que van incrustadas en las joyas de plata y oro.
Cirilo está muy satisfecho con su labor porque le gusta, ya que es un arte que le ha brindado durante gran parte de su vida el sustento económico. 
Por otro lado, son pocas personas las que saben todo sobre esta actividad, y como él mismo dice: “en este arte se debe ser muy celoso”, por esta razón trabaja sólo con su familia.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP  y está seguro que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que la próxima vez quiere acceder a una cantidad mayor para seguir progresando. Con el dinero que solicita comprará material (crisocola) para cumplir con un gran pedido que tiene pendiente y así espera obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Cirilo is 36 years old and has a strong desire to get ahead in life. He lives in his own home with his wife, Delza, who is 25, and their young daughter, Diana, who is 8 years old, in a tourist location outside of Lima.

When he was very young he learned the art of jewelry making. At the beginning he helped in a gold and silver workshop and by watching the masters of the trade he learned all the techniques. Currently and for the past 20 years he has worked at this job, but in his own business. He produces and gives shape to the pieces of crisocola (and blue-green mineral) that are set in the gold and silver jewelry. Cirilo is very satisfied with his work because he likes it, as it is an art that has provided for him economically throughout most of his life. On the other hand, there are few people who know everything about this trade, and as he himself says: "in this art one must be very cautious," and for this reason he only works with his family.

This is the first loan he has had with MFP and he is certain he will punctually complete each of the loan payments, as he hopes to obtain a larger quantity of money in the future to keep progressing. With the money he asks for he will buy material (crisocola) to finish a large order he currently has and he hopes to increase his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, de 51 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Cruz (52) y de sus 3 hijos; Mayra (18), Melissa (17) y José (14).
Desde muy joven aprendió a manejar autos, es por esta razón desde hace 8 años empezó a dedicarse a movilizar personas brindando el servicio de taxi. Le gusta esta actividad porque la puede realizar en el horario que él convenga, ya que su auto es propio, pero lo que no le agrada es tráfico durante las horas de mayor saturación vehicular. Por otro lado, este oficio le permite interactuar con las personas, lo cual le agrada mucho y no se aburre, además lo considera rentable porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. 
Para el futuro, Cristian quiere instalar una ferretería en su casa y así tener un negocio más tranquilo a diferencia del taxi.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo, es por esta razón que promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Cristian tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en darle mantenimiento a su auto y también empezar a comprar mercadería para su futura ferretería, ya que quiere implementarla lo antes posible. A su vez, piensa vender su auto más adelante para usar el dinero en abastecer mejor su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Cristian is 51 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife, Cruz (52), and their 3 children: Mayra (18), Melissa (17), and José (14). He has been driving cars since he was very young, and for this reason 8 years ago he began working in public transportation by providing taxi service. He likes this job because he can work a schedule that is convenient to him since he has his own car. He does not like traffic during rush hour. On the other hand, this job allows him to interact with people, which is something that greatly pleases him, and he does not get bored. It is also very profitable because the money he earns allows him to provide a better quality of life for his family. In the future, Cristian wants to start a hardware shop in his home in order to have a calmer business than driving the taxi.

This is the third loan he has had with MFP, and he does not want to let his other group members down, and so he promises to be punctual in his loan payments. Cristian plans to invest the requested money in car maintenance and also to begin to buy merchandise for his future hardware store, as he wants to start it as soon as possible. He is also planning to sell his car someday to use that money to better stock his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance and investing in a new business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores, D. 64 años, vive feliz en su casa propia en compañía D. su madre, su hijo Javier, su nuera y su pequeña nieta.
Anteriormente tenía un restaurante donD. preparaba y vendía diversas comidas, pero tuvo problemas D. salud y decidió cambiar el rubro D. su negocio. Es así que desD. hace 2 meses empezó a vender muebles D. madera; como estantes, vitrinas, camas, etc., ya que  la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial y además este negocio no le demanda mucho esfuerzo que pueda poner en peligro su salud. Aunque Dolores extraña su restaurante, sabe que su nuevo negocio también les es muy rentable, a pesar D. su avanzada edad tiene un espíritu joven por lo que planea seguir progresando en su negocio ofreciendo mayor diversidad y cantidad D. muebles.

Este es el 8vo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable en el pago D. sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal ni con la institución, ni con sus compañeros D. grupo. Dolores tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. colchones para empezar a venderlos junto con sus muebles, así implementará mejor su negocio y obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores is 64 years old and happily lives in her own home in the company of her mother, her son, Javier, her daughter-in-law, and her young granddaughter. She previously had a restaurant where she prepared and sold a variety of foods, but she had health problems and decided to switch to a new business. Two months ago she began selling wood furniture like shelves, cabinets, beds, etc. since the zone where she lives is very commercialized and this business does not require a lot of exertion and she does not put her health in danger. Even though Dolores misses her restaurant, she knows that her new business is also profitable. In spite of her advanced age she has a young spirit and she plans to continue progressing in her business offering a greater diversity and quantity of furniture.

This is the eighth loan she has had with MFP and she promises to be responsible in her loan payments, since she does not want the bank nor her group members to look poorly upon her. Dolores plans to invest her loan money in buying mattresses to begin selling them with her furniture. This will improve her business and help her obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina vive muy feliz al lado de su hijo Fidel (34), su nuera y su pequeño nieto. La casa que habitan es suya y es propia.
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y cervezas en su pequeña tienda ubicada  en su misma vivienda. Ella atiende el negocio sola, ya que su hijo y su nuera trabajan; pero no se queja, por el contrario le agrada mucho trabajar en la tranquilidad de su casa y así generar su propio dinero. Durante todo el día permanece atendiendo su tienda y conversando con sus clientes, quienes son sus vecinos de toda la vida. Por otro lado, desde hace 2 años, esta emprendedora mujer también se dedica a la venta de productos energizantes de una  reconocida marca y a su vez capta otras vendedoras por lo que recibe un dinero extra.
Ambas actividades le agradan, ya que se considera una vendedora innata, por lo que para el futuro tiene muchos planes, como mejorar el ambiente de su tienda y ampliarlo para vender mayor cantidad de mercadería.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que será muy puntual en los pagos de sus cuotas, ya que quiere seguir obteniendo más préstamos en el futuro. Joaquina tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de bebidas, ya que por la temporada de verano sabe que tendrá mayor demanda; pero también comprará otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Joaquina lives very happily with her son Fidel (34), her daughter-in-law, and her small grandson. The house that they live in belongs to her. For 2 years she has sold food and beer from her small store located in her home. She attends to the store herself, since her son and daughter-in-law work, but she does not complain. On the contrary, she likes to work in the tranquility of her home, and in this way she has her own income. During the whole day she stays in the store attending to her customers and chatting with them; they have been her neighbors all of her life. In addition, for 2 years this enterprising woman has also sold energy drinks from a well-known brand, and in turn recruits other sellers, for which she receives extra money. Both activities please her, as she considers herself to be a born saleswoman. In the future she has many plans, such as improving the environment of her store and expanding it so that she can sell a greater variety of merchandise. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she assures us that she will be very punctual with her payments, since she wants to continue taking loans in the future. Joaquina will use the money that she requests to buy a greater quantity of drinks, since in the summer season she knows that she will have a greater demand. She will also buy other products to restock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy drinks and other items for her store)

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus padres y hermanos. Aunque aún no se ha casado tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Desde hace 20 años, en sociedad con su hermana, tiene una tienda de comestibles en su vivienda donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad. Durante el día es ella quien atiende la bodega, mientras él está en su trabajo como técnico en estadística en un centro médico de su localidad. Por ende, cuando llega a su casa, por la tarde, se dedica a la atención de su tienda, de esta forma ambos comparten el trabajo y las ganancias.
Ambas actividades le gustan mucho, ya que se entretiene y puede solventar sus gastos sin problemas, y como él es un hombre muy emprendedor para el futuro quiere tener su propio negocio e instalar un restaurante donde pueda ofrecer diversidad de platos típicos del Perú.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere fallarles a las integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda para obtener mayores ganancias y empezar a ahorrar para su futuro restaurante.
texts.en:
Jorge. 48 years old, lives in his own home, near his parents and siblings. Although he has never married he is looking forward to getting ahead in life. For the past 20 years, in a partnership with his sister, he has owned a grocery store in his home where he sells all sorts of basic items. During the day she is the one who attends to the store, while he is in his day job as a statistics technician in a local medical center. When he gets home in the afternoon he looks after the store. This way they both share the work and the earnings. He likes both activities very much, because they keep him entertained and he can meet his expenses without trouble. As he is a very enterprising man, in the future he wants to own his own business, setting up a restaurant where he can serve a variety of Peruvian local dishes. This is his second loan with MFP and he is committed to paying back the loan in a timely manner, because he doesn't want to let the other members of his Communal Bank down. With the money he asks for he will purchase merchandise to stock up his store, obtain better earnings and start saving for his future restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus padres y sus 3 hijos; Vladimir (24), José (21) y Jair (19).
Desde hace 3 años se inició en la venta de productos de belleza, esta actividad la realiza junto a una amiga, y como tiene poder de convencimiento puede obtener buenas ganancias debido a sus altas ventas. A luz le gusta recomendar los tonos de maquillaje a sus asiduas clientes, además es una labor tranquila, pues ofrece los productos mediante un catalogo y posteriormente reparte los pedidos y hace la cobranzas. Por tal motivo, piensa continuar en el negocio, ya que no tiene mayores dificultades al hacerlo y le permite no descuidar la crianza de sus hijos. 
Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora y quiere salir adelante, tiene planeado para el futuro instalar una tienda en su vivienda y ahí mismo ofrecer sus productos de belleza.

Este es el 8vo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy responsable en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con los integrantes de su grupo. Luz tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de nuevos productos de belleza, para así tener en stock y ofrecerlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old. She lives in her own home with her parents and her three children: Vladimir (24), Jose (21) and Jair (19). Three years ago she started selling beauty products. She does this activity together with a friend. Since she has the power of persuasion, she is able to make good profits due to her high sales. Luz likes to recommend the makeup tones to her regular customers. In addition, it is a calm business. She offers the products through a catalog and later delivers the orders and collects the money. For this reason, she is planning to continue in this business, since she has had no major problems with it and it allows her to raise her children. Since she is a very hard working woman and wants to get ahead, she plans to have a store in her house in the future and offer her beauty products. This is the 8th loan that she has had with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with making her payments since she wants to do right by the other members of the group. Luz is planning on investing the money she is asking for in the purchase of new beauty products in order to have them in stock and offer them at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Сафаров Муродали проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Сафаров Муродали в области животноводства работает более 6 лет. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Сафаров Муродали хочет увеличить количество скота. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Murodali S. lives in the Yavan region. He is 30 years old; married with 5 children. Murodali has worked in cattle breeding for over 6 years. He fattens up and sells cattle. Murodali would like to increase the size of his livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 50 años vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Gladys (40) y de sus tres hijos; Robert (22), Karen (18) y Jurgen (7).
Desde hace 7 años se dedica al transporte de carga pesada, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo realiza durante los días útiles de la semana y descansa todo el fin de semana, también le agrada  mucho manejar y apreciar los hermosos paisajes naturales que ofrece cada rincón del Perú.
A pesar que sus ganancias las comparte con la empresa dueña del camión que maneja, el dinero que obtiene le alcanza para darle buena calidad de vida a su familia.
Pero Roberto tiene aun muchos sueños por cumplir y ya ha empezado a ahorrar para comprarse un auto propio y empezar a trabajar como taxista, pues así obtendría mayores ganancias.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchos planes de seguir de progreso a base de estos créditos. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará el monto que necesita para comprar su propio auto, y también le hará algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto, 50, lives in his own house with his wife, Gladys (40), and his three children. Robert is 22, Karen is 18, and Jurgen is 7. For seven years he has been working in heavy transport. He likes his work a lot because he works week days and rests the entire week end. Also, he really likes to drive and appreciate the beautiful natural scenery that can be found in every corner of Perú. In spite of the fact that he shares his earnings with the business that owns the truck he drives, the money that he gets suffices to give his family a good quality of life. But, Roberto still has many dreams to fulfill. He has started saving to buy his own car to start working as a taxi driver. That way he would get greater earnings. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to make all of his payments punctually. He has a lot of plans to keep progressing, and they are based on the loans. He will use the money he is requesting to increase the amount he has been saving towards buying his own car. He will also make some improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his next business and improve his house

loans.name: Iponi

texts.en:
Iponi A. is currently in the business of selling used clothes in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase new shoes and bedsheets to sell. Iponi is 40 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase new shoes and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni B. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol beverages. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell. Poni is 35 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more materials to use to make more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Isela

texts.en:
Isela J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell.  Isela is 30 years old and divorced. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khudoyberdi

texts.ru: Нурхонов Худойберди проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Нурхонов Худойберди животноводством занимается более 7 лет. Он одновременно работает страителем. За уходом скота ему помогают его сыновья. Кредит берет для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Khudoyberdi N. lives in the Yavan region. He is 50 years old; married with 8 children. Khudoyberdi has been breeding cattle for over 7 years. He also works as a construction worker. His sons help him take care of the livestock. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en:
Rejina L. is currently in the business of selling mobile phones in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more mobile phones and airtime to sell.  Rejina is 25 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more mobile phones and airtime to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D. is currently in the business of selling milk in a shop and is requesting a loan to stock more jerrycans of milk to sell.  Marcelina is 42 years old and is widowed. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bakery.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more jerrycans of milk to sell.

loans.name: Boykul

texts.ru: Оманов Бойкул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 55 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Оманов Бойкул в области животноводства более 4 лет. Он разводит животных в своем собственном доме. Оманов Бойкул одновременно занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Boykul O. lives in the Yavan region. He is 55 years old; married with 6 children. Boykul has been breeding cattle for over 4 years. He breeds the animals at home. Boykul also cultivates plants. He is requesting the loan to purchase cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret M. is currently in the business of selling fruits and vegetables in the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell.  Margret is 45 years old and is widowed. She has four children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 29 years old, married, and has a six-year-old child who is in school. Peace rents a one-roomed house where she lives with five people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. At home, she has access to electricity but no piped water. The family has three meals a day. Peace's biggest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, and medication.
Peace owns a kiosk in Bwaise selling all types of soft drinks, such as soda water, and passion fruits. She sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 30 customers a day. Peace has been in this business for over ten years, and her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Peace has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for four years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruits and sugar. She hopes to see her business grow, own a fully-stocked kiosk, and open another branch in Kawempe. .

loans.use: To buy more soda, mineral water, passion fruits and sugar

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa A. is 50 years old and married to a policeman. She has six school-aged children. Elisa is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava) at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: N. Betty is a 42-year-old businesswoman who has owned and run a salon for the last ten years. She is requesting a loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair food, hair relaxers, combs, and so forth to boost her salon. Her hope is to attract more customers into her business so that she can generate more profit to boost and expand her salon. Her future plan is to see her business develop to a very high level.

loans.use: To purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair food, hair relaxers, combs, etc.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is 38 years of age, married, and has five children aged between six and eighteen years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family owns a five-roomed house where Cissy lives with eight people. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication, and feeding the family.
Cissy operates a bar in Nabweru Bwaise selling all types of drinks, such as soda water and passion fruit, and beer. She sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Cissy has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for four years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and beer, boxes of mineral water, passion fruits and sugar. She hopes to see her business grow, own a fully stocked bar, and open up another branch in Kawempe.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, beer, and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Mirzokul

texts.ru: Сармисов Мирзокул проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сармисов Мирзокул торгует более 13 лет. Он продает курут. Сармисов Мирзокул хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Mirzokul S. lives in the Vose region. He is 39 years old; married with 4 children. Mirzokul has been a vendor for over 13 years. He sells kurut. Mirzokul would like to diversify his wares. He is requesting the loan to increase his sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales turnover

loans.name: Stama

texts.en:
Stama M. is 32 years old and married to a clerk. She has five school-aged children. Stama is currently in the business of selling posho and beans in a wholesale shop, and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and posho to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Stama hopes to be able to build rooms for renting.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of beans and posho to sell

loans.name: Kumrigul

texts.ru: Кавоева Кумригул проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Кавоева Кумригул торговлей занимается более 5 лет. Она торгует в своем собственном магазине. Кавоева Кумригул покупает и продает продукты. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Kumrigul K. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 53 years old; married with 4 children. Kumrigul has been a vendor for over 5 years. She has her own store. Kumrigul buys and sells goods. She is requesting the loan to increase her sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Melyakova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase sales turnover

loans.name: Ismailova Habibahon` Group

texts.en:
Habibahon, 51, is the leader of this group. She is married and has two married children. Her husband works as a vet in a rural district, her son is a taxi driver, and her daughter is a housewife.
Habibahon is a farm worker who also owns some livestock. She has been in this business since the early 1990s. She started it after the collapse of the Soviet Union, when most government agricultural land was privatized. At the present time, her seasonal income from farming exceeds $1500 USD. Habibahon usually spends all her income in covering family expenses. Her business earnings have meant that her family could marry both children, build a house for her son, and increase the number of livestock. In the near future, Habibahon is planning to open a food market near her house. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance, and it will be used to buy potato seeds and 300 kilos of mineral fertilizers.
Hojiumar, 49, is a father of two married children. He is a farmer, and will use his loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. Hojiumar has a dream of building a pharmacy and barber shop in the village center because the local population has to go to the district center to buy drugs.
Adinahon, 41, is also a farmer. Her family has a total of 0.47 hectare of land. She cultivates potatoes and wheat there. She is requesting a loan to prepare for the spring sowing by plowing and buying potato seeds. Adinahon is married with two children. Her husband works in a cotton plant, and all her family members take an active role in the family business.
Gaznahan is 47 years old. She is a widow with four children, the eldest two of whom are married. The other two children are students. Gaznahan will use her loan to buy 500 kilos of potato seeds and 100 kilos of fertilizer. In the future, Gaznahan hopes that she will be able to build a house for her second son. For her, the most important thing is the happiness of her children.

About Mol Bulak Finance
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and 300 kilos of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Salama 1 Ndagire Agnes Group

texts.en: N. Agnes is a 40-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school. She also has three dependents, who are in school too. She is the representative for this loan group. Agnes has owned a carpentry business for over two years. She is using her loan to purchase timber for her workshop business. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to work hard, educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase timber for her workshop business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 40 years of age, married, and has five children aged between six and eighteen years, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family own a five-roomed house where Juliet lives with eight people. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication, and feeding the family.
Juliet owns a stall selling bananas and tomatoes in Mengo Mackay. She sells both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Juliet has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and tomatoes. She hopes to see her business grow and start buying directly from farmers.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas and boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Medius Kankuze's Group

texts.en:
Medius is 51 years old, single, and the mother of five children aged between ten and twenty. All her children go to school. The family owns a five-roomed house where Medius lives with eight people. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her biggest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication and feeding the family.
Medius owns a retail shop selling all types of merchandise. She sells on a retail basis only. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Medius has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise for her retail shop. She hopes to see her business grow, and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise such as soap, sugar and salt

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru: Фатоев Далер проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, не имеет детей. Фатоев Далер торговлей занимается более 4 лет. Он продает продукты питания в собственном магазине. Фатоев Далер старается увеличить ассортимент товара для привлечения клиентов. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Daler F. lives close to Vahdat, Tajikistan. He is twenty-six years old and married with no children. Daler F. has been in sales for over four years. He sells groceries in his own store. Daler is trying to offer a wider variety of goods to attract more clients. He is asking for a loan to increase his sales volume.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old, widowed, and has five children aged between ten and twenty, all of whom go to school. The family rents a one-roomed house where Margaret lives with eight people. She also takes care of additional family members. She has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family eats three meals a day. Her biggest monthly expenses are utility bills, school fees, medication and feeding the family.
Margaret owns a stall selling second-hand clothes. She sells on a retail basis only. She works seven days a week and serves an average of 40 customers a day. She has been in this business for over ten years. Her main challenges are seasonal changes and the rainy season because she works from a muddy place.
Margaret has been with Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, for three years and is now on her seventh loan. She has always worked with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She hopes to see her business grow, and start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothing
